commit_message:
Deprecate not providing resource_class (again)

It is not going to be compatible with the proposed allocation API,
because the API will have to be compatible with Placement, which
requires resource class.

Change-Id: Ib288e7f933f421d6ff756e6bc4877fd344515c74
Story: #2004341
Task: #28027

commit_message:
Add 'inspect_ports' as a 'driver_info' parameter to iLO drivers

This spec add support that allows user to pass 'inspect_ports'
as a parameter for out-of-band inspection which creates the
specific ports passed by the user.

Change-Id: I1f93bef2f63c8900aa27008591ba6a337d5076ae

commit_message:
Set `TraceEnable` directive for apache to 'Off'

Openstack service don't support TRACE requests, so there is little
point allowing TRACE for apache.

Change-Id: I396a4c3bfab8f353d038b011d5dc8029f4137a57
Closes-Bug: #1801298

commit_message:
Deprecate check_revocations_for_cached option

check_revocations_for_cached is deprecated for removel because of PKI
token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: Iee468fee8af19ff317d3d536cb1c6f2469538061
Closes-Bug: #1804562

Change-Id: I0b12be1e9844905e1ac3e7866930b3fe9871e48e
"}, {'created': '2018-11-04 01:47:21.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I0b12be1e9844905e1ac3e7866930b3fe9871e48e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I0b12be1e9844905e1ac3e7866930b3fe9871e48e

commit_message:
Switch to new engine facade in neutron/db/agents_db.py

This patch changed the old engine facade to new engine
fade in neutron/db/agents_db.py.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-03 08:43:44.000000000', 'message': 'Support cpuset and scheduler for cpuset

This patch improves the numa objects, mem_available and mem_total are added.

This patch adds a parameter which named "cpu_policy" for Zun API to tag the mode of container.

This patch adds methods of node resource management for numa.

This patch also introduces a filter for cpuset.

Change-Id: Ia71ea7bd59644a61e48e8f26fada51f0b02b94e9
Implements: blueprint cpuset-container
'}]
commit_message:
Support cpuset and scheduler for cpuset

This patch improves the numa objects, mem_available and mem_total are added.

This patch adds a parameter which named "cpu_policy" for Zun API to tag the mode of container.

This patch adds methods of node resource management for numa.

This patch also introduces a filter for cpuset.

Change-Id: Ia71ea7bd59644a61e48e8f26fada51f0b02b94e9
Implements: blueprint cpuset-container

[{'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-19 10:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-19 10:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-19 10:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:20:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-21 06:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-21 08:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-11-21 18:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Do we need to wait for someone to sync these projects into storyboard?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-21 18:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Frank, do these use launchpad currently and is there an easy way to look for them?'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Frank, do these use launchpad currently and is there an easy way to
 > look for them?

both are part of openstack-manuals (https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals).
There are some bugs raised, but these bugs are very old due the fact that the docs were supended over a year and nobody worked on it. I think a migration makes no sense. I would review Launchpad bugs and open new tasks in Storyboard manually.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-22 05:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-20 09:50:44.000000000', 'message': "add status field to the instance notifications

The instance has a calcuated status field returned from the REST API.
But the instance notifications only contains vm_state (called state),
task_state and power_state for an instance but not the calculated
status value. This patch adds the status field to the notifications as
well so that Searchlight doesn't need to duplicate the calculation.

Change-Id: I16ea07b6fa7f137893309ee591d18af8e82c9508
"}]
commit_message:
add status field to the instance notifications

The instance has a calcuated status field returned from the REST API.
But the instance notifications only contains vm_state (called state),
task_state and power_state for an instance but not the calculated
status value. This patch adds the status field to the notifications as
well so that Searchlight doesn't need to duplicate the calculation.

Change-Id: I16ea07b6fa7f137893309ee591d18af8e82c9508

commit_message:
docs: Use sphinx-apidoc library for autodoc generation

This package is used for automatic generation of autodoc
documentation which offers the following advantages:

* the Patrole framework for all modules is always built
  and kept up to date
* it is isolated in its own page layout
* it can still be linked to by other documentation pages
  easily

Change-Id: I101557efe47293f88ee65b99275fdc8424c02e35

commit_message:
Get rid of dependency on dpath

dpath isn't in the OpenStack global requirements list, so it's one of
the things breaking the requirements job. Furthermore, it's only used on
one line, to avoid some trivial Python code. Just get rid of it.

Change-Id: I4d284894e48a20c60f9c57e0d2c0696dc348fb0b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/604386

subject: Remove the check.yml for baremetal
messages:
[{'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-06-14 06:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-14 06:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

while doing kolla-ansible check, the command will issue a -e action=check.
In all roles we have in main.yml - include: "{{ action }}.yml"

If any role does not have the check file, check command will fail due file is not found while trying to load it'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-06-14 07:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> while doing kolla-ansible check, the command will issue a -e
 > action=check.
 > In all roles we have in main.yml - include: "{{ action }}.yml"
 > 
 > If any role does not have the check file, check command will fail
 > due file is not found while trying to load it

Agree, please this one'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-06-14 07:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/aodh/tasks/main.yml#L2'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-06-14 07:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> while doing kolla-ansible check, the command will issue a -e
 > action=check.
 > In all roles we have in main.yml - include: "{{ action }}.yml"
 > 
 > If any role does not have the check file, check command will fail
 > due file is not found while trying to load it

the baremetal can't support ``kolla-ansible check`` command  because the role does't exists in site.yml [0][3], and kolla-ansible will use site.yml.
only run bootstrap-servers will run baremetal[1][2]

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/site.yml
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/kolla-host.yml
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/tools/kolla-ansible#L266
[3]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/tools/kolla-ansible#L116'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-06-14 07:44:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/aodh/tasks/main.yml#L2

so the check.yml of baremetal will never be used, remove it is safe'}, {'account_id': 21691, 'date': '2018-10-02 02:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

agree with Eduardo and Sfurya, the changed is no needed'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

ditto'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-11-22 00:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-11-22 00:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 06:15:28.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the check.yml for baremetal

when run ``kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers`` command to bootstrap
servers, it will invoke the baremetal role, and the kolla_action
always be the bootstrap-servers, so the check.yml is unused, this
ps to remove.

Change-Id: I262f553735d7191f2cbdb170c795c68bd202ca0f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the check.yml for baremetal

when run ``kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers`` command to bootstrap
servers, it will invoke the baremetal role, and the kolla_action
always be the bootstrap-servers, so the check.yml is unused, this
ps to remove.

Change-Id: I262f553735d7191f2cbdb170c795c68bd202ca0f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 13:01:00.000000000', 'message': "Handle HostMappingNotFound when deleting a compute service

If the compute service we're deleting has never been
discovered (mapped to a cell using discover_hosts) or the
host mapping was already deleted, we need to handle the
HostMappingNotFound error when deleting a compute service
so that we (1) don't 500 out of the API and (2) continue to
delete the compute service.

Change-Id: I0d7644db3537a67b94e75972b3c4fce25a623763
Closes-Bug: #1780727
(cherry picked from commit ee6e0c1e7eb861e56915c5b6c60a214b75240366)
(cherry picked from commit 0be8cbc302aa77b312e031f6a7a419e83afd6e3b)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle HostMappingNotFound when deleting a compute service

If the compute service we're deleting has never been
discovered (mapped to a cell using discover_hosts) or the
host mapping was already deleted, we need to handle the
HostMappingNotFound error when deleting a compute service
so that we (1) don't 500 out of the API and (2) continue to
delete the compute service.

Change-Id: I0d7644db3537a67b94e75972b3c4fce25a623763
Closes-Bug: #1780727
(cherry picked from commit ee6e0c1e7eb861e56915c5b6c60a214b75240366)
(cherry picked from commit 0be8cbc302aa77b312e031f6a7a419e83afd6e3b)

LGTM. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-11-21 03:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Hmm, could it be even better if we can identify that the call is a multi-create request, uses the long timeout. If it is a sigle create, then use shorter timeout for quicker response.'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-11-21 07:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-21 13:53:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Hmm, could it be even better if we can identify that the call is a multi-create request, uses the long timeout. If it is a sigle create, then use shorter timeout for quicker response.

I don't think that really matters. If the scheduler service is dead, we'll get a MessagingTimeout regardless of which timeout we use. The long_rpc_timeout will heartbeat the service every 60 seconds and only finally timeout after 30 minutes (by default), which is fine. If you do a single server create request but have 10K computes to filter through, it could take awhile as well."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-11-21 15:54:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Hmm, could it be even better if we can identify that the call is
 > a multi-create request, uses the long timeout. If it is a sigle
 > create, then use shorter timeout for quicker response.
 > 
 > I don't think that really matters. If the scheduler service is
 > dead, we'll get a MessagingTimeout regardless of which timeout we
 > use. The long_rpc_timeout will heartbeat the service every 60
 > seconds and only finally timeout after 30 minutes (by default),
 > which is fine. If you do a single server create request but have
 > 10K computes to filter through, it could take awhile as well.

Yeah, the response time isn't any different with this if the service is up. We heartbeat every 30s, and timeout if we make it to 60s with no heartbeats coming back. That means 60s to find out the other side isn't alive, which is the same as the regular RPC call timeouts.

To contradict your assertion about the single case, if we're overwhelming the scheduler with a ton of new boots, the regular RPC process may send a bunch of requests, which the scheduler _will_ eventually process, even though the callers have long since given up. Basically, making the scheduler do extra work for no gain. If the user just keeps booting things to make up for the failures, then the total load on the scheduler goes up with the regular RPC process, but not with this one because the callers actually wait for the thing they've asked the scheduler to do, and only time out if the scheduler actually dies."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-11-21 22:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

LGTM, good improvement.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 23:07:46.000000000', 'message': 'Use long_rpc_timeout in select_destinations RPC call

Conductor RPC calls the scheduler to get hosts during
server create, which in a multi-create request with a
lot of servers and the default rpc_response_timeout, can
trigger a MessagingTimeout. Due to the old
retry_select_destinations decorator, conductor will retry
the select_destinations RPC call up to max_attempts times,
so thrice by default. This can clobber the scheduler and
placement while the initial scheduler worker is still
trying to process the beefy request and allocate resources
in placement.

This has been recreated in a devstack test patch [1] and
shown to fail with 1000 instances in a single request with
the default rpc_response_timeout of 60 seconds. Changing the
rpc_response_timeout to 300 avoids the MessagingTimeout and
retry loop.

Since Rocky we have the long_rpc_timeout config option which
defaults to 1800 seconds. The RPC client can thus be changed
to heartbeat the scheduler service during the RPC call every
$rpc_response_timeout seconds with a hard timeout of
$long_rpc_timeout. That change is made here.

As a result, the problematic retry_select_destinations
decorator is also no longer necessary and removed here. That
decorator was added in I2b891bf6d0a3d8f45fd98ca54a665ae78eab78b3
and was a hack for scheduler high availability where a
MessagingTimeout was assumed to be a result of the scheduler
service dying so retrying the request was reasonable to hit
another scheduler worker, but is clearly not sufficient
in the large multi-create case, and long_rpc_timeout is a
better fit for that HA type scenario to heartbeat the scheduler
service.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/507918/

Change-Id: I87d89967bbc5fbf59cf44d9a63eb6e9d477ac1f3
Closes-Bug: #1795992

commit_message:
Use long_rpc_timeout in select_destinations RPC call

Conductor RPC calls the scheduler to get hosts during
server create, which in a multi-create request with a
lot of servers and the default rpc_response_timeout, can
trigger a MessagingTimeout. Due to the old
retry_select_destinations decorator, conductor will retry
the select_destinations RPC call up to max_attempts times,
so thrice by default. This can clobber the scheduler and
placement while the initial scheduler worker is still
trying to process the beefy request and allocate resources
in placement.

This has been recreated in a devstack test patch [1] and
shown to fail with 1000 instances in a single request with
the default rpc_response_timeout of 60 seconds. Changing the
rpc_response_timeout to 300 avoids the MessagingTimeout and
retry loop.

Since Rocky we have the long_rpc_timeout config option which
defaults to 1800 seconds. The RPC client can thus be changed
to heartbeat the scheduler service during the RPC call every
$rpc_response_timeout seconds with a hard timeout of
$long_rpc_timeout. That change is made here.

As a result, the problematic retry_select_destinations
decorator is also no longer necessary and removed here. That
decorator was added in I2b891bf6d0a3d8f45fd98ca54a665ae78eab78b3
and was a hack for scheduler high availability where a
MessagingTimeout was assumed to be a result of the scheduler
service dying so retrying the request was reasonable to hit
another scheduler worker, but is clearly not sufficient
in the large multi-create case, and long_rpc_timeout is a
better fit for that HA type scenario to heartbeat the scheduler
service.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/507918/

Change-Id: I87d89967bbc5fbf59cf44d9a63eb6e9d477ac1f3
Closes-Bug: #1795992

commit_message:
Change to use iproute2 instead of brctl

brctl is being deprecated in some Linux distros, so
change neutron to start using iproute2 commands or
the pyroute2 library where possible.

Added create() to IpLinkCommand class to allow usage
of pyroute2 for bridge creation.

Change-Id: If679e79fa3242ee1cd8610b5525deca35b41c87e
Closes-bug: #1801919

commit_message:
Validate omission of expected_error_codes defaults to 403

Add a test that checks that the omission of expected_error_codes
defaults to [403] * len(rules). This helps to validate the recent
change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/592935/

Change-Id: I0faa89ab22ab6f811c3d927f76cfb20c2d63012a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 05:42:34.000000000', 'message': 'trivial: Fix irrelevant-files regexes for unit tests

This is to fix the regexes for unit tests in irrelevant-files
in .zuul.yaml to avoid unnecessarily running unit tests. Currently
the regex includes "patrole/" which is incorrect as the "root"
should be the topmost patrole package in the project's repo
which is "patrole_tempest_plugin".

.. https://github.com/openstack/patrole

Change-Id: I16c91b378d23e0c917f2cf5975f9c0f8fa33c620
'}]
commit_message:
trivial: Fix irrelevant-files regexes for unit tests

This is to fix the regexes for unit tests in irrelevant-files
in .zuul.yaml to avoid unnecessarily running unit tests. Currently
the regex includes "patrole/" which is incorrect as the "root"
should be the topmost patrole package in the project's repo
which is "patrole_tempest_plugin".

.. https://github.com/openstack/patrole

Change-Id: I16c91b378d23e0c917f2cf5975f9c0f8fa33c620

[{'created': '2018-11-08 15:12:01.000000000', 'message': 'Make supports_direct_io work on 4096b sector size

The current check uses an alignment of 512 bytes and will fail when the
underlying device has sectors of size 4096 bytes, as is common e.g. for
NVMe disks. So use an alignment of 4096 bytes, which is a multiple of
512 bytes and thus will cover both cases.

Closes-Bug: 1801702
Co-Authored-By: Alexandre Arents <alexandre.arents@corp.ovh.com>

commit_message:
Make supports_direct_io work on 4096b sector size

The current check uses an alignment of 512 bytes and will fail when the
underlying device has sectors of size 4096 bytes, as is common e.g. for
NVMe disks. So use an alignment of 4096 bytes, which is a multiple of
512 bytes and thus will cover both cases.

Change-Id: I5151ae01e90506747860d9780547b0d4ce91d8bc
Closes-Bug: 1801702
Co-Authored-By: Alexandre Arents <alexandre.arents@corp.ovh.com>

[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-10-16 21:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ocata: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-pike: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1763070

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-17 02:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is this bug related at all to: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1610994

It appears as if its history is:

1) Apply skip decorator as a workaround
2) Remove decorator
3) <maybe additional history here>
4) Real bug fix?

In which case may we add a Closes-Bug tag to commit message?'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-10-17 09:18:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Is this bug related at all to: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1610994
 > 
 > It appears as if its history is:
 > 
 > 1) Apply skip decorator as a workaround
 > 2) Remove decorator
 > 3) <maybe additional history here>
 > 4) Real bug fix?
 > 
 > In which case may we add a Closes-Bug tag to commit message?

Thanks Felipe for the pointers here.

So, I took a look at the bug ticket and the related maillist thread but it doesn't seem directly related to this problem I am having when I run this test against an OVN cloud.

The reason it fails for OVN is due to how some service ports (in this case DHCP) is implemented. And that makes me question whether we should be asserting that as well. The test is about testing connectivity between two VMs on different networks, which is great! But, asserting that you can ping the DHCP port that lives in a different network sounds a bit out of scope IMHO. And not very backend agnostic.

I'll go ahead and open a bug for this specific problem and link it to this patch.

Thanks for the links and history there, it's helpful to understand what was done before.

Cheers,
Lucas"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:13:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Let me know what you think... Perhaps we can change it in a way that the first step checking an internal port it'll ping the gateway (but we need to attach the network to the router first). I think it's ok to assume that the gateway responds to pings... :?"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:15:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Let me know what you think... Perhaps we can change it in a way
 > that the first step checking an internal port it'll ping the
 > gateway (but we need to attach the network to the router first). I
 > think it's ok to assume that the gateway responds to pings... :?

sorry not gateway but the router interface IP address for that subnet."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-17 11:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

I get your point but from the patch looks like we're saying "we don't want to rely on pinging DHCP service but only if the service is on different network". 
Otherwise, are we fine with pinging it from inside the same net?'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-10-17 12:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > I get your point but from the patch looks like we're saying "we
 > don't want to rely on pinging DHCP service but only if the service
 > is on different network".
 > Otherwise, are we fine with pinging it from inside the same net?

That's what the patch proposes, to not try to ping the services ports from different networks.

It doesn't seem to me that relying on pinging such ports from the same network is a problem given that the method that checks it is widely used in many places (not only in the test_connectivity_between_vms_on_different_networks test)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-10-17 12:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 16:05:08.000000000', 'message': 'Make connectivity test less backend dependent

The test_connectivity_between_vms_on_different_networks should assert
connectivity between different VMS on different networks but the test is
also asserting that one VM can ping the services port (such as DHCP)
running on the other network and that may not be the case for all
backends.

OVN for example uses a "localport" type to implement a
DHCP port. That port type in OVN does not allow traffic
outside the network it belongs to [0] which is causing the test
test_connectivity_between_vms_on_different_networks to fail when used
with networking-ovn.

This patch is adding a new parameter to the
_check_network_internal_connectivity() method called "ping_dhcp_port"
(True by default). If set to False the method will not attempt to ping
the internal ip of the DHCP port.

In the case of test_connectivity_between_vms_on_different_networks test,
this patch is disabling pinging the DHCP port (using the new
"ping_dhcp_port" parameter) when it attempts to ping the VM and services
from VM1 to VM2 (which lives on different networks).

[0]
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/d9677a1f0eaf6352c44af3ba3a4c2faf76a2a39b/ovn/controller/physical.c#L1176-L1182

Change-Id: Ia4a6ee65d3d737f8452b4aed9bf4624455a3b050

commit_message:
Make connectivity test less backend dependent

The test_connectivity_between_vms_on_different_networks should assert
connectivity between different VMS on different networks but the test is
also asserting that one VM can ping the services port (such as DHCP)
running on the other network and that may not be the case for all
backends.

OVN for example uses a "localport" type to implement a
DHCP port. That port type in OVN does not allow traffic
outside the network it belongs to [0] which is causing the test
test_connectivity_between_vms_on_different_networks to fail when used
with networking-ovn.

This patch is modifying the test to only ping the relevant ports when
asserting that the VMs have connectivity with each other.

[0]
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/d9677a1f0eaf6352c44af3ba3a4c2faf76a2a39b/ovn/controller/physical.c#L1176-L1182

Closes-Bug: #1798317
Change-Id: Ia4a6ee65d3d737f8452b4aed9bf4624455a3b050

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 21:24:38.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify middleware public methods

In Django 1.10 the new middleware interface was introduced [1].
process_request and process_response are no longer part of the interface.
On the other hand, process_exception is the part of the interface.

To clarify that we are using the new middleware interface,
it looks better to rename the methods in the old interface to private.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/http/middleware/

Change-Id: I0bb39321f3659458a86beb2b258e9e903392620a
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify middleware public methods

In Django 1.10 the new middleware interface was introduced [1].
process_request and process_response are no longer part of the interface.
On the other hand, process_exception is the part of the interface.

To clarify that we are using the new middleware interface,
it looks better to rename the methods in the old interface to private.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/http/middleware/

Change-Id: I0bb39321f3659458a86beb2b258e9e903392620a

commit_message:
Remove v1 check in Cinder client version lookup

The Cinder v1 API was deprecated in Juno on removed completely in
Queens. We no do not support compatibility between Stein Nova and Queens
Cinder, so this checking can be removed.

Change-Id: I947f50e921159f66b425f10e31a08a3e0840228e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2017-11-22 00:02:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Lance, as indicated in my comments on https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1615076, I'm don't think 'enabled' does anything in v3. Additionally, I have yet to find a identity entity that supports 'extra' that does not also support arbitrary updating 'extra' via the API. So far I've looked at user, group, role, region, and service.The most concerning example is 'services' which has API specified fields 'name' and 'description' [2] that are only stored in extras. I have been implementing v3 API support in gophercloud and have extensively exercised the APIs include 'extra'.

[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/#update-service"}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2017-11-22 00:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-12-13 08:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I can't find any usage for the extra :{"enabled": true} which is set by keystone-client. So IMO the region's extra is like something did by endpoint, group,project and role. It's only contains user specified data.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-27 16:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with David. While we might not like it, we do already support extra and other resources allow it to be updated. It should at least be consistent.

This needs a test though.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-11-07 19:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-11-07 22:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-11-07 22:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-11-07 22:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-11-07 23:03:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

We are in a API behavior break scenario. I'd rather see us just drop any elements that would have gone into extras on the floor and not store them with a contract that drops the extra column instead of adding support for update.

My -1 is because we should not under any circumstances expand use of extras (even for consistency sake).

Other cores feel free to override my -1 if this should land as is."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-11-08 07:52:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I'm in favor of consistency."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-11-08 15:26:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I see both sides of this approach. It would be nice to allow people to clean up extras if they've put things in there, especially for the sake of consistency. But I really don't care for extras at all...

I'd be OK at least having consistency until we figure out how feasible it is to fix the larger issue of extras existing."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-11-16 21:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

With the discussions in Berlin and the long view for a real V4 API, I am fine with maintaining extras as is for now. I'll rescind my -1 knowing that v4 (crud) api will not carry extras nor emit them (a specific vendor data location for explicit content will be created, spec to-be-proposed shortly) as they exist today.

We will discuss the possibility of a general exception to my "rule" of no config-that-changes api behavior with the possibility of disabling extras once we have a vendor-data (or whatever it will be called) location.

I will maintain I prefer dropping extras in this case, but will not hold it up. (removing -1 to highlight my dislike should not be considered blocking)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-11-20 13:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:01:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Region update extra support

The region update API currently does not allow for adding any
extra values via the update API. This effectively means that while
an extra can be set at create time, they cannot be altered once
set, nor can any additional values be added.

This patch add the missing inclusion of extra to the new ref.

Change-Id: I6e99764c0e360656ddbb47ebb23fe9576c97b99f
Closes-Bug: #1729933

commit_message:
Default embedded instance.flavor.is_public attribute

It is possible that really old instances don't actually have this
attribute defined which can lead to raising exceptions when loading
their embedded flavors from the database.

This patch fixes this by defaulting these values to true if they
are not set.

Change-Id: If04cd802ce7184dc94f94804c743faebe0d4bd8c
Closes-Bug: #1789423

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 04:07:36.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fix required projects for sanity plugin check job

Currently, the sanity plugin check job is failing because
of errors like the following:

ERROR! /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin not found
In Zuul v3 all repositories used need to be declared
in the 'required-projects' parameter on the job.
To fix this issue, add:

  openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin

It follows that .zuul.yaml required-projects for this job should
use *-tempest-plugin repos rather than just openstack/cinder
due to the migration Tempest plugin spec. (Note that note
all projects will follow this naming, like gabbi-tempest.)

Idea is to:

1) Change all repos to use *-tempest-plugin in required-projects
   (this PS)
2) Remove all other extraneous repos from required-projects
   (TODO PS)
3) Blacklist repos that haven't migrated to standalone Tempest
   repo because it makes it hard to pass this job (TODO PS)

.. http://logs.openstack.org/96/615396/4/check/tempest-tox-plugin-sanity-check/a18e9a9/ara-report/

Change-Id: Ifee972d87ae83759000db925449764a60a98f7ba

Currently, the sanity plugin check job is failing because
of errors like the following:

ERROR! /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin not found
In Zuul v3 all repositories used need to be declared
in the 'required-projects' parameter on the job.
To fix this issue, add:

  openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin

It follows that .zuul.yaml required-projects for this job should
use *-tempest-plugin repos rather than just openstack/cinder (e.g.)
due to the migration Tempest plugin spec. (Note that note
all projects will follow this naming, like gabbi-tempest.)

Idea is to:

1) Add missing plugin repos to required-projects (this PS)
2) Blacklist unsupported/broken plugins in
   tempest-plugin-sanity.sh (follow-up PS)

.. http://logs.openstack.org/96/615396/4/check/tempest-tox-plugin-sanity-check/a18e9a9/ara-report/

Change-Id: Ifee972d87ae83759000db925449764a60a98f7ba

commit_message:
Fix required projects for sanity plugin check job

Currently, the sanity plugin check job is failing because
of errors like the following:

  ERROR! /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin not found
  In Zuul v3 all repositories used need to be declared
  in the 'required-projects' parameter on the job.
  To fix this issue, add:

    openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin [0]

So this adds missing projects like tempest plugin repos to get
the job passing.

Included in this patch set:

* Add missing repos to required-projects
* Blacklist networking-plumgrid since it is failing because
  it hasn't been supported in years [1]
* Remove trio2o from required-projects because it is already
  blacklisted
* Add irrelevant-files for sanity check job

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/96/615396/4/check/tempest-tox-plugin-sanity-check/a18e9a9/ara-report/
[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-plumgrid

Change-Id: Ifee972d87ae83759000db925449764a60a98f7ba

commit_message:
interfaces_by_fixed_ip no extra port

test_create_list_show_delete_interfaces_by_fixed_ip was allowed
to make one extra port/interface creation optional
in case the CONF.compute.fixed_network_name was defined,
but in this case the test failed at teardown time (double port delete).
Turned out the test case normally not even deletes the fixed_ip port,
inside the test case.

There is no point for having 3 interface in this test, so just
adding/deleting the fixed_ip interface
and removing th 3th `extra` interface part from the test.

The extra port was problematic in (multiple) shared network case,
however fixed_ip interface creation part
has the right logic to use an explicit network.

Related-Bug: #1790864
Change-Id: I6e3e53c4ac26b4fef09fefb9c590dfa91f577565

subject: Describes alternative way of image creation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}, {'_account_id': 8863, 'name': 'Andrii Ostapenko', 'email': 'anost1986@gmail.com', 'username': 'aostapenko'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 20466, 'name': 'Tin Lam', 'email': 'tin@lam.wtf', 'username': 'tinlam'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-05 21:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-05 22:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-05 23:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-06 00:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-06 02:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-06 14:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2018-11-07 01:06:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't exactly understand why a base_image, that only supports one distribution, is being added in addition to the distro specific dockerfiles.

Loci already allows you to specify your own base image with the FROM argument. Without a strongly compelling reason for adding this specific use case tailored for a jenkins build system, I don't see the need for this patch."}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2018-11-07 01:25:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ah, amending my last review, I see that the FROM in the added Dockerfile is configurable. My mistake there. 

Still, I don't see the utility in adding a new Dockerfile that addresses the needs of external CI system, and has no documentation of how and why to use it."}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-08 00:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Chris, thank you for review, I totally agree. Let me prepare proper change so you could evaluate an idea.'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-08 01:59:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-08 12:50:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am confused, and I don't understand the need for it.

Could you clarify?

For me if you were to put the SSH_AUTH_SOCK into the tmp folder, and re-use it, it should be just fine, and cleaned up afterwards (as part of cleanup.sh)."}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-08 13:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jean-Philippe, thanks for your reply. Socket files can not be copied. The only way for it to get inside a container is to be mounted.'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2018-11-12 08:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The intent of Loci is not to support specific third-party code. If you have a build system that depends on specific image features, you should be able to provide Dockerfiles to meet those needs.

If Loci accepts project specific code outside of the three basic generic builds, they will become responsible for maintaining third-party changes, which is both an unrealistic burden and an invitation to add unneeded complexity.

Unless there is strong disagreement on this policy from the rest of the core team, Iâ€™m a strong -1 code review (and weaker -2 code review).'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-12 18:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I understand your point. But the idea here is to allow to use loci elsewhere with such common use case as described here. Unfortunately loci does not provide a way to handle this with all docker limitations related to passing credentials into container during build, forcing to use swarm to handle secrets properly. So with this change I suggest to provide an official way to handle this use case. If this is not adopted, I believe it would be good to describe some another path to work this out. E.g. mirroring closed repositories locally before each build to be available without authentication.'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-12 18:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is it a part of policy, that loci is not intended to be used elsewhere except official Openstack CI?'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2018-11-21 20:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, we have rejected other patches that are targeted towards third-party specific needs. It is not reasonable to expect the Loci dev team to maintain patches targeted towards systems that they don't maintain. As it stands right now, we're also looking at how we can improve the gate jobs for the official project. We also will add documentation and configuration that helps third-party developers accomplish particular goals, in a general sense.

So, for example, we have the FROM parameter which will allow you to accomplish and maintain your particular CI system without needing to send a new back image with particular build instructions to the general LOCI repository.

Because one of the stated goals of LOCI is maintaining minimalist packages, we will unfortunately be forced to say 'no' to some external feature requests."}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-21 20:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Understood. Thank you for detailed explanation'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2018-11-21 20:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 21:19:11.000000000', 'message': "Adds Dockerfile for creating base build image

As docker does not allow to pass volumes while building image
there is no way to reuse ssh-agent socket from jenkins slave.
This change adds basic Dockerfile that will be used for 'docker build',
while install.sh will be invoked during 'docker run' with all
required parameters passed as environment variables.

This covers use-case when content of upper-constraints.txt require
ssh authentication and is not used for community images creation.
However it adds resposibility to maintain new Dockerfile if
non 'ARG' steps are added to original Dockerfile.

Change-Id: I3f63a18611c25dbae78f1cb1f34be8e51d2e6fd0
"}, {'created': '2018-11-08 01:59:40.000000000', 'message': "Describes alternative way of image creation

As docker does not allow to pass volumes while building image
there is no way to reuse ssh-agent socket from jenkins slave.
This change adds basic Dockerfile that will be used for 'docker build',
that assumes install.sh to be invoked during 'docker run' with all
required parameters passed as environment variables.

This covers use-case when PROJECT_REPO or content of
upper-constraints.txt require ssh authentication
and is not used for community images creation.
However it adds resposibility to maintain new Dockerfile if
non 'ARG' steps are added to original Dockerfile.

Change-Id: I3f63a18611c25dbae78f1cb1f34be8e51d2e6fd0
"}]
commit_message:
Describes alternative way of image creation

As docker does not allow to pass volumes while building image
there is no way to reuse ssh-agent socket from jenkins slave.
This change adds basic Dockerfile that will be used for 'docker build',
that assumes install.sh to be invoked during 'docker run' with all
required parameters passed as environment variables.

This covers use-case when PROJECT_REPO or content of
upper-constraints.txt require ssh authentication
and is not used for community images creation.
However it adds resposibility to maintain new Dockerfile if
non 'ARG' steps are added to original Dockerfile.

Change-Id: I3f63a18611c25dbae78f1cb1f34be8e51d2e6fd0

commit_message:
Switch to using public endpoint for URIs

The URI options in Heat all need to be public facing or otherwise
any instances spawned by Heat could have problems working with
things like SoftwareDeployment's such as Heat.

This patch makes the appropriate changes.

Change-Id: I210cedbdc527d981c49ff52264ee6028242202d2

commit_message:
Consider root id is None in the database case

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch fixes that bug for cases there is no sharing or nested
providers in play.

Change-Id: I9639d852078c95de506110f24d3f35e7cf5e361e
Closes-Bug:#1799892
(cherry picked from commit cdbedac920f407e102a6916f2d943e50a1b0943d)

commit_message:
Install packages required to build EFI disk images

Building EFI disk images requires the sgdisk and mkfs.vfat utilities,
which are provided by the gdisk and dosfstools packages.

Change-Id: I28b1a7bfc9c580a7e098f2861de1c38360751c7c
Story: #1524845
Task: #8755

commit_message:
Add initial support for EFI booting

In order to support EFI booting, we need to respond to the DHCP request
with the appropriate binary for booting the node.

At present, holding off on documentation until this has had an
opportunity to be fully tested and that we're sure that EFI booting
works without issues.

Change-Id: Ibdbeedb481796da03351daf56c91b8bd50480470
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Riteau <pierre@stackhpc.com>
Story: #1524845
Task: #8755

commit_message:
mark yamlutils module as private

Prefix the module name with an underscore to indicate that it is not
meant to be used by things outside of the library.

Change-Id: Id37e69dc5b643bd7276d25352d63547dff572238
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add new charm repositories

These charms and interfaces are direct and indirect
dependencies for the on-going Octavia charm work.

Also amends the ``release-management`` key for the
``charm-octavia`` entry.

Change-Id: I2448ed051340ec879542f1e954a8a72c6334838b
Depends-On: Ia5bab981b806cb9ca6316b0d9fa7f61456434334

commit_message:
simplify interface for creating Governance instance

Replace the separate URL arguments to the class method with one arg
for the base.

Add a new method for loading data from the local filesystem.

Change-Id: I818873b21865837f9068e8c60106d522366d768b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
move governance loading functions into a class

Start a class to encapsulate the idea that the governance data comes
from several different sources. For now this still only reads the
project team data.

Change-Id: I3687a8fe4a102c142b933847907e4bc3a1187d96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: add module for fetching and parsing governance data
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-01 13:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from governance-library to code-change'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-02 18:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-05 17:58:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

After thinking about it  and experiencing it for awhile, I'm not super keen on a python package being in the governance repo. I'd prefer we have data, resolutions, references in here.

Stuff on which we are doing reviews as governors and for which a roll call vote makes sense.

These kinds of things deserve proper code code review and, to me, loading that mindset into my head while doing reviews in 'openstack/governance' isn't a match.

Also, when perusing the repo, it's a sort of impedance mismatch.

Apologies if this was already discussed and decided in some way and I missed it. If people want it to be here and that's the consensus, then great I'm willing to go along with it, but my preference is for something like a governance-tools repo or something of that ilk."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-05 19:42:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> After thinking about it  and experiencing it for awhile, I'm not
 > super keen on a python package being in the governance repo. I'd
 > prefer we have data, resolutions, references in here.
 > 
 > Stuff on which we are doing reviews as governors and for which a
 > roll call vote makes sense.
 > 
 > These kinds of things deserve proper code code review and, to me,
 > loading that mindset into my head while doing reviews in
 > 'openstack/governance' isn't a match.
 > 
 > Also, when perusing the repo, it's a sort of impedance mismatch.
 > 
 > Apologies if this was already discussed and decided in some way and
 > I missed it. If people want it to be here and that's the consensus,
 > then great I'm willing to go along with it, but my preference is
 > for something like a governance-tools repo or something of that
 > ilk.

This is just a convenience thing I've had on the back-burner for a while. I didn't expect it to be controversial.

I don't find it useful to have a completely separate repo for this code because that makes changing the data format and code at the same time more work. If enough of the TC agrees that it shouldn't go here I'll just keep copying it around into all of the places I end up using it."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-07 13:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-07 13:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:18:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

LGTM, and if it grows support for legacy.yaml too I could see switching the election tooling to use this instead of carrying its own parser. Thanks for making it!'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove "amqp.requested-access" state

This patchset removes the "amqp.requested-access" state when the
"amqp" relation is deleted.

The patchset depends on the following pull request for
"charms.reactive" library:

https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/pull/164

Change-Id: I1b16b45c8b01e44ae814d787e061e0f99d0a220d
Closes-Bug: 1721580

[{'created': '2018-11-20 19:39:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add recreate test for bug 1799892

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch recreate that bug by simulating the situation by
inserting the records to the database directly.

Change-Id: Iaed912314f3e8fef2f46453a6bf12011702ae1dd
Related-Bug:#1799892
(cherry picked from commit 95d0ebc3d896a1af95c369d5d12b413e36c1c8d9)
'}]
commit_message:
Add recreate test for bug 1799892

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch recreate that bug by simulating the situation by
inserting the records to the database directly.

Change-Id: Iaed912314f3e8fef2f46453a6bf12011702ae1dd
Related-Bug:#1799892
(cherry picked from commit 95d0ebc3d896a1af95c369d5d12b413e36c1c8d9)

subject: Use eventlet Event for loopingcall events
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25437, 'name': 'Allain Legacy', 'email': 'allain.legacy@windriver.com', 'username': 'alegacy'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-19 08:59:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-19 12:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The problem is that this essentially reverts https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/commit/ba28d511e08c02803ac834bf563eb30a135c2c6e

I wonder if just using https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/eventletutils.py#L174 would fix the problem. That appears to have the correct logic for picking which implementation to use.'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2018-10-19 15:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The problem is that this essentially reverts https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/commit/ba28d511e08c02803ac834bf563eb30a135c2c6e
 > 
 > I wonder if just using https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/eventletutils.py#L174
 > would fix the problem. That appears to have the correct logic for
 > picking which implementation to use.

+1, I wrote the event stuff in eventletutils to solve this exact problem.  See https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1518430 for more info behind that.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-19 17:21:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I had a look at eventletutils. It changes the whole interface completely, and doesn't seem to really map to the usage here. I don't know about that previous patch, but it was reverted already. It needs more testing I guess..."}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-19 19:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-19 19:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

New attempt with eventletutils.Event, I didn't think about fixing it that way."}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2018-10-19 19:47:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I was just now writing out a comment and you fixed it exactly as I was describing :)

This should address Ben's concern as well from that reverted patch, the loopingcall will not block inside of the sleep call during service stop."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-19 20:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-19 20:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-19 21:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Looking a bit closer at the timeline, the patch that Ben linked  was I5835f9595826df5349e4cc8b1da8529bb960ee04.

That patch was reverted in Icb39a334b82834b592932facf93be0687563c316 because it broke the Trove, Vitrage, and Heat gates.

A replacement patch If715fbe21ac085e4f5c83cef0729dbca8dcb19ca was then merged. The difference, according to the commit message, is that the working version "[a]dded code to support the case where unit tests are not being monkey patched (example heat)."

This explains why the logic appears to be 'backwards' - the original intention was to use eventlet but via the monkey-patched threading.Event interface. The eventlet.Event interface is different, so it couldn't be substituted in directly, so in unit tests where threading was *not* monkey-patched we had to do something different. It turns out that eck already wrote a wrapper for eventlet.Event to provide the threading.Event interface so it's easier to use that.

What this does *not* explain, however, is how it's going to fix the bug. Because threading very much *is* monkeypatched in heat-engine (though not in its unit tests): https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat/tree/heat/cmd/engine.py#n22 So in theory we should be using the greenlet Event either way (previously via the monkeypatched threading module; now via the eventletutils Event wrapper).'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-22 08:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

I'm getting a better understanding of the issue. This patch basically reintroduces the issue of bug 1660210. The bug mentions:

"There is some overhead involved in waking up more often, but since it isn't processing anything isn't using a lot of cpu." It's not using a lot, but enough that it's really noticeable when not doing anything.

So I guess I need to find a new approach if I want to reduce the CPU usage and keep the behavior.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-22 11:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-22 13:44:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

OK, according to https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1518430/comments/11 the issue with CPU usage is triggered by using threading.Event even when it is monkeypatched, and using eventlet.Event directly (via eventletutils.Event) instead of the monkeypatched threading.Event fixes it.

I don't think this reintroduces the issue from bug 1660210. The problem there was that we were calling sleep(), so when the process was interrupted by a signal eventlet just let the greenthread go right back to sleep after. Now we're calling wait() on the event, so if the event gets set during the interruption then the greenthread will wake up again. It's equivalent to the original patch for that bug (I5835f9595826df5349e4cc8b1da8529bb960ee04) except using a different interface to Event.

What does worry me is that when thread is _not_ monkeypatched, eventletutils.Event is going to call (the actual, native) threading.Event. Which is the thing that caused problems in I5835f9595826df5349e4cc8b1da8529bb960ee04 and was fixed by If715fbe21ac085e4f5c83cef0729dbca8dcb19ca after the revert. I suspect what we actually want here is to use eventletutils._Event all the time."}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-22 14:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-22 14:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I believe this solves all 3 problems :)'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2018-10-22 17:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Is it even possible to use eventlet without threading being monkey-patched?  I thought that check was just the common way of asking "Am I being run under eventlet?"'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-22 18:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Is it even possible to use eventlet without threading being
 > monkey-patched?  I thought that check was just the common way of
 > asking "Am I being run under eventlet?"

It's technically possible yes. There is nothing preventing you to have real threads alongside green threads, you just have to really careful how to manage them. I hope we don't do that anywhere in OpenStack. oslo.service in particular is very eventlet oriented.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-22 19:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Is it even possible to use eventlet without threading being
 > monkey-patched?  I thought that check was just the common way of
 > asking "Am I being run under eventlet?"

You can, but it's a terrible idea. See the example in http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/eventlet-best-practices.html#monkey-patching'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-22 19:49:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(2 comments)

I agree that this seems right. Let's give it a shot and see what other eventlet edge cases we can uncover. :-)"}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-11-02 17:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-11-02 17:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Use eventlet Event for loopingcall events

This fixes broken logic for finding out how to use green threads. Using
threading.Event with eventlet creates useless load related to timers.

Change-Id: I62e9f1a7cde8846be368fbec58b8e0825ce02079
Closes-Bug: #1798774

commit_message:
Switch to www_authenticate_uri instead of auth_uri

auth_uri has been deprecated in Stein and also it must include
the URL which is publicly accessible by the user.  However, we
keep it in there still because Magnum depends on it for some
variables.

Change-Id: If04d0342dca0f60e1115db388c5e496672d0ab2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-08 14:17:59.000000000', 'message': 'De-dupe subnet IDs when calling neutron /subnets API

In the _get_subnets_from_port method, we call the neutron /subnets API
to list subnets filtered by subnet IDs. We get the subnet IDs by
iterating all of the fixed IPs for the instance and sending the list of
corresponding subnet IDs. The python-neutronclient sends the list of
subnet IDs as a query string in the URI. When an instance has a large
number of interfaces attached, the list of subnet IDs can be too long
for the URI, resulting in a RequestURITooLong error from neutronclient.

This de-dupes the subnet IDs before calling neutron, to handle the case
where an instance has a large number of interfaces attached, but many
of them are on the same subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1796074

Change-Id: I5b52ff81f74ae7cb11e6f012ab7e53cfc6821486
(cherry picked from commit ab5fc6870260d3b3c3bce90a7123c17816bf0093)
(cherry picked from commit 057a05dbbd7e4b9aea0aaa52f4bf6c1089f079be)
'}]
commit_message:
De-dupe subnet IDs when calling neutron /subnets API

In the _get_subnets_from_port method, we call the neutron /subnets API
to list subnets filtered by subnet IDs. We get the subnet IDs by
iterating all of the fixed IPs for the instance and sending the list of
corresponding subnet IDs. The python-neutronclient sends the list of
subnet IDs as a query string in the URI. When an instance has a large
number of interfaces attached, the list of subnet IDs can be too long
for the URI, resulting in a RequestURITooLong error from neutronclient.

This de-dupes the subnet IDs before calling neutron, to handle the case
where an instance has a large number of interfaces attached, but many
of them are on the same subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1796074

Change-Id: I5b52ff81f74ae7cb11e6f012ab7e53cfc6821486
(cherry picked from commit ab5fc6870260d3b3c3bce90a7123c17816bf0093)
(cherry picked from commit 057a05dbbd7e4b9aea0aaa52f4bf6c1089f079be)

commit_message:
monasca-agent: fix references in service files

Some references in the monasca-agent service files still
used upstream service names to reference services. As a result
of this, the PartOf references from the component services
were unresolvable, causing them not to get restarted upon
restarting openstack-monasca-agent.target.

Change-Id: I7bbfb77466964b10edec6f595feb68ccf2eeaa79
(cherry picked from commit 9dbc1aab393093a9c335c7632dfb2021a2af5efc)

commit_message:
Increase the startup time of ambari-server to 180s

It seems to be easy to hit timeout errors, so let's increase
the value of the timeout when ambari-server is started.
The option is recognized only from Ambari 2.5 onwards, but
the plugin uses Ambari 2.6 for all versions but HDP 2.3.

Story: 2004102
Task: 27509
Change-Id: I47c6dd14585ed20998fcf4a068cf1e7144eaf026
(cherry picked from commit 8bded6c9319370872581543325e3c98dcbedb0e1)

subject: Fix neutron resource cleanup after ml2/ovs migration
messages: [{'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-11-21 12:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-11-21 16:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-11-21 16:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-21 12:30:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron resource cleanup after ml2/ovs migration

The migration script "delete-neutron-resources" was being
executed on controller-0 instead of the undercloud node regardless
of the defer_to:localhost ansible setting.

In that controller ~/overcloudrc does not exist, so the cleanup
was failing silently.

This commit moves the cleanup to a separate role that we tie
to localhost (undercloud) from ovn-migration.yml

Closes-Bug: #1804194

Change-Id: I05f2411604ba01d170440ac655491a624f98aafc
(cherry picked from commit 4ea65133984caec42906c0566dd751f593ca8711)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron resource cleanup after ml2/ovs migration

The migration script "delete-neutron-resources" was being
executed on controller-0 instead of the undercloud node regardless
of the defer_to:localhost ansible setting.

In that controller ~/overcloudrc does not exist, so the cleanup
was failing silently.

This commit moves the cleanup to a separate role that we tie
to localhost (undercloud) from ovn-migration.yml

Closes-Bug: #1804194

Change-Id: I05f2411604ba01d170440ac655491a624f98aafc
(cherry picked from commit 4ea65133984caec42906c0566dd751f593ca8711)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 16:26:24.000000000', 'message': 'Correct clustered gating job

The cluster gatting job was failing due to memory locking, which is
impossible due to limited resources in the CI environment. This change
disables memory locking in the clustered gate test.

Change-Id: I0a146c41a1b82425539e014b1baee2011d464e05
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Correct clustered gating job

The cluster gatting job was failing due to memory locking, which is
impossible due to limited resources in the CI environment. This change
disables memory locking in the clustered gate test.

Change-Id: I0a146c41a1b82425539e014b1baee2011d464e05
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-11-08 14:21:02.000000000', 'message': "Use infra Docker registry mirror during CI

cloud and improve download times.

commit_message:
Use infra Docker registry mirror during CI

The mirror caches images from Dockerhub, and should reduce load on the
cloud and improve download times.

Change-Id: I2b52fa6371118e28c1d601e8b90065897f24f41d

commit_message:
Complete removal of vitrage-collector service.

 - vitrage-graph will execute the drivers.
 - Simplify large data transfer from drivers to processor by obsoleting rpc.
 - Drivers don't need to create the complete list by taking advantage of python
   generators in order to conserve memory.
 - Lowering the total signiture of vitrage processes.
 - LockByDriver will enforce a driver does not run get_changes and get_all in parallel.

Story: 2004384
Change-Id: Ie713456b2df96e24d0b15d2362a666162bfb4300

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 07:32:28.000000000', 'message': "Try deleting stack if not soft deleted yet

If an engine is stopped before a stack is soft deleted but marked
DELETE COMPLETE (updated with ian empty template in convergence),
the empty stack can't be soft deleted anymore and would always end
up in the stack list.

Keeps the nested stack behaviour same by returning EnitityNotFound
as before.

Change-Id: Idc541fe0cd12d03e2d9b3cc11a1e7b0046be9d25
Story: #2002921
Task: 22901
"}]
commit_message:
Try deleting stack if not soft deleted yet

If an engine is stopped before a stack is soft deleted but marked
DELETE COMPLETE (updated with ian empty template in convergence),
the empty stack can't be soft deleted anymore and would always end
up in the stack list.

Keeps the nested stack behaviour same by returning EnitityNotFound
as before.

Change-Id: Idc541fe0cd12d03e2d9b3cc11a1e7b0046be9d25
Story: #2002921
Task: 22901

messages: [{'account_id': 27052, 'date': '2018-11-21 12:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27052, 'date': '2018-11-21 17:07:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nchamge 615836 is correct with history.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-21 12:05:00.000000000', 'message': "Don't return Critical when ceph is in warning state.

Current implementation returns Critical when Ceph is in warning
state, checking for some known exceptions which are considered
operational tasks. However this causes many Alarms.
This patch changes the behavior to report Warning when Ceph is
in HEALTH_WARN. If known operational tasks are exceeding
thresholds, Critical is returned.

Change-Id: I129bbe98d0adc28b75c24a923a4808332d75a363
"}]
commit_message:
Don't return Critical when ceph is in warning state.

Current implementation returns Critical when Ceph is in warning
state, checking for some known exceptions which are considered
operational tasks. However this causes many Alarms.
This patch changes the behavior to report Warning when Ceph is
in HEALTH_WARN. If known operational tasks are exceeding
thresholds, Critical is returned.

Change-Id: I129bbe98d0adc28b75c24a923a4808332d75a363

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 13:44:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Set sharable controller and DB configurations

There are a couple of configuration options that need to be set not only
for the worker but also for other Octavia services. For example, on a
composable node deployment where the API runs on a separate node than
the rest of the Octavia services, the network driver was not being set
(hence defaulting to noop driver) while for the worker the driver was
allowed_address_pairs_driver. This led to failure to create a load
balancer. Another example is the database that was only being set for
the API service but not to other services that also connect to the
database.

Change-Id: I853ca1fee058f3ef95460d78f2b9ea154bee606f

commit_message:
Set common configuration options across services

There are a couple of configuration options that need to be set not only
for the worker but also for other Octavia services. For example, on a
composable node deployment where the API runs on a separate node than
the rest of the Octavia services, the network driver was not being set
(hence defaulting to noop driver) while for the worker the driver was
allowed_address_pairs_driver. Another example is the database that was

Set common configuration options across services

There are a couple of configuration options that need to be set not only
for the worker but also for other Octavia services. For example, on a
composable node deployment where the API runs on a separate node than
the rest of the Octavia services, the network driver was not being set

commit_message:
Set common configuration options across services

There are a couple of configuration options that need to be set not only
for the worker but also for other Octavia services. For example, on a
composable node deployment where the API runs on a separate node than
the rest of the Octavia services, the network driver was not being set

commit_message:
Fix octavia::controller redeclaration

It's impossible to use this new class because you
cannot use any services combined with and specify
the parameters in octavia::controler since you get
redeclaration issues.

The class should only be included from octavia::worker
if it doesn't exist to support the old use case.

If you want to use this class it's required that you
define octavia::controller *before* octavia::worker
otherwise you'll end up with another redeclaration
issue since we include the controller unless its
defined before.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618915/
Change-Id: If5b4014d2129879199798d440ae604c03b01ab3a

It's impossible to use this new class because you
cannot use any services combined with and specify
the parameters in octavia::controler since you get
redeclaration issues.

The class should only be included from octavia::worker
if it doesn't exist to support the old use case.

If you want to use this class it's required that you
define octavia::controller *before* octavia::worker
otherwise you'll end up with another redeclaration
issue since we include the controller unless its
defined before.

[{'created': '2018-11-19 18:49:56.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure octavia flavor gets configured if composable octavia

The octavia service templates configure the octavia flavor through the
controller-worker is deployed on a node other than the controller. Since
this uses docker_puppet_tasks, it is only run on the bootstrap node
which at the moment means the first controller. This patch moves the

created when deploying worker components in an non-standard role.

commit_message:
Ensure octavia flavor gets configured if composable octavia

The octavia service templates configure the octavia flavor through the
controller-worker is deployed on a node other than the controller. Since
this uses docker_puppet_tasks, it is only run on the bootstrap node
which at the moment means the first controller. This patch moves the
flavor creation to the docker API template to make sure the flavor gets
created when deploying worker components in an non-standard role.

Conflicts:
    docker/services/octavia-api.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1797443

Change-Id: Id823672b82ea60f355d1f01068f802567d687da5
(cherry picked from commit 7d533b77370311926e23b18ef6dbdbf2c3dcac01)
(cherry picked from commit 130633422731630ebc0bcc45bb899cd7c0aa1bc3)

commit_message:
Add status check tox env and zuul job

This patch ensures that the status check tool is run in CI when changes
are made so that we can properly validate the changes and see the
example output.

Change-Id: Ide20064713e54638661b779e371ee9dbbdff1634

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 08:57:15.000000000', 'message': 'Support action managed upgrades

Update code to ensure that openstack upgrade does not run via a
hook if action-managed-upgrades is set. If the openstack upgrade
is being triggered via an action then no interfaces will have
been passed so call render_all_configs which will indirectly
construct the adapter classes.

Depends-On: I1958226576c73d0ce0e9fd4c1423f86addadb454
Change-Id: I33947c474b70c5cd4722688567ba55370b805f65
'}, {'created': '2018-11-21 10:19:47.000000000', 'message': 'Support action managed upgrades

Update code to ensure that openstack upgrade does not run via a
hook if action-managed-upgrades is set. If the openstack upgrade
is being triggered via an action then no interfaces will have
been passed so call render_all_configs which will indirectly
construct the adapter classes.

commit_message:
Support action managed upgrades

Update code to ensure that openstack upgrade does not run via a
hook if action-managed-upgrades is set. If the openstack upgrade
is being triggered via an action then no interfaces will have
been passed so call render_all_configs which will indirectly
construct the adapter classes.

Depends-On: I1958226576c73d0ce0e9fd4c1423f86addadb454
Change-Id: I33947c474b70c5cd4722688567ba55370b805f65
