subject: Switch default service type to 'forking'
messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:32:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-23 17:08:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-10-23 21:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Sadly it would seem that if the exec process does not call `fork()` the forking unit will hang or otherwise generally fail. Additionally it looks like on processes that do not fork the service unit will report the correct status code http://paste.openstack.org/show/732857/ - To correct the service start issues on forking processes it would seem we need to modify the service type, where appropriate and simply not assume that the simple or forking works universally.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-08 15:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-21 16:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 15:32:46.000000000', 'message': "Switch default service type to 'forking'

The 'simple' service type will always return success
when starting/restarting a service, regardless of
whether the service fails. This means that all tasks
to start/restart the service think that it's working,
when it actually is not.

In order to ensure that systemd actually verifies the
result of the start/restart and returns an RC of >1
on fail, we switch the default service type to
'forking'.

For reference, here is a sample of what happens:
https://gist.github.com/odyssey4me/b8f6a13ffc48b99cc837761cf4e4b064

Change-Id: Ia3e67d822563e9dbc83d218ec50fe5f78445545b
"}, {'created': '2018-10-23 15:39:25.000000000', 'message': "Switch default service type to 'forking'

The 'simple' service type will always return success
when starting/restarting a service, regardless of
whether the service fails. This means that all tasks
to start/restart the service think that it's working,
when it actually is not.

In order to ensure that systemd actually verifies the
result of the start/restart and returns an RC of >1
on fail, we switch the default service type to
'forking'.

For reference, here is a sample of what happens:
https://gist.github.com/odyssey4me/b8f6a13ffc48b99cc837761cf4e4b064

Change-Id: Ia3e67d822563e9dbc83d218ec50fe5f78445545b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch default service type to 'forking'

The 'simple' service type will always return success
when starting/restarting a service, regardless of
whether the service fails. This means that all tasks
to start/restart the service think that it's working,
when it actually is not.

In order to ensure that systemd actually verifies the
result of the start/restart and returns an RC of >1
on fail, we switch the default service type to
'forking'.

For reference, here is a sample of what happens:
https://gist.github.com/odyssey4me/b8f6a13ffc48b99cc837761cf4e4b064

Change-Id: Ia3e67d822563e9dbc83d218ec50fe5f78445545b

Moving delete_namespace to addCleanup in port_pool testing

delete_namespace should be done in addCleanup, otherwise if the
test fails the namespaces are not erased automatically

Hi, please, cover this case by tests'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- mistral-devstack: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1763070
- mistral-rally-task: unrecognized error
- mistral-tox-unit-mysql: unrecognized error
- mistral-tox-unit-postgresql: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-lower-constraints: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py27: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py35: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py36: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-10-15 08:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The division by 2 is applied several times without much explanation. It would be good to extract this logic in a documented function. Otherwise looks good.

Side note: In general, it would be better if this serialization did not have to happen several times. Currently it happens at least during this test and during the SQLAlchemy SQL command creation. If the data is small, this causes negigible overhead but larger limits can result in significant performance loss.'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-25 15:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-11-09 14:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-11-21 11:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-07 21:38:00.000000000', 'message': "Omit output_on_error in error handling if it exceeds field size limits.

If wf fails because of task's summary output exceeds field's limitation,
_fail_workflow method could write this object again to wf_ex.output,
which will lead to error again and wf will stuck in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I9618f634a541d85b9ae871b2c3a0ab2d14f1b29c
Closes-Bug: #1796592
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-11 11:09:52.000000000', 'message': "Refactor size limit check mechanism

* Fix incorrect size calculation in length validator.
* Reduce output message limits in error handling.
Field's size validator uses cast to str to calculate field size. If we
cast dict to list, some artifacts could appear, so we need to save some
free space to deal with them.
* Omit output_on_error in error handling if it exceeds field size
limits. If wf fails because of task's summary output exceeds field's
limitation, _fail_workflow method could write this object again
to wf_ex.output, which will lead to error again and wf will stuck
in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I9618f634a541d85b9ae871b2c3a0ab2d14f1b29c
Closes-Bug: #1797136
Closes-Bug: #1796592
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Refactor size limit check mechanism

* Fix incorrect size calculation in length validator.
* Reduce output message limits in error handling.
Field's size validator uses cast to str to calculate field size. If we
cast dict to list, some artifacts could appear, so we need to save some
free space to deal with them.
* Omit output_on_error in error handling if it exceeds field size
limits. If wf fails because of task's summary output exceeds field's
limitation, _fail_workflow method could write this object again
to wf_ex.output, which will lead to error again and wf will stuck
in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I9618f634a541d85b9ae871b2c3a0ab2d14f1b29c
Closes-Bug: #1797136
Closes-Bug: #1796592
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Sync c-h with loopback_devices() fix

PY3 bug in loopback_devices caused the related bug.  This patch syncs
just the relevant file to fix the bug into charmhelpers.

Change-Id: I5aacd16c2bd4957c49210e867dc76efa1a315ab4
Closes-Bug: #1804128

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 13:50:43.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Clean MAC_Binding entries when disassociating a FIP

When a FIP gets disassociated, the MAC_Binding entries in SB
database are not getting cleared. There's a use case (surely
more) where 2+ Logical Routers are connected to the external
network and different VMs want to talk through FIPs. In this
case if one FIP is reused (was previously used and removed/
disassociated), the old flows due to the MAC_Binding entry
will still be present and no action will be sent to
ovn-controller to update the ARP responder, thus the old MAC
is still used and the FIP is unreachable.

While the proper way to fix this should be making ovn-northd
or ovn-controller clearing/updating the MAC_Binding entries
upon new NAT rules creation, this patch is a workaround to
remove whatever MAC_Binding entries are related to that FIP
when this gets disassociated.

Details about the bug reported in OVS ML at [0].

TODO: tests

[0] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-October/047604.html

Change-Id: Ic04fcbe332adf030ab0ee3aad3a94ad874b18c9a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-29 11:58:55.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Clean MAC_Binding entries when (dis)associating a FIP

When a FIP is assigned to a port, it may happen that it was
previously used by another FIP or gateway port and an entry
in MAC_Binding table exits. If that's the case, the ARP
responder will answer with the wrong MAC address and the FIP
will then be unreachable.

In order to be on the safe side, this patch is deleting all
MAC_Binding entries upon association or disassociation of a
FIP as a workaround. The proper way to fix this should be
making ovn-northd or ovn-controller clearing/updating the
stale entries upon new NAT rules creation.

Details about the bug reported in OVS ML at [0].

TODO: tests

[0] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-October/047604.html

Change-Id: Ic04fcbe332adf030ab0ee3aad3a94ad874b18c9a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-11-07 19:01:13.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Clean MAC_Binding entries when (dis)associating a FIP

commit_message:
Clean MAC_Binding entries when (dis)associating a FIP

When a FIP is assigned to a port, it may happen that it was
previously used by another FIP or gateway port and an entry
in MAC_Binding table exits. If that's the case, the ARP
responder will answer with the wrong MAC address and the FIP
will then be unreachable.

In order to be on the safe side, this patch is deleting all
MAC_Binding entries upon association or disassociation of a
FIP as a workaround. The proper way to fix this should be
making ovn-northd or ovn-controller clearing/updating the
stale entries upon new NAT rules creation.

Details about the bug reported in OVS ML at [0].

[0] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-October/047604.html

Change-Id: Ic04fcbe332adf030ab0ee3aad3a94ad874b18c9a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 16:50:37.000000000', 'message': "Support Ironic Inspector dnsmasq PXE filter

The dnsmasq PXE filter [1] provides far better scalability than the
iptables filter typically used. Inspector manages files in a dhcp-hostsdir
directory that is watched by dnsmasq via inotify. Dnsmasq then either
whitelists or blacklists MAC addresses based on the contents of these
files.

This change adds a new variable, ironic_inspector_pxe_filter, that can
be used to configure the PXE filter for ironic inspector. Currently
supported values are 'iptables' and 'dnsmasq', with 'iptables' being the
default for backwards compatibility.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/latest/admin/dnsmasq-pxe-filter.html

Implements: blueprint ironic-inspector-dnsmasq-pxe-filter
Change-Id: I73cae9c33b49972342cf1984372a5c784df5cbc2
"}, {'created': '2018-11-20 15:26:41.000000000', 'message': "Support Ironic Inspector dnsmasq PXE filter

iptables filter typically used. Inspector manages files in a dhcp-hostsdir
directory that is watched by dnsmasq via inotify. Dnsmasq then either
whitelists or blacklists MAC addresses based on the contents of these
files.

This change adds a new variable, ironic_inspector_pxe_filter, that can
be used to configure the PXE filter for ironic inspector. Currently
supported values are 'iptables' and 'dnsmasq', with 'iptables' being the
default for backwards compatibility.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/latest/admin/dnsmasq-pxe-filter.html

Implements: blueprint ironic-inspector-dnsmasq-pxe-filter
Change-Id: I73cae9c33b49972342cf1984372a5c784df5cbc2
"}]
commit_message:
Support Ironic Inspector dnsmasq PXE filter

The dnsmasq PXE filter [1] provides far better scalability than the
iptables filter typically used. Inspector manages files in a dhcp-hostsdir
directory that is watched by dnsmasq via inotify. Dnsmasq then either
whitelists or blacklists MAC addresses based on the contents of these
files.

This change adds a new variable, ironic_inspector_pxe_filter, that can
be used to configure the PXE filter for ironic inspector. Currently
supported values are 'iptables' and 'dnsmasq', with 'iptables' being the
default for backwards compatibility.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/latest/admin/dnsmasq-pxe-filter.html

Implements: blueprint ironic-inspector-dnsmasq-pxe-filter
Change-Id: I73cae9c33b49972342cf1984372a5c784df5cbc2

commit_message:
Set "no_log" for "databases user and setting permissions" tasks

At the moment the "databases user and setting permissions" task for
designate and nova leaks the database_password because of the use
of with_items:

---snip---
TASK [nova : Creating Nova databases user and setting permissions] *********************************************************
ok: [x -> y] => (item={u'database_password': u'password', u'database_name': u'nova', u'database_username': u'nova'})
ok: [x -> y] => (item={u'database_password': u'password', u'database_name': u'nova_cell0', u'database_username': u'nova'})
ok: [x -> y] => (item={u'database_password': u'password', u'database_name': u'nova_api', u'database_username': u'nova_api'})
---snap---

Change-Id: I141e4153223c8772c82a31d81e58057ce266c0b9
Co-authored-by: Bernd MÃ¼ller <mueller@b1-systems.de>

commit_message:
Add glance-cache support

Glance cache is used to keep a locally cache image
in the glance_api service.
Is an usefull service when an image is commonly used
to speed times between pulling from storage backend
and send to nova.

Change-Id: I8e684cc10e4fee1cb52c17a126e3b11f69576cf6

What's migrated:

commit_message:
zuul: Move legacy jobs to project

Implement part of step one of the zuulv3 migration guide: move the
purely nova projects to the nova repo [1]. This does not migrate any
jobs used in other projects nor does it convert what is migrated to use
the new 'devstack' or 'devstack-tempest' base jobs. Both of these steps
should be done separately.

What's migrated:

- experimental:
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-lvm (renamed to nova-lvm)

What's dropped:

- experimental:
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-lxc (no one's using this)
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-wsgi-full (WSGI is the default since Pike)

What's still to be migrated, here or to other projects:

- check:
  - legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode
  - legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-cells
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-nova-next-full
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration
  - ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full
  - legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron
- gate:
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-cells
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full
  - legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron
- experimental:
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-api
  - legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-nova-next
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-multinode-full
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-ha-multinode-full
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend
  - ironic-tempest-dsvm-pxe_ipa-full
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-libvirt-kvm-apr
  - legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-zero-downtime
  - ironic-tempest-dsvm-multitenant-network
  - ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-resourceclasses-partition-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-nfs
  - legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-oooq
  - legacy-barbican-simple-crypto-dsvm-tempest-nova
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35-full-devstack-plugin-ceph
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-pg-full
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-opensuse-423
  - legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.versionedobjects

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

 Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are becase the nova-dsvm-base job does not exist
in Pike.

Change-Id: I41b03a34795efe139d5911c605cdbd3c47a2f059
(cherry picked from commit 0db7b77b4615f25217ad646b2e4082994e8dfb73)

[{'created': '2018-11-13 14:50:34.000000000', 'message': 'monasca-agent: fix references in service files

Some references in the monasca-agent service files still
used upstream service names to reference services. As a result
of this, the PartOf references from the component services
were unresolvable, causing them not to get restarted upon
restarting openstack-monasca-agent.target.

Change-Id: I7bbfb77466964b10edec6f595feb68ccf2eeaa79
'}]
commit_message:
monasca-agent: fix references in service files

Some references in the monasca-agent service files still
used upstream service names to reference services. As a result
of this, the PartOf references from the component services
were unresolvable, causing them not to get restarted upon
restarting openstack-monasca-agent.target.

Change-Id: I7bbfb77466964b10edec6f595feb68ccf2eeaa79

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I68e4c9e81b8f17ec076a03376342e7b166efbe44
Implements: blueprint deprecate-auth-uri-option

commit_message:
remove unused methods from CommonDbMixin

The register_model_query_hook and _apply_dict_extend_functions methods
from CommonDbMixin is not being used by consumers today. This patch
removes them and updates any doc references as well.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I3e72d7f33f5a7b0c9c023295302929410f94eefb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 10:36:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron resource cleanup after ml2/ovs migration

The migration script "delete-neutron-resources" was being
executed on controller-0 instead of the undercloud node regardless
of the defer_to:localhost ansible setting.

In that controller ~/overcloudrc does not exist, so the cleanup
was failing silently.

This commit moves the cleanup to a separate role that we tie
to localhost (undercloud) from ovn-migration.yml

Closes-Bug: #1804194

Change-Id: I05f2411604ba01d170440ac655491a624f98aafc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron resource cleanup after ml2/ovs migration

The migration script "delete-neutron-resources" was being
executed on controller-0 instead of the undercloud node regardless
of the defer_to:localhost ansible setting.

In that controller ~/overcloudrc does not exist, so the cleanup
was failing silently.

This commit moves the cleanup to a separate role that we tie
to localhost (undercloud) from ovn-migration.yml

Closes-Bug: #1804194

Change-Id: I05f2411604ba01d170440ac655491a624f98aafc

subject: pci-passthrough-whitelist: allow devname regexps
messages:
[{'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2018-08-10 10:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2018-11-08 04:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Thank you for your work on this.  Unfortunately, the change cannot proceed as-proposed.  It needs to be proposed against the master branch (rather than a stable branch).  Generally speaking, once a change lands in master, it can then be cherry-picked to a stable branch and considered for a stable backport.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-11-08 10:33:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Really interesting patch Alvaro.

I'm asking myself whether we really want to add such complexity here where this can be resolved by a bash script. Making a logic to guess in a command to write config looks a bit sensible for me.
Also that can't this be in conflict with regex allowed by the pci/pci_passthrough_whitelist option itself (that seems to be only for the PCI address)?

Except of that your patch looks good even if we should probably ensure the behavior when no dev are found and whether more than one is found. Also as noticed by Ryan you probably want to propose that one on master."}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2018-11-21 12:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

see https://review.openstack.org/619225'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-10 10:19:29.000000000', 'message': 'pci-passthrough-whitelist: allow devname regexps

devname may vary depending on physical slots network adapters have been
added to. This patch allows to pass a regular expression to find the
proper device name (ie. "enp(131|216)s0f1").

Any other regular expression special character is also allowed (ie. $,
\b, ^, etc.)

Change-Id: Ic87d53f23516013b4b96c5841e385a7747e149b3
Closes-Bug: 1786283
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
pci-passthrough-whitelist: allow devname regexps

devname may vary depending on physical slots network adapters have been
added to. This patch allows to pass a regular expression to find the
proper device name (ie. "enp(131|216)s0f1").

Any other regular expression special character is also allowed (ie. $,
\b, ^, etc.)

Change-Id: Ic87d53f23516013b4b96c5841e385a7747e149b3
Closes-Bug: 1786283
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>

When render_configs is called without an adapters_instance it used to

was, in effect, useless (the pre-existing docstring comment says as
much). Usually render_configs is called via render_with_interfaces
which inturn has gets its interface list excplicitly passed in.
However, this approach is not possible when needing to trigger a

Change-Id: I1958226576c73d0ce0e9fd4c1423f86addadb454

commit_message:
Add interfaces from flags to adapter interface

When render_configs is called without an adapters_instance it used to
construct an adapters_instance which lacked any relation data. This
was, in effect, useless (the pre-existing docstring comment says as
much). Usually render_configs is called via render_with_interfaces
which inturn has gets its interface list excplicitly passed in.
However, this approach is not possible when needing to trigger a
config render from a generic layer as the generic layer does not know
which interfaces to pass.

This change adds code to dynamically build the interface list from
the flags which have been set already.

Change-Id: I1958226576c73d0ce0e9fd4c1423f86addadb454

commit_message:
Log stack environment output.

Print out the overcloud stack environment
parameters for debugging purposes, even though
the upgrade was performed correctly it's always
useful to know the content of the resource_registry
and other environment parameters.

Change-Id: I7431d3aacc219c551bd7b262dca189d94d4f1d5c

commit_message:
Add nrpe support

Parses services() available, and uses charmhelpers' haproxy checks to
set default checks for Heat. By enabling nrpe-external-master interface,
we also allow hacluster subordinate application to be monitored for
check_crm and pacemakerd.

Change-Id: I4ad2b1c514099f9b6fe352cdab65587780915e5c
Closes-Bug: 1664745
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Install the timezone package by default

The timezone package is required in order to have the containers report
correct time the timezone package is required. This change install the
tz package across all of the distros we support.

Change-Id: I2aa2561cc6e2c71db0a16590f5d9dbab24b393d2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2795982ba3b96e1ec3eae961d6e680adba314bfc)

commit_message:
Rename kuryr-status to kuryr-k8s-status

As there's another kuryr-status binary in kuryr repo this creates issues
when creating packags out of the repo and could get confusing, therefore
I'm renaming this one.

Change-Id: I4b958d53c6530dd5099b3ac1dbcde4648055ff38

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-07 11:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-07 11:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to nspawn-rocky-fixes'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-11-20 18:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-21 11:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 11:08:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add test for host_only networks and ensure network ordering

The `host_only` network option did not have a functional test, this
change adds one so that the mv-extra interface will now run with this
which will ensure its functional when enabled. The "nspawn_combined_networks"
also had an issue where the first network in the container config could
be something other than the nspawn container network. This would shift
the gateway from the mv-nspawn and to whatever was defined first. A
change to the "nspawn_combined_networks" will now ensure
"nspawn_networks" is referenced first.

Depends-On: Ic280db301ce44b98ac35c8911999dec5fa263a29
Change-Id: Id20afab8b705f6528ba5575ee4704c1661e6e65c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit b2df99498c7a0c775ac13edcf3136e5b2dbefcb5)
'}]
commit_message:
Add test for host_only networks and ensure network ordering

The `host_only` network option did not have a functional test, this
change adds one so that the mv-extra interface will now run with this
which will ensure its functional when enabled. The "nspawn_combined_networks"
also had an issue where the first network in the container config could
be something other than the nspawn container network. This would shift
the gateway from the mv-nspawn and to whatever was defined first. A
change to the "nspawn_combined_networks" will now ensure
"nspawn_networks" is referenced first.

Depends-On: Ic280db301ce44b98ac35c8911999dec5fa263a29
Change-Id: Id20afab8b705f6528ba5575ee4704c1661e6e65c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit b2df99498c7a0c775ac13edcf3136e5b2dbefcb5)

The current network creation loop would allow a user to create duplicate
configs within a container and that can break parts of an environment.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0b9d6a4178103ecdd2bf2b82071420dc771fafbf)
"}]
commit_message:
Add a guard so we don't allow for duplicate config

The current network creation loop would allow a user to create duplicate
configs within a container and that can break parts of an environment.

Change-Id: I3585422fb134eec5ef2532515a6cda463b239f7c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0b9d6a4178103ecdd2bf2b82071420dc771fafbf)

commit_message:
Add missing user defined interface support

Macvlan interfaces can have a user defined interface within the host
config. This change ensures that the capability, which is documented in
the nspawn_host role, is actually functional.

Change-Id: I083042a791d9213b9b1872a239dc18dc6c7ae46e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit d01150301e2dcb7119392be693e168f8599cf6df)
(cherry picked from commit 5949f382cedb3e4b3cdb11ef3b059e313789475f)

Kayobe configuration path <my pwd>/config/src/kayobe-config does not exist"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-10 14:23:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ah, you might be right there. In that case you could just use config/src/tenks. Any idea why it silently failed? Missing a set -e?"}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-10 14:58:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Thanks; patch set 3 'succeeded' in Zuul as well but the task
 > > errored because of the relative path. Doesn't the chdir need to
 > be
 > > there for the config_init in tenks_deploy.sh to work? If I run it
 > > from anywhere except the Kayobe source directory, I get:
 > >
 > > Kayobe configuration path <my pwd>/config/src/kayobe-config does
 > > not exist
 > 
 > Ah, you might be right there. In that case you could just use
 > config/src/tenks. Any idea why it silently failed? Missing a set
 > -e?

I'm not sure! 'set -e' is certainly present in tenks-deploy.sh. I believe the error occurs when pip installing Tenks, which is inside a set +U block, but I don't see why that would affect it since this error isn't to do with an undefined variable. In fact, in the current patch set I've doubly broken it because there's a newline between the tenks-deploy.sh invocation and the path it's being passed, meaning tenks-deploy.sh returns 1 on line 18. Perhaps the set -e doesn't make its way into the subshell that Ansible creates to run the command?"}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-10 16:23:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-11 08:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-11 09:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-11 11:03:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

There's some weirdness going on here. This latest error stems from the fact that the user in Zuul doesn't appear to be a member of the 'docker' group, meaning it can't connect to the Docker daemon without sudo. The error in the previous patchset's CI run shows this: http://logs.openstack.org/39/601239/6/check/kayobe-overcloud-centos/402f3f6/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-09-11_09_01_03_745104

In the latest patchset I added sudo to the docker commands in tenks-deploy.sh, but we still fail elsewhere because we're not using sudo in the /bin/ovs-vsctl script that connects to the Docker daemon.

Instead of adding sudo to that script as well, shouldn't the user already be a member of the Docker group? The 'Query docker daemon information' task in overcloud-deploy seemed to work fine (http://logs.openstack.org/39/601239/7/check/kayobe-overcloud-centos/2efadf3/primary/ansible/overcloud-deploy), so I don't know why it seems to not be in the group anymore in tenks-deploy.sh."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:26:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> There's some weirdness going on here. This latest error stems from
 > the fact that the user in Zuul doesn't appear to be a member of the
 > 'docker' group, meaning it can't connect to the Docker daemon
 > without sudo. The error in the previous patchset's CI run shows
 > this: http://logs.openstack.org/39/601239/6/check/kayobe-overcloud-centos/402f3f6/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-09-11_09_01_03_745104
 > 
 > In the latest patchset I added sudo to the docker commands in
 > tenks-deploy.sh, but we still fail elsewhere because we're not
 > using sudo in the /bin/ovs-vsctl script that connects to the Docker
 > daemon.
 > 
 > Instead of adding sudo to that script as well, shouldn't the user
 > already be a member of the Docker group? The 'Query docker daemon
 > information' task in overcloud-deploy seemed to work fine
 > (http://logs.openstack.org/39/601239/7/check/kayobe-overcloud-centos/2efadf3/primary/ansible/overcloud-deploy),
 > so I don't know why it seems to not be in the group anymore in
 > tenks-deploy.sh.

The zuul user is 'zuul', and that's what ansible will use by default. Kayobe uses the stack user, and this user is added to the docker group."}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:32:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> > There's some weirdness going on here. This latest error stems
 > from
 > > the fact that the user in Zuul doesn't appear to be a member of
 > the
 > > 'docker' group, meaning it can't connect to the Docker daemon
 > > without sudo. The error in the previous patchset's CI run shows
 > > this: http://logs.openstack.org/39/601239/6/check/kayobe-overcloud-centos/402f3f6/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-09-11_09_01_03_745104
 > >
 > > In the latest patchset I added sudo to the docker commands in
 > > tenks-deploy.sh, but we still fail elsewhere because we're not
 > > using sudo in the /bin/ovs-vsctl script that connects to the
 > Docker
 > > daemon.
 > >
 > > Instead of adding sudo to that script as well, shouldn't the user
 > > already be a member of the Docker group? The 'Query docker daemon
 > > information' task in overcloud-deploy seemed to work fine
 > > (http://logs.openstack.org/39/601239/7/check/kayobe-overcloud-centos/2efadf3/primary/ansible/overcloud-deploy),
 > > so I don't know why it seems to not be in the group anymore in
 > > tenks-deploy.sh.
 > 
 > The zuul user is 'zuul', and that's what ansible will use by
 > default. Kayobe uses the stack user, and this user is added to the
 > docker group.

Ah right, that makes sense. Judging by your comment in the docker-engine role, I guess we'll have to give in and use sudo instead of trying to do any SSH faffing here then."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Yes, either that or use the stack user to execute ansible. sudo might be easier.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:36:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Looks like we might need to have a similar script to ovs-vsctl for virsh that points to the nova_libvirt container. And also avoids running the libvirt-host role in that case. Let's try to get it working first though."}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:47:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Looks like we might need to have a similar script to ovs-vsctl for
 > virsh that points to the nova_libvirt container. And also avoids
 > running the libvirt-host role in that case. Let's try to get it
 > working first though.

Good point."}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-12 11:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> > Looks like we might need to have a similar script to ovs-vsctl
 > for
 > > virsh that points to the nova_libvirt container. And also avoids
 > > running the libvirt-host role in that case. Let's try to get it
 > > working first though.
 > 
 > Good point.

It seems like it won't be as simple as having a virsh script like the ovs-vsctl one. The host's virsh will actually connect to the container's instance of the libvirt daemon if the libvirt-daemon package is not installed on the host; however we still need to run the libvirt-host role to add the volume pools. The libvirt-host/vm roles trip up with the paths to the volume pools and emulator binaries (e.g. the nova-libvirt container uses the deprecated qemu-kvm emulator, instead of qemu-system-x86_64), which differ based on whether you're in the context of the container or not. The task that creates the volume pool directory using the 'file' module on the host would therefore need a /var/lib/libvirt/... path, whereas the task that actually adds the pool to libvirt using the 'virt' module would need a /var/lib/docker/volumes/libvirtd/_data/... path.

I've racked my brains about this but can't think of a very good solution. We could add an optional 'command prefix' of 'docker exec nova_libvirt ' to the roles which would be used for each task, but that would mean we couldn't use the 'file' module anymore. Ansible also has a way of adding Docker containers as separate hosts, but that doesn't seem to work with Docker daemons that aren't running on localhost."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-12 14:25:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> > > Looks like we might need to have a similar script to ovs-vsctl
 > > for
 > > > virsh that points to the nova_libvirt container. And also
 > avoids
 > > > running the libvirt-host role in that case. Let's try to get it
 > > > working first though.
 > >
 > > Good point.
 > 
 > It seems like it won't be as simple as having a virsh script like
 > the ovs-vsctl one. The host's virsh will actually connect to the
 > container's instance of the libvirt daemon if the libvirt-daemon
 > package is not installed on the host; however we still need to run
 > the libvirt-host role to add the volume pools. The libvirt-host/vm
 > roles trip up with the paths to the volume pools and emulator
 > binaries (e.g. the nova-libvirt container uses the deprecated
 > qemu-kvm emulator, instead of qemu-system-x86_64), which differ
 > based on whether you're in the context of the container or not. The
 > task that creates the volume pool directory using the 'file' module
 > on the host would therefore need a /var/lib/libvirt/... path,
 > whereas the task that actually adds the pool to libvirt using the
 > 'virt' module would need a /var/lib/docker/volumes/libvirtd/_data/...
 > path.
 > 
 > I've racked my brains about this but can't think of a very good
 > solution. We could add an optional 'command prefix' of 'docker exec
 > nova_libvirt ' to the roles which would be used for each task, but
 > that would mean we couldn't use the 'file' module anymore. Ansible
 > also has a way of adding Docker containers as separate hosts, but
 > that doesn't seem to work with Docker daemons that aren't running
 > on localhost.

A simple solution to this problem is to avoid it. If we ensure we don't install tenks on a system with containerised libvirt, it should work. Three options I can think of:

1. Disable nova virt compute
2. Put nova compute services on a second node
3. Put tenks on a second node

Suggest we go with 1 for now and switch the server creation in overcloud-test.sh to use a bare metal flavor.

If you have a list of current limitations, this should be on it."}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-12 14:42:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Okay, that's probably easiest for now. I'll add a limitations section to the Tenks README."}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-12 15:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-12 16:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-13 08:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-13 10:59:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Add tenks-deploy.sh dev script

tenks-deploy.sh deploys a minimal virtualized baremetal test cluster
locally. It also adds it to the overcloud-base CI job. To make the new
CI job work, we need to configure the firewall on the test machine to
allow the baremetal machines to communicate with the openstack services.

Change-Id: I7487a2606cf0bac71c5c63db41b2b518a6f6398b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615939
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618003
Story: 2004297
Task: 27850

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-24 12:17:35.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Make nova tests pass with externalized placement

These changes are an exploration of what it would take to get nova
"working" with placement code that comes from somewhere else. Not
because there's a plan to do anything immediately but because doing
experiments in advance helps to uncover issues so we can think about
it smoothly.

NOTE: Tests are not expected to pass, this is just for discussion:
nothing is managing the install of the special placement in the gate
so it will blow up.

What we have here is:

* recent nova master
* nova/api/openstack/placement removed (except for lib.py)
* nova/tests/{unit,functional}/api/openstack/placement removed
* https://github.com/EdLeafe/placement/pull/2 'pip install -e'
  into the local nova virtenv

And then the changes need to get both unit and functional tests
passing. As the diff (a consolidated one without file removes is at
[1]) shows, the changes are relatively minor and can be grouped into
three (overlapping) classes:

* things that directly access objects in placement
* things that need the PlacementFixture so they have access to a
  working placement API
* things that need access to the placement db, either because they
  want to use it directly, or because they are using the
  PlacementFixture with "real" data

The remaining changes are "we don't need placement here".

As a bonus this patch includes a slightly modified
nova/api/openstack/placement/wsgi.py which, if it is working
properly, allows a nova-placement-api WSGI app to run off the
nova.conf file, against the extracted placement code. Initial
diddling suggests it kind of works, but need to try with something
other than the built in server. Note that placement is still set up
to use either the [api_database]/connection or
[placement_database]/connection. Using the former if it is set and
falling back to the latter. This means that it would be possible to
use the placement code, but carry on with the "old" database, the
old config, and the wsgi script, if people wanted to do that sort of
thing.

The issues I'm able to identify by doing this (please follow up with
those that you think of) include:

* the nova/api/openstack/placement/lib.py file is used by both nova
  and placement for managing RequestGroup objects. However, as I
  understand things, there is, or will be some divergence on how
  these things are going to be used, so should be fine to have
  separate versions and not an actual "lib"

* The cmd and status checks that want the database need to have a
  future defined for them.

* The nova side PlacementFixture, which is a subclass of the
  placement side PlacementFixture, pretty much always needs a
  database, so it would make some sense to make that if not
  automatic then at least an option.

* The base test, when use db is true, uses the placement database.
  We should probably change that, even if we weren't going to
  extract placement.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/728735/

Change-Id: I0fada396e3c429bceeaccd321e4d82cb69e5265d
'}, {'created': '2018-08-24 13:23:41.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Make nova tests pass with externalized placement

it smoothly.

What we have here is:

* recent nova master
* nova/api/openstack/placement removed (except for lib.py)
* nova/tests/{unit,functional}/api/openstack/placement removed
* git+https://github.com/cdent/placement-1.git@cd/make-it-work installed
  via requirements

(Note that in order for code to be installed from git it has be installed
by pip directly, so tox.ini has been adjusted slightly to install
requirements.txt directly instead of having those things installed when
nova itself installed. This _may_ mean some tests pass in the gate.
We'll see.)

And then the changes need to get both unit and functional tests
passing. As the diff (a consolidated one without file removes is at
[1]) shows, the changes are relatively minor and can be grouped into
three (overlapping) classes:

* things that directly access objects in placement
* things that need the PlacementFixture so they have access to a
  working placement API
* things that need access to the placement db, either because they
  want to use it directly, or because they are using the
  PlacementFixture with "real" data

The remaining changes are "we don't need placement here".

As a bonus this patch includes a slightly modified
nova/api/openstack/placement/wsgi.py which, if it is working
properly, allows a nova-placement-api WSGI app to run off the
nova.conf file, against the extracted placement code. Initial
diddling suggests it kind of works, but need to try with something
other than the built in server. Note that placement is still set up
to use either the [api_database]/connection or
[placement_database]/connection. Using the former if it is set and
falling back to the latter. This means that it would be possible to
use the placement code, but carry on with the "old" database, the
old config, and the wsgi script, if people wanted to do that sort of
thing.

The issues I'm able to identify by doing this (please follow up with
those that you think of) include:

* the nova/api/openstack/placement/lib.py file is used by both nova
  and placement for managing RequestGroup objects. However, as I
  understand things, there is, or will be some divergence on how
  these things are going to be used, so should be fine to have
  separate versions and not an actual "lib"

* The cmd and status checks that want the database need to have a
  future defined for them.

* The nova side PlacementFixture, which is a subclass of the
  placement side PlacementFixture, pretty much always needs a
  database, so it would make some sense to make that if not
  automatic then at least an option.

* The base test, when use db is true, uses the placement database.
  We should probably change that, even if we weren't going to
  extract placement.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/728735/

Change-Id: I0fada396e3c429bceeaccd321e4d82cb69e5265d

commit_message:
DNM: Make nova tests pass with externalized placement

These changes are an exploration of what it would take to get nova
"working" with placement code that comes from somewhere else. Not
because there's a plan to do anything immediately but because doing
experiments in advance helps to uncover issues so we can think about
it smoothly.

What we have here is:

* recent nova master
* nova/api/openstack/placement removed (except for lib.py)
* nova/tests/{unit,functional}/api/openstack/placement removed
* git+https://github.com/placementstuff/placement.git@cd/second-time installed
  via requirements

(Note that in order for code to be installed from git it has be installed
by pip directly, so tox.ini has been adjusted slightly to install
requirements.txt directly instead of having those things installed when
nova itself installed. This _may_ mean some tests pass in the gate.
We'll see.)

And then the changes need to get both unit and functional tests
passing. As the diff (a consolidated one without file removes is at
[1]) shows, the changes are relatively minor and can be grouped into
three (overlapping) classes:

* things that directly access objects in placement
* things that need the PlacementFixture so they have access to a
  working placement API
* things that need access to the placement db, either because they
  want to use it directly, or because they are using the
  PlacementFixture with "real" data

The remaining changes are "we don't need placement here".

As a bonus this patch includes a slightly modified
nova/api/openstack/placement/wsgi.py which, if it is working
properly, allows a nova-placement-api WSGI app to run off the
nova.conf file, against the extracted placement code. Initial
diddling suggests it kind of works, but need to try with something
other than the built in server. Note that placement is still set up
to use either the [api_database]/connection or
[placement_database]/connection. Using the former if it is set and
falling back to the latter. This means that it would be possible to
use the placement code, but carry on with the "old" database, the
old config, and the wsgi script, if people wanted to do that sort of
thing.

The issues I'm able to identify by doing this (please follow up with
those that you think of) include:

* the nova/api/openstack/placement/lib.py file is used by both nova
  and placement for managing RequestGroup objects. However, as I
  understand things, there is, or will be some divergence on how
  these things are going to be used, so should be fine to have
  separate versions and not an actual "lib"

* The cmd and status checks that want the database need to have a
  future defined for them.

* The nova side PlacementFixture, which is a subclass of the
  placement side PlacementFixture, pretty much always needs a
  database, so it would make some sense to make that if not
  automatic then at least an option.

* The base test, when use db is true, uses the placement database.
  We should probably change that, even if we weren't going to
  extract placement.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/728735/

Change-Id: I0fada396e3c429bceeaccd321e4d82cb69e5265d

subject: DNM: Use external placement in nova-next

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 20:17:17.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Use external placement in nova-next

This is an experiment to see if we can get external placement
and a hacked up devstack running a successful nova-next.

commit_message:
DNM: Use external placement in nova-next

This is an experiment to see if we can get external placement
and a hacked up devstack running a successful nova-next.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600162
Change-Id: I219fe5039d2472705030b8aeaf064e0e2844e986

commit_message:
Prevent create port forwarding to port which has binding fip

For dvr scenario, if port has a bound floating, and then create
port forwarding to it, this port forwarding will not work, due to
the traffic is redirected to dvr rules.

This patch restricts such API request, if user try to create port
forwarding to a port, check if it has bound floating IP first.
This will be run for all type of routers, since neutron should
not let user to waste public IP address on a port which already
has a floating IP, it can take care all the procotol port
numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1799137
Change-Id: I4ba4b023d79185f8d478d60ce16417d3501bf785

commit_message:
Update doc for vm_workload_consolidation strategy

Actually, the metric "cpu_util" and "memory.resident" are necessary
in vm_workload_consolidation.py, according to line 75. So modify
this document about this part.

Change-Id: I648f341184a0b42d88dcb4c934af989997fe3fea

[{'created': '2018-11-13 04:27:15.000000000', 'message': 'Set WORKDIR / in the dockerfiles

commit_message:
Set WORKDIR / in the dockerfiles

For some reason buildah is failing on images which already have a
WORKDIR set (such as the tempest image). This change sets the WORKDIR
to / to avoid this failure.

Change-Id: Id756000a3b24eac01292907ca8837a5f99c66678

commit_message:
use neutron-lib for _model_query

The model_query module is in neutron-lib and the CommonDBMixin will
eventually be removed. This patch swiches use of the _model_query
method over to query_with_hooks from neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Ifb99db6a13a9e3ad89eb5e790d89bb4451510bee

commit_message:
use context manager from neutron-lib

The neutron.db.api.context_manager already references neutron-lib's
context manager; so consumers of it are already using neutron-lib. This
patch switches neutron's references to the context_manager over to
use neutron-lib's directly rather than that in neutron.db.api.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I6bd6283b4bcc018d1e0fcd0972ec4a4278b24f3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-21 08:21:45.000000000', 'message': 'suport multi discovery service

magnum will try to use discovery url in following order:
1. discovery url which is passed when create a cluster
2. discovery service endpoint in configuration
3. if configurated discovery endpoint is differnent from
   "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" and,
   use "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" as a backup
   service

Change-Id: Ib76e2e8ea00fc9eb825625b5ec908663d890ba10
Task: 26937
'}]
commit_message:
suport multi discovery service

magnum will try to use discovery url in following order:
1. discovery url which is passed when create a cluster
2. discovery service endpoint in configuration
3. if configurated discovery endpoint is differnent from
   "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" and,
   use "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" as a backup
   service

Change-Id: Ib76e2e8ea00fc9eb825625b5ec908663d890ba10
Task: 26937

commit_message:
[UDP] Update amphora agent api ref

This patch add apt ref for new udp api, as the exsit api is too specific
haproxy. And update some affected api either.

Change-Id: Ia56377ad76e37d0cf1a4811763c226639bfa807e
Story: 2003290
Task: 24237

commit_message:
Add docker bridge ip option to the undercloud.conf

Add docker_bip option to the undercloud.conf in order
to easily override the value of: DockerNetworkOptions
through the undercloud.conf

Change-Id: Ibbf7c6101539bdf575c23295c1b9fa4bfc84cff7

commit_message:
Fix ipv6 URL formatting for pxe/iPXE

The first DHCPv6 related fix was not enough.

In testing, it appears that we were not correctly returning
the proper variables and formatting to enable the machine to
boot via IPv6.

Fixes values, wraps a bare IPv6 address as dicated by RFC standards,
and enhances unit tests.

Change-Id: I9ebfb1ff1ba53dd117988b5e2a7736e20d1041a0

is fixed. Ubuntu's documentation seems to say
IPv6 exports must not be enclosed in square
brackets. [1]

[1] http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/bionic/man5/exports.5.html

"}, {'created': '2018-10-17 00:07:01.000000000', 'message': '[CI][LVM] Run the LVM job on Bionic Beaver

We switched to running the voting LVM driver job
from Ubuntu to CentOS because the "nfs-utils"
package on Ubuntu 16.04 lacked two bug-fixes [1][2]
required to test IPv6 exports. The kernel
package has been updated on Ubuntu 18.04 [3]
and the latest package has these fixes.

Switching back to Ubuntu will also help us
move faster towards our python3-first goal
since there are no plans to support python3
in the CentOS base repositories.

[1] http://git.linux-nfs.org/?p=steved/nfs-utils.git;a=commit;h=4663c6481c294838260840d234fec7dfd3186451
[2] http://git.linux-nfs.org/?p=steved/nfs-utils.git;a=commit;h=188354e57dd8476e66ce30d647180a106da29b88
[3] https://launchpad.net/nfs-utils/+packages

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611199/
Change-Id: I8928f7ef87b0ec53a6a65f5d8964b2eee885056d
'}, {'created': '2018-10-31 20:26:28.000000000', 'message': '[CI][LVM] Run the LVM job on Bionic Beaver

commit_message:
[CI][LVM] Run the LVM job on Bionic Beaver

We switched to running the voting LVM driver job
from Ubuntu to CentOS because the "nfs-utils"
package on Ubuntu 16.04 lacked two bug-fixes [1][2]
required to test IPv6 exports. The kernel
package has been updated on Ubuntu 18.04 [3]
and the latest package has these fixes.

Switching back to Ubuntu will also help us
move faster towards our python3-first goal
since there are no plans to support python3
in the CentOS base repositories.

[1] http://git.linux-nfs.org/?p=steved/nfs-utils.git;a=commit;h=4663c6481c294838260840d234fec7dfd3186451
[2] http://git.linux-nfs.org/?p=steved/nfs-utils.git;a=commit;h=188354e57dd8476e66ce30d647180a106da29b88
[3] https://launchpad.net/nfs-utils/+packages

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611199/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604929/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614802/
Change-Id: I8928f7ef87b0ec53a6a65f5d8964b2eee885056d

subject: Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent deleting the log between runs
messages:
[{'account_id': 25100, 'date': '2018-11-20 23:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25100, 'date': '2018-11-20 23:32:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So, for the json dump format, I'm not sure we need the extra class, I think it'll only run the json.dumps() bit if it's called there. I'm not clear what the wrapper class buys us

As for the OrderedDict, as mentioned, the sorted order is helpful for me when looking at it, since I don't need to reorder it with jq when browsing the results.

My use case for it is using jq to query sets of results. I typically in this config run patrole three times for each role, and then compare the output between two files generated per-run. This helps me parse them out per-role or per-rule, etc

Changed the string log format back, and added in the choices bit to Config"}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2018-11-20 23:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-11-21 03:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

There should also be a releasenote with the addition of the 2 conf options.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-11-21 03:49:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-11-21 03:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25100, 'date': '2018-11-21 03:51:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh, I need to look into that roles thing tomorrow then. Does that mean we run a separate test per-role? I'd think it'd be better to output it per-test in that case"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-11-21 03:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Oh, I need to look into that roles thing tomorrow then. Does that
 > mean we run a separate test per-role? I'd think it'd be better to
 > output it per-test in that case

No, it just means that you can assign multiple roles to the user like "foo" and "bar" and test both jointly. It's for a use case downstream at AT&T, but essentially the old behavior is preserved if you give one role to rbac_test_roles.

Running the same test again N roles is expensive and leads to all sorts of issues related to sharing class-wide resources across the various test runs for each role, runtime issues, etc.'}, {'account_id': 25100, 'date': '2018-11-21 04:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ah, makes sense, looking over it I'm not totally sure how it changes it. It seems to just change the test for _is_allowed(). I once started to write a patch like that, but it won't run the setup and teardown, that's a good point. Blah. Ok, I'll keep running it for different roles separately"}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-11-21 06:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 23:26:43.000000000', 'message': 'Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]:
os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent",
"rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual":
"Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I7a302e571f4fb5ffb33287c8153be7f8b8e38dc8
'}]
commit_message:
Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]:
os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent",
"rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual":
"Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I7a302e571f4fb5ffb33287c8153be7f8b8e38dc8

commit_message:
changed port in tools/sample_data.sh

With the removal of the Identity v2 API, keystone now runs on
port 5000, rather than on the port 35357 which was used earlier.

Change-Id: I5a763fbf765553b00713add9f863751b418deb82

commit_message:
Handling invalid path of workspace register and move

This PS will fix the invalid value handling.
Error will be raised if no/blank value will be specified for
workspace register and workspace move for path parameter.

Change-Id: I0d9956cac27fd4dbb527fd865aa152e4724c01f9
Closes-Bug: #1799883
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage

commit_message:
Document user options

User options have been available in keystone for a few releases but
there isn't any official documentation for them.

This commit add a general section to the administrator guide that
attempts to describe each options and its type.

Change-Id: Ib0cc07236ba9083c2a35bf8ac6444ccfd19b7219
Related-Bug: 1792026

convert py35 jobs to py3

Update the jobs that were explicitly using python 3.5 and have them
just use python 3 without specifying a minor version.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 10:51:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix the undercloud-process-count validation

After containerization of several services the `pgrep` call which should return
the number of running processes doesn't work anymore (since it's executed
outside of the container where the service is running)

This patch executes the `pgrep` command inside of the appropriate container.

Note: The validation in its current form cannot make a judgement for a
realistic limit for any given situation. For that reason, this validation will
always succeed with warning(s).

Change-Id: I0cb33babae2fc285fff7fd6638c578b39e630338
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit dd979247206b1f47f128c68cdc3ea5286dcd5df7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the undercloud-process-count validation

After containerization of several services the `pgrep` call which should return
the number of running processes doesn't work anymore (since it's executed
outside of the container where the service is running)

This patch executes the `pgrep` command inside of the appropriate container.

Note: The validation in its current form cannot make a judgement for a
realistic limit for any given situation. For that reason, this validation will
always succeed with warning(s).

Change-Id: I0cb33babae2fc285fff7fd6638c578b39e630338
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit dd979247206b1f47f128c68cdc3ea5286dcd5df7)

[{'created': '2018-11-15 17:54:40.000000000', 'message': 'DNM - debug update_identifier for common deploy tasks

Change-Id: Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27
Related-Bug: #1796924
'}, {'created': '2018-11-16 18:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'Honor --skip-deploy-identifier in common deploy tasks for updates

To continue the work that was done in
I711dbb00a9c34dbd96ef179ef41bff281b0001d1, we also need to skip the common
deploy tasks if --skip-deploy-identifier is passed by the operator.

When using --skip-deploy-identifier, the UpdateIdentifier is set to
None.
Ansible doesn't see None as "", so we really need to test if the
variable is defined or not. That patches changes the logic to test that.
We also support the case where the variable is set to "", and consider
is as empty which means we want to skip the deploy/updates.
It is also doing it for the update playbooks which includes tasks from
commont deploy.

It is not replicating the exact condition as in deploy_steps_playbook.
There is no need to also check if /var/lib/docker-container-startup-configs.json
file is here because it has been created during the initial deployment.

This fix the bug where --skip-deploy-identifier wasn't honored during
stack updates.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas HervÃ© <therve@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sam Doran <sdoran@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27
Related-Bug: #1796924
(cherry picked from commit 5ac6d19f58f188328e6f850e63c65bb70eb1c4f7)
'}, {'created': '2018-11-19 14:25:42.000000000', 'message': 'Honor --skip-deploy-identifier in common deploy tasks for updates

commit_message:
Honor --skip-deploy-identifier in common deploy tasks for updates

To continue the work that was done in
I711dbb00a9c34dbd96ef179ef41bff281b0001d1, we also need to skip the common
deploy tasks if --skip-deploy-identifier is passed by the operator.

When using --skip-deploy-identifier, the UpdateIdentifier is set to
None.
Ansible doesn't see None as "", so we really need to test if the
variable is defined or not. That patches changes the logic to test that.
We also support the case where the variable is set to "", and consider
is as empty which means we want to skip the deploy/updates.
It is also doing it for the update playbooks which includes tasks from
commont deploy.

It is not replicating the exact condition as in deploy_steps_playbook.
There is no need to also check if /var/lib/docker-container-startup-configs.json
file is here because it has been created during the initial deployment.

This fix the bug where --skip-deploy-identifier wasn't honored during
stack updates.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas HervÃ© <therve@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sam Doran <sdoran@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27
Related-Bug: #1796924
(cherry picked from commit 5ac6d19f58f188328e6f850e63c65bb70eb1c4f7)

I didn't make any changes at all, so I'm confused - removing WIP but it would be good to understand why this is now passing as I'd rather not have to revert-revert-revert ;)"}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

IIUC the revert was just to land the CI fix?'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Ah, no, the CI fix just made the upgrade job voting - https://review.openstack.org/611526'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:05:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The containerized undercloud upgrade job was green also on the very first patch (i think i wouldn't have merged it otherwise): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605430/   So CI is not working as expected perhaps?"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-10-22 15:25:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

To clarify, yes the original patch passed CI on check, but the undercloud upgrade job wasn't in the gate queue at that time.

Marios raised a bug which seemed to be caused by this patch, so we reverted this patch, and landed the CI changes to ensure the undercloud upgrade was also tested in the gate pipeline.

So, I expected to push this and have to figure out why the undercloud upgrade job was failing, so my guess is CI isn't working - or the other possibility is we somehow had a stale version of tripleo-common .

If anyone can help me figure it out that would be great, as I'm not super familiar with the undercloud upgrade CI job, and I'd prefer to avoid breaking anything again :)"}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-10-23 20:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Consider root id is None in the database case

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch fixes that bug for cases there is no sharing or nested
providers in play.

Change-Id: I9639d852078c95de506110f24d3f35e7cf5e361e
Closes-Bug:#1799892

subject: Add recreate test for bug 1799892
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-09 20:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-09 20:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cherry picked from the nova change which is approved: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613304/2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-13 13:51:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ed made https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613320/ and suggested that we didn't need the pre-test if it was already happening in nova."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Ed made https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613320/ and suggested that we didn't need the pre-test if it was already happening in nova.

I'm not sure what "it was already happening in nova" means. Splitting the regression test/recreate from the fix is useful to see the failure and then that it's fixed, and it's also helpful to keep the mirror cherry-picked changes in placement as mirrors of the nova changes, so reviewers can just diff them, like cherry picks from master to stable. We don't squash those.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-20 17:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-11-21 04:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-11-09 20:52:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add recreate test for bug 1799892

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch recreate that bug by simulating the situation by
inserting the records to the database directly.

Change-Id: Iaed912314f3e8fef2f46453a6bf12011702ae1dd
Related-Bug:#1799892
'}]
commit_message:
Add recreate test for bug 1799892

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch recreate that bug by simulating the situation by
inserting the records to the database directly.

Change-Id: Iaed912314f3e8fef2f46453a6bf12011702ae1dd
Related-Bug:#1799892

Allow much newer puppet modules to be deployed when using automatic dependencies lookup.
This will allow deploying puppet5 and puppet6 compatible modules, and will prevent keeping back some core modules such as mysql.
The only exception is puppetlabs/rabbitmq which was left untouched, as this might require coordination with other openstack
puppet modules since puppetlabs/rabbitmq was handed over to puppet/rabbitmq (from Vox Pupuli) and is now version 8.4.0
(compared to the old 5.6.0 in the current requirement), and thus other openstack puppet modules should require the same module
to prevent module names collision.

puppet modules since puppetlabs/rabbitmq was handed over to puppet/rabbitmq (from Vox Pupuli) and is now version 8.4.0
(compared to the old 5.6.0 in the current requirement), and thus other openstack puppet modules should require the same module

Change-Id: I10fe1cf1429181ea3e6b325193be7b39773005b4

commit_message:
allow more recent puppet modules in metadata.json

Allow much newer puppet modules to be deployed when using automatic dependencies lookup.
This will allow deploying puppet5 and puppet6 compatible modules, and will prevent keeping back some core modules such as mysql.
The only exception is puppetlabs/rabbitmq which was left untouched, as this might require coordination with other openstack
puppet modules since puppetlabs/rabbitmq was handed over to puppet/rabbitmq (from Vox Pupuli) and is now version 8.4.0
(compared to the old 5.6.0 in the current requirement), and thus other openstack puppet modules should require the same module
to prevent module names collision.

Change-Id: I10fe1cf1429181ea3e6b325193be7b39773005b4

commit_message:
default to py3 and add fast8

- This change updates named envs to default to py3
- This change adds fast8 as an target that run
  pep8 on only the files that have changed.
- This change adds docs and releasenotes envs
  to default set and enables fast8 instead of pep8

Change-Id: If07f9331380aab1ec6da90e7b6b393509f6f3623

commit_message:
Remove invaild field "os_auth_version"

This field is unrequired any more.  It is removed from Command Line.

Change-Id: I79ab402a660fe4cd4a5318f9ee5514f0e4ec65d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-15 19:04:35.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)

commit_message:
Consider root id is None in the database case

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch fixes that bug for cases there is no sharing or nested
providers in play.

Change-Id: I9639d852078c95de506110f24d3f35e7cf5e361e
Closes-Bug:#1799892

commit_message:
Ansible json error callback plugin

This callback plugin will write any task errors (that are not
ignore_error: true) to a log file in JSON format.

In later patches, we can add the cli and workflows to make these errors
visible via the Mistral API.

Change-Id: I72a91473511f335f8a0e40c7a786ff927113f26a

[{'created': '2017-12-15 05:49:35.000000000', 'message': 'Provides detailed conductor information

In a large deployment with multiple ironic conductors incorporated,
nodes are distributed across conductors by hashring, currently we
have no mechanism to know the specific conductor for a given node.

This spec proposes providing support of retrieving such information
from ironic API.

In short:

* Add ``/v1/conductors`` to return the list of conductor in service.
* Add ``/v1/conductors/{hostname}`` to return detailed information
  including mappings of nodes.
* Update ``/v1/nodes*`` related APIs to include a ``conductor`` field
  which indicates the node where the conductor servicing a node is
  running.

Change-Id: I7da04c1775132d4112acf3e1f3f1f19cf164a144
Related-Bug: #1724474

commit_message:
Provides detailed conductor information

In a large deployment with multiple ironic conductors incorporated,
nodes are distributed across conductors by hashring. Currently we
have no mechanism to know which conductor currently is serving a
given node.

This spec proposes providing support for retrieving such information
from ironic API.

In short:

* Add ``/v1/conductors`` to return the list of known conductors.
* Add ``/v1/conductors/{hostname}`` and ``/v1/nodes/{node_ident}/conductor``
  to return more detailed information.
* Update ``/v1/nodes*`` related APIs to include a ``conductor`` field
  which indicates the hostname where the conductor serving a node is
  running. Support node querying by conductor hostname.

Story: 1724474
Task: 10629
Change-Id: I7da04c1775132d4112acf3e1f3f1f19cf164a144

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-15 17:51:37.000000000', 'message': 'DNM - debug update_identifier for common deploy tasks

Change-Id: Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27
Related-Bug: #1796924
'}, {'created': '2018-11-16 13:50:29.000000000', 'message': 'common-deploy-tasks: switch update_identifier to a boolean

When --skip-deploy-identifier, we force DeployIdentifier to be null.
The result is that update_identifier is not even set to "" but is really
empty:

update_identifier:

Ansible doesn't treat this as an empty variable but as a variable that
is set and set to something.
It can easily be reproduced with this playbook:

- hosts: localhost
  vars:
    update_identifier:
  tasks:
   - debug:
       msg: variable is not empty
     when: update_identifier|default(false) != ""
   - debug:
       msg: variable is empty
     when: update_identifier|default(false) == ""
   - debug:
       msg: variable is false
     when: not update_identifier|default(false)

ok: [localhost] => {
    "msg": "variable is not empty"
}
ok: [localhost] => {
    "msg": "variable is false"
}

So instead of testing if the variable != "", we should default to a
boolean and change the logic:
If update_identifier is set to False or if the Docker JSON files don't
exist, then we can run the common deploy tasks that configure containers
and such. Otherwise, we skip the nodes, as it is wanted by the operator
when using --skip-deploy-identifier.

Change-Id: Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27
Related-Bug: #1796924
'}, {'created': '2018-11-16 15:07:36.000000000', 'message': "Honor --skip-deploy-identifier in common deploy tasks for updates

To continue the work that was done in
I711dbb00a9c34dbd96ef179ef41bff281b0001d1, we also need to skip the common
deploy tasks if --skip-deploy-identifier is passed by the operator.

It is not replicating the exact condition as in deploy_steps_playbook.
There is no need to also check if /var/lib/docker-container-startup-configs.json
file is here because it has been created during the initial deployment.

This fix the bug where --skip-deploy-identifier wasn't honored during
stack updates.

Change-Id: Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27
Related-Bug: #1796924
"}, {'created': '2018-11-16 16:40:20.000000000', 'message': 'Honor --skip-deploy-identifier in common deploy tasks for updates

To continue the work that was done in
I711dbb00a9c34dbd96ef179ef41bff281b0001d1, we also need to skip the common

None.

variable is defined or not. That patches changes the logic to test that.

commit_message:
Honor --skip-deploy-identifier in common deploy tasks for updates

To continue the work that was done in
I711dbb00a9c34dbd96ef179ef41bff281b0001d1, we also need to skip the common
deploy tasks if --skip-deploy-identifier is passed by the operator.

When using --skip-deploy-identifier, the UpdateIdentifier is set to
None.
Ansible doesn't see None as "", so we really need to test if the
variable is defined or not. That patches changes the logic to test that.
We also support the case where the variable is set to "", and consider
is as empty which means we want to skip the deploy/updates.
It is also doing it for the update playbooks which includes tasks from
commont deploy.

It is not replicating the exact condition as in deploy_steps_playbook.
There is no need to also check if /var/lib/docker-container-startup-configs.json
file is here because it has been created during the initial deployment.

This fix the bug where --skip-deploy-identifier wasn't honored during
stack updates.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas HervÃ© <therve@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sam Doran <sdoran@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27
Related-Bug: #1796924
