commit_message:
Fixed logstash file name for tempest

* The file getting generated is tempest.log under /home/zuul/
  tempest.log not tempest-output.log that's why it is not able
  to indexed in logstash.
* And tempest_log_file var is used twice in validate-tempest role
  and tempest.log is used at each place which also leads that
  tempest_output.log was never found in ci logs.

Related-Bug:#1802971

Change-Id: I9bb9f8bdd0a17d2a1481356caaf186ed6348f6ba

commit_message:
Use a shorter default domain name

Since https://review.openstack.org/615730 we default
to <hostname>.tripleodomain.example.com if hostname is
not set.

Some of the CI jobs use very long <hostname>'s, resulting
in the FQDN to be more than 63 characters long which is
the max for linux, see GETHOSTNAME(2).

Change the default to use: <hostname>.ooo.test instead.

Also, yamllint complain about indentation.

Closes-Bug: #1803703
Change-Id: If041b1c6e1da1d89d66ffafbbc6ab6c33bd80801

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Ie69f0a6fa56fd1fceaa7893bece8b2735095216c
Related-Bug: 1801465

commit_message:
Minimal construct plumbing for nova show when a cell is down

This patch sets the stage for modifying the behavior of nova show
which currently gives a 500 when the cell in which the instance
lives is down. The new behavior will return a partial construct
consisting of uuid, project_id, created_at from instance_mappings
table and user_id, flavor, image_ref and availability_zone info
from request_specs table.  Note that the rest of the keys will be
missing. This behavior will be enabled by passing a new enough
microversion, handling for which is introduced later in this series.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: Iaea1cb4ed93bb98f451de4f993106d7891ca3682

commit_message:
Add timeout to calls for ws_client.py functions

Sometimes the 'connect_get_namespaced_pod_exec' and
rest of functions from [1] that takes timeout as a
parameter are hanging from some reason (on OS select)
although the command completed.
This patch address this issue by adding the timeout parameter.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python-base/blob/master/stream/ws_client.py

Change-Id: I9fdeaaeee3dad432135cf864a2d34198f18af705

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-13 15:30:50.000000000', 'message': 'Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]: os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent", "rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual": "Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I11f0c9cef2e06b3667d61f62114e12fa2b88b7f6
'}]
commit_message:
Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]: os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent", "rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual": "Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I11f0c9cef2e06b3667d61f62114e12fa2b88b7f6

commit_message:
ceph improvements: failure domains, root hierarchy ..etc

Added supported for SSD, HDD co-existtance
Support for failure domains based on setup
Support for root hierarchy for OSDs
Support for differeent pools for SSD/HDD/any device class
Support for multiple storage classes (SSD/HDD)
general as default storage class
rbd provisioners for HDD along with client key generator and cleaner

Story: #27999
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>
Change-Id: Ieb7b52cbb671c231b407b7603c2deb832ed93192

commit_message:
Expand retry behavior to cover other python-ovs methods

If there is a disconnect, it is possible that we could throw an
exception if we call wait() while the stream is currently set to
None. Move the try: earlier so that if something weird happens, we
at least retry before raising.

Change-Id: Ic820ab3978a3b58a41762e6fca034f62d51a0243

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 12:46:17.000000000', 'message': "Adapt placement database fixture for external use

This change makes it easier to use the placement database fixture
from external systems (mostly nova) that would like to run functional
tests with a stubbed in placement database.

A 'set_config' boolean flag is added to allow the caller to indicate
they have not themselves set a connection string in the
placement_database group and want the fixture to do so.

The fixture attempts to register the group and opt but allows
that to fail if it has already been done. This provides some
resiliency in the face of nova currently having the group and
option but not having it later.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
"}, {'created': '2018-11-14 13:54:38.000000000', 'message': "Adapt placement database fixture for external use

The fixture attempts to register the group and opt but allows
that to fail if it has already been done. This provides some
resiliency in the face of nova currently having the group and
option but not having it later.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
"}, {'created': '2018-11-14 17:32:26.000000000', 'message': "Adapt placement database fixture for external use

This change makes it easier to use the placement database fixture
from external systems (mostly nova) that would like to run functional
tests with a stubbed in placement database.

A 'set_config' boolean flag is added to allow the caller to indicate
they have not themselves set a connection string in the
placement_database group and want the fixture to do so.

The fixture attempts to register the group and opt but allows
that to fail if it has already been done. This provides some
resiliency in the face of nova currently having the group and
option but not having it later.

As a part of this, the necessary functionality of syncing traits and
resources classes is handled by the fixture itself, rather than
things that call it, meaning some cleanups in other fixtures. This
centralizes database handling in one place, which is probalby how
it should have been all along, but as with all evolving things,
it meandered.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
"}, {'created': '2018-11-15 09:50:12.000000000', 'message': "Adapt placement fixtures for external use

This change makes it easier to use the PlacementFixture from external
systems (mostly nova) that would like to run functional tests with a
stubbed in placement service, including a database.

A 'set_config' boolean flag is added to the Database fixture to allow
the caller to indicate they have not themselves set a connection string
in the placement_database group and want the fixture to do so.

That fixture attempts to register the group and opt but allows that to
fail if it has already been done. This provides some resiliency in the
face of nova currently having the group and option but not having it
later.

As a part of this, the necessary functionality of syncing traits and
resources classes is handled by the fixture itself, rather than
things that call it, meaning some cleanups in other fixtures. This
centralizes database handling in one place, which is probalby how
it should have been all along, but as with all evolving things,
it meandered.

The PlacementFixture is updated to use the Database fixture
automatically.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
"}, {'created': '2018-11-15 13:07:54.000000000', 'message': "Adapt placement fixtures for external use

This change makes it easier to use the PlacementFixture from external
systems (mostly nova) that would like to run functional tests with a
stubbed in placement service, including a database.

A 'set_config' boolean flag is added to the Database fixture to allow
the caller to indicate they have not themselves set a connection string
in the placement_database group and want the fixture to do so.

That fixture attempts to register the group and opt but allows that to
fail if it has already been done. This provides some resiliency in the
face of nova currently having the group and option but not having it
later.

As a part of this, the necessary functionality of syncing traits and
resources classes is handled by the fixture itself, rather than
things that call it, meaning some cleanups in other fixtures. This
centralizes database handling in one place, which is probalby how
it should have been all along, but as with all evolving things,
it meandered.

The PlacementFixture is updated to use the Database fixture
automatically, unless a db keyword arg is set to False.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
"}, {'created': '2018-11-16 11:31:19.000000000', 'message': "Adapt placement fixtures for external use

This change makes it easier to use the PlacementFixture from external
systems (mostly nova) that would like to run functional tests with a
stubbed in placement service, including a database.

A 'set_config' boolean flag is added to the Database fixture to allow
the caller to indicate they have not themselves set a connection string
in the placement_database group and want the fixture to do so.

That fixture attempts to register the group and opt but allows that to
fail if it has already been done. This provides some resiliency in the
face of nova currently having the group and option but not having it
later.

Because both nova and placement use global config, we need to avoid
registering and processing all of placement's config options anywhere
during the use of the fixture (from nova), otherwise errors will
happen. Therefore, we cannot use migration.upgrade in the Database
fixture, as env.py currently pulls in and processes a global config.
Instead we use a create_schema method. Migrations continue to be
tested by the migration specific tests.

The necessary functionality of syncing traits and resources classes is
handled by the fixture itself, rather than things that call it, allowing
some cleanups in other fixtures. This centralizes database handling in
one place, which is probalby how it should have been all along, but as
with all evolving things, it meandered.

The PlacementFixture is updated to use the Database fixture
automatically, unless a db keyword arg is set to False.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
"}, {'created': '2018-11-16 17:59:58.000000000', 'message': "Adapt placement fixtures for external use

automatically, unless a db keyword arg is set to False.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
"}]
commit_message:
Adapt placement fixtures for external use

This change makes it easier to use the PlacementFixture from external
systems (mostly nova) that would like to run functional tests with a
stubbed in placement service, including a database.

A 'set_config' boolean flag is added to the Database fixture to allow
the caller to indicate they have not themselves set a connection string
in the placement_database group and want the fixture to do so.

That fixture attempts to register the group and opt but allows that to
fail if it has already been done. This provides some resiliency in the
face of nova currently having the group and option but not having it
later.

Because both nova and placement use global config, we need to avoid
registering and processing all of placement's config options anywhere
during the use of the fixture (from nova), otherwise errors will
happen. Therefore, we cannot use migration.upgrade in the Database
fixture, as env.py currently pulls in and processes a global config.
Instead we use a create_schema method. Migrations continue to be
tested by the migration specific tests.

The necessary functionality of syncing traits and resources classes is
handled by the fixture itself, rather than things that call it, allowing
some cleanups in other fixtures. This centralizes database handling in
one place, which is probalby how it should have been all along, but as
with all evolving things, it meandered.

The PlacementFixture is updated to use the Database fixture
automatically, unless a db keyword arg is set to False.

Change-Id: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3

commit_message:
Use pycodestyle in place of pep8

The lower version of pycodestyle lib (aliased to pep8) doesn't work
for py36 env. This commit unblocks the py36 gate by adding a
dependency on pycodestyle and using that for style checks.

Bump the "hacking" lib version to v1.1.0 which depends
on a higher verion of pycodestyle.

Change-Id: I3fc591e09c1e25a3bd2a3922880772ea9617f1e3

 > > instance running external command "rm a_very_large_file" in a
 > > python agent.
 > 
 > For this issue here, I suspect the RPC connection green thread did
 > not switch well.

Yes, it might be like You are saying. And in such case I prefer to make tests pass rather then rechecking :)
In real world even if something like that would happen I think it would be killed by systemd or other init system which handles such daemons.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-11-15 13:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 20:44:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add kill_timeout to AsyncProcess

AsyncProcess.stop() method has now additional parameter
kill_timeout. If this is set to some value different than
None, eventlet.green.subprocess.Popen.wait() will be called
with this timeout, so TimeoutExpired exception will be raised
in case if process will not be killed for this "kill_timeout"
time.
In such case process will be killed "again" with SIGKILL signal
to make sure that it is gone.

This should fix problem with failing fullstack tests, when
ovs_agent process is sometimes not killed and test timeout was
reached in this wait() method.

Change-Id: I1e12255e5e142c395adf4e67be9d9da0f7a3d4fd

commit_message:
Add kill_timeout to AsyncProcess

AsyncProcess.stop() method has now additional parameter
kill_timeout. If this is set to some value different than
None, eventlet.green.subprocess.Popen.wait() will be called
with this timeout, so TimeoutExpired exception will be raised
in case if process will not be killed for this "kill_timeout"
time.
In such case process will be killed "again" with SIGKILL signal
to make sure that it is gone.

This should fix problem with failing fullstack tests, when
ovs_agent process is sometimes not killed and test timeout was
reached in this wait() method.

Change-Id: I1e12255e5e142c395adf4e67be9d9da0f7a3d4fd
Closes-Bug: #1798472

commit_message:
Address known issue with ambiguous interfaces

nova-cloud-controller now includes new amqp-cell and shared-db-cell
interfaces which may cause ambiguous relation errors while deploying
legacy bundles. Addressed in 18.11 release notes doc.

Change-Id: I4cf4b2b8870fbc6eaa2c21fd20c9428e38cc28de
Related-Bug: #1804301

commit_message:
Add dhcrelay example to using old syntax

"DHCP relay configuration (Example)" section works for
more recent versions 4.3.6 (in Fedora), but it doesn't
work with the version in 4.2.5 (CentOS 7).

Add example configuration for version 4.2.5 (Centos)
as well.

Closes-Bug: #1774637

commit_message:
Add placement-status upgrade check command

This adds the basic framework for the
placement-status upgrade check command which
is a community-wide goal for the Stein release.

A simple placeholder check is added which should
be replaced later when we have a real upgrade
check.

Change-Id: I9291386fe7fcbfc035c104ea9fdbe5eb875c4776
Story: 2003657
Task: 27518

[{'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-09-04 03:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-09-04 14:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-09-05 02:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Open question from other review -https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576261/5

I can see current bugs in LP [1]. So my main question about this migration is (may be for storyboard team) 

1. will those current bugs will be migrated to Storyboard ? This is needed to track the current ongoing bugs. These has to be migrated to storyboard before marking the project as use_storyboard=true in project-config.
<Felipe replied on this to migrate manually as those are not big number. i did one - https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003660>

2. will fixed bugs [2] will be migrated to Storyboard ? This is needed for history purpose. if i want to check the released bug and their discussion then should i go and look LP or storyboard if they can also be migrated.

After above 2 question clarification, we will follow the other migration step like closing the LP and inform all stackholders via email also.  - https://docs.openstack.org/infra/storyboard/migration.html


[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/patrole

[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/patrole/+bugs?field.searchtext=&orderby=-importance&field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=OPINION&field.status%3Alist=INVALID&field.status%3Alist=WONTFIX&field.status%3Alist=EXPIRED&field.status%3Alist=CONFIRMED&field.status%3Alist=TRIAGED&field.status%3Alist=INPROGRESS&field.status%3Alist=FIXCOMMITTED&field.status%3Alist=FIXRELEASED&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITHOUT_RESPONSE&assignee_option=any&field.assignee=&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=&field.structural_subscriber=&field.tag=&field.tags_combinator=ANY&field.has_cve.used=&field.omit_dupes.used=&field.omit_dupes=on&field.affects_me.used=&field.has_patch.used=&field.has_branches.used=&field.has_branches=on&field.has_no_branches.used=&field.has_no_branches=on&field.has_blueprints.used=&field.has_blueprints=on&field.has_no_blueprints.used=&field.has_no_blueprints=on&search=Search'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-09-05 03:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

adding storyboard folks to clarify those query and then we can go ahead with this migration.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-09-05 03:58:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

@gmann I think if we want history we need to do migration correctly; I just thought it would be OK to move forward as we don't have too many people adding stuff to LP. But I do agree for future contributors it is important to keep this history.

I added +2 here as this is for consistency but I'm OK if we revert the SB references in our README and some other places and use LP until the migration is over, as I think the inconsistency is bad.

Hopefully we can resolve during PTG - I haven't had much time to deal with these admin things lately but I agree this is important and we need to do a better job of following the guide."}, {'account_id': 28239, 'date': '2018-09-05 04:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-09-05 06:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> @gmann I think if we want history we need to do migration
 > correctly; I just thought it would be OK to move forward as we
 > don't have too many people adding stuff to LP. But I do agree for
 > future contributors it is important to keep this history.
 > 
 > I added +2 here as this is for consistency but I'm OK if we revert
 > the SB references in our README and some other places and use LP
 > until the migration is over, as I think the inconsistency is bad.
 > 
 > Hopefully we can resolve during PTG - I haven't had much time to
 > deal with these admin things lately but I agree this is important
 > and we need to do a better job of following the guide.

Yeah, main thing i want is to close the LP once we update the README otherwise it will be confusion for users. and I am waiting to close the LP till migration things."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-09-05 13:37:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It looks like https://review.openstack.org/575182 set patrole to use storyboard but none of the people usually involved in migrating existing bugs from launchpad were made aware. It's a manual process, but i can go ahead and do that import at any time you like."}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-09-15 14:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-09-15 14:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

it work with me'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-09-18 02:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

we discussed it in PTG and once we move the BP to storyboard then we are good to proceed on this - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/migration-from-lp-to-sb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 23:24:35.000000000', 'message': 'Switch Puppet 6 jobs to non-voting

The Puppet OpenStack jobs have added a unit test job for puppet 6.0 but
puppet-tripleo is not ready. This change defines our own job templates
to switch the 6.0 and latest jobs to non-voting.

Change-Id: I82c02bf50f18d5953ba0ced48bcf9aa859739f42
'}]
commit_message:
Switch Puppet 6 jobs to non-voting

The Puppet OpenStack jobs have added a unit test job for puppet 6.0 but
puppet-tripleo is not ready. This change defines our own job templates
to switch the 6.0 and latest jobs to non-voting.

Change-Id: I82c02bf50f18d5953ba0ced48bcf9aa859739f42

commit_message:
Load files from adopt file when adopt stack

Add files from adopt file into create fields. This allow us to
adopt nested stack which the template defined in files.
Story: #1700744
Task: #17263

Change-Id: I2b473791186949d49be59ee790185b3e394c7000

commit_message:
Added playbooks to snapshot and revert snapshot MNAIO deployments

With the move to lvm back MNAIO, the need for snapshot automation
around the MNAIO environments changed. This commit adds the ability
to both snapshot and revert snapshot MNAIO environments

Change-Id: I2596f6692278d6cb549322c7ea3a44ac7c6fa497

'}, {'created': '2018-10-29 17:26:59.000000000', 'message': "Add a placement-manage CLI

This change adds a rudimentary command line tool, 'placement-manage'
that can do three things:

* placement version: report the current version of the software
* placement db sync: sync the db to the 'head' alembic version
* placement db version: report the current version of the db

It is written following the examples set by both nova and ironic for
using oslo config driven command line parsing. It is not as full
featured as the nova version (with decorators for argument handling and
help text etc) because we don't need that yet. There's plenty of room
for improvement.

Probably need to figure out some way to do tests, advice desired, but
wanted to get this version out in the air for peole to see.

Future changes would include being able to target a specific db
version and (if we can't avoid it) tools for initiating migrations
from the command line.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/600162/
Change-Id: I1ff472106610150a587f5286f26a6bd7c1aa84f4

"}, {'created': '2018-11-03 10:14:44.000000000', 'message': "Add a placement-manage CLI

This change adds a rudimentary command line tool, 'placement-manage'
that can do three things:

* placement version: report the current version of the software
* placement db sync: sync the db to the 'head' alembic version
* placement db version: report the current version of the db

It is written following the examples set by both nova and ironic for
using oslo config driven command line parsing. It is not as full
featured as the nova version (with decorators for argument handling and
help text etc) because we don't need that yet. There's plenty of room
for improvement.

Probably need to figure out some way to do tests, advice desired, but
wanted to get this version out in the air for peole to see.

Future changes would include being able to target a specific db
version and (if we can't avoid it) tools for initiating online
migrations from the command line.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/600162/
Change-Id: I1ff472106610150a587f5286f26a6bd7c1aa84f4

This change adds a rudimentary command line tool, 'placement-manage'
that can do three things:

* placement-manage --version: report the current version of the software
* placement-manage db sync: sync the db to the 'head' alembic version
* placement-manage db version: report the current version of the db

we need them to be otherwise.

The provided unit tests cover that the arg parsing behaves as expected
and that the right commands are connected the right args. The actual
functionality of the 'db sync' command (a migration.upgrade) is tested
in runs that use devstack as well as the test_migrations functional
test.

Errors during the migration simply raise exceptions which will output
noisily to the console. At this stage this is desirable and suitable.

A new doc for the cli is added, with basic information for
placement-manage. Note that at this time the deployment documentation
has not been updated. That will be done in a later change.

Future changes may include (if we can't avoid it) tools for initiating
online migrations from the command line.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/600162/

commit_message:
Add a placement-manage CLI

This change adds a rudimentary command line tool, 'placement-manage'
that can do three things:

* placement-manage --version: report the current version of the software
* placement-manage db sync: sync the db to the 'head' alembic version
* placement-manage db version: report the current version of the db

It is written following the examples set by both nova and ironic for
using oslo config driven command line parsing. It is not as full
featured as the nova version (with decorators for argument handling and
help text etc) because we don't need that yet. There's plenty of room
for improvement, but the intention here is to keep things simple until
we need them to be otherwise.

The provided unit tests cover that the arg parsing behaves as expected
and that the right commands are connected the right args. The actual
functionality of the 'db sync' command (a migration.upgrade) is tested
in runs that use devstack as well as the test_migrations functional
test.

Errors during the migration simply raise exceptions which will output
noisily to the console. At this stage this is desirable and suitable.

A new doc for the cli is added, with basic information for
placement-manage. Note that at this time the deployment documentation
has not been updated. That will be done in a later change.

Future changes may include (if we can't avoid it) tools for initiating
online migrations from the command line.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/600162/
Change-Id: I1ff472106610150a587f5286f26a6bd7c1aa84f4

commit_message:
Enable extra playbooks to run post-deployment

Take advantage of zuul job config to set additional var for
running extra playbooks post deployment. In the job config, add:

playbooks_extra:
  - 1.yml
  - 2.yml
  ...
  
Use case is adding a list of playbooks that exists in tqe or stands in a
project gated by tqe quickstart-extras-requirements.txt as browbeat[1].
Ultimate goal is to run post deployment playbook(s) without changing
the logic that calls inner playbooks.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/61e5caf35aaa522279367b44fb65d2d2a1d3e632/roles/nodepool-setup/tasks/clone-ci-repos.yml#L39

Change-Id: I2dc969bcc4c03b703deb74fcc39eb50e4b7d8e58

commit_message:
Set libvirt_type kvm for baremetal overcloud deploy

Enable kvm when supported, fallback to qemu otherwise.
This is an extension (baremetal version) of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587572.

Change-Id: I5509d70ca65a21ebba6ae805d2da2ea60520e951

commit_message:
Support of the boolean advertise_extra_routes

This Boolean attribute is added to the Router Association resource
(Neutron API, 'bgpvpn' and 'bgpvpn-routes-control' API extensions) in
order to support routes control. This allow to propagate routes of
subnets not directly connected to the router
The corresponding code in networking-bgpvpn has already merged

See https://blueprints.launchpad.net/bgpvpn/+spec/routes-control

Change-Id: Icdd7f6592a9d657b6414645406f06b74b6f3bb11
Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
Consider volume in 'reserved' status as detachment in progress

It's possible that a volume can end up in `reserved` state
when volume attachment fails. We should wait for it to be
available when detaching.

Change-Id: Ieb1d12ea9d7c8c76c448387fadfb2e4dbf4cbb2e
Story: #2003789
Task: 26497

This reverts commit faaf96bfb15c5f4c45a72b149dc6fe1e1f907a71.

commit_message:
Hide change password button for non-admin

Fix the policy so that non-admin users isn't
shown the "Change password" button when listing
users in the Identity dashboard.

Partial bug as the bug #1788384 is also about
the self-service password changing UX is bad
and confusing.

Change-Id: If842731545b41e50f4bd457e5668dcc9241b0dbd
Partial-Bug: 1788384

[{'created': '2018-11-14 07:59:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add CellsV2 FAQ about API design decisions

At the Stein summit (and previous discussions) the topic of exposing
cellsv2 out of the API came up again. This patch adds two FAQ entries
reflecting my notes from early design decisions about why we did not
want to do that, along with more recent examples, such as FFU.

These are my feelings on the subject and I was asked to put these into
FAQ form for posterity to make the discussion easier in the future. I
would recommend that we agree on these and then codify them here.

Change-Id: I0499e141456fcca63f95bad25503c4e86c6aa369

commit_message:
Add CellsV2 FAQ about API design decisions

At the Stein summit (and previous discussions) the topic of exposing
cellsv2 out of the API came up again. This patch adds two FAQ entries
reflecting my notes from early design decisions about why we did not
want to do that, along with more recent examples, such as FFU.

These are my feelings on the subject and I was asked to put these into
FAQ form for posterity to make the discussion easier in the future. I
would recommend that we agree on these and then codify them here.

Change-Id: I0499e141456fcca63f95bad25503c4e86c6aa369

subject: Make placement direct usable from nova test
messages:
[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-09-10 23:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-11 00:37:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We don't want to ask for a migration every time PlacementDirect is might be used. If we do, it's not fit for purpose where it is used for its original purpose: talking to placement from various situations without HTTP.

For the report client test we probably want to handle the database outside of creating the PlacementDirect context manager.

I'm not actually certain what the perfect way to do it is, but it's definitely the case that we don't want to force the migration every time direct is used."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-09-11 01:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> We don't want to ask for a migration every time PlacementDirect is
 > might be used. If we do, it's not fit for purpose where it is used
 > for its original purpose: talking to placement from various
 > situations without HTTP.

"talking to placement from various situations without HTTP."

What is and where is placement in this case? It is still a standalone service just without the HTTP server? 

If yes then instantiating a new PlacementDirect would mean attaching the PlacementDirect instance to that standalone service. This also means somebody needs initialize placement before the first instance of PlacementDirect is created.

 > 
 > For the report client test we probably want to handle the database
 > outside of creating the PlacementDirect context manager.

That would pretty much the same as using PlacementFixture and that is how other nova tests sets up placement in the test env. 

 > 
 > I'm not actually certain what the perfect way to do it is, but it's
 > definitely the case that we don't want to force the migration every
 > time direct is used.

I think we have to go back to what is the intended use of PlacementDirect. Today it is only used in a report client tests but for that use case we already have PlacementFixture that is more complete.

If PlacementDirect intended to be a lib version of placement without any standalon server then I think this lib should hide implementation details like the need of placement db creation from the users of the lib. 

Now I think it would be cleaner to refactor the report client test in nova to use the PlacementFixture instead as the rest of the nova tests.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-11 01:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> "talking to placement from various situations without HTTP."
 > 
 > What is and where is placement in this case? It is still a
 > standalone service just without the HTTP server?

It's basically an installed service but without the web server turned on. Or another way to think of it is in-process access to the placement service.

The originating use case was for fast forward upgraded: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/reshape-provider-tree.html#direct-interface-to-placement

 > If yes then instantiating a new PlacementDirect would mean
 > attaching the PlacementDirect instance to that standalone service.

The placement direct instance is in the same process as the standalone service which may also be the same process as whatever is wanting to be a "client" of placement. In those contexts that process is presumably responsible for making sure there is a database for placement.

 > This also means somebody needs initialize placement before the
 > first instance of PlacementDirect is created.

Yes.

 > I think we have to go back to what is the intended use of
 > PlacementDirect.

See above.

 > If PlacementDirect intended to be a lib version of placement
 > without any standalon server then I think this lib should hide
 > implementation details like the need of placement db creation from
 > the users of the lib.

PlacementDirect is intended to be _part_ of a lib version of placement, but not the whole thing. It simply provides the context for pretending to talk over the API.

 > Now I think it would be cleaner to refactor the report client test
 > in nova to use the PlacementFixture instead as the rest of the nova
 > tests.

That may be. I don't have much of an opinion either way. Eric may have some thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-19 19:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Now I think it would be cleaner to refactor the report client test
> > in nova to use the PlacementFixture instead as the rest of the nova
> > tests.

> That may be. I don't have much of an opinion either way. Eric may have some thoughts.

Well, I spent some time going back through the changes where I made the report client tests use PlacementDirect. I think my immediate impetus was simply resolving a TODO [1]. But looking through it again, I still feel as though the PlacementDirect route is more elegant. I really don't like the fact that PlacementFixture has mocks for get/put/post/delete which have actual logic in them. This is pretty brittle; means we'll have to change the fixture (hopefully we notice!) if we ever e.g. implement a PATCH route or add a new header or whatever. That said, I really can't speak to whether we're violating the "intent" of PlacementDirect (whatever that may be) by using it for tests.

Fundamentally, aren't PlacementFixture and PlacementDirect doing the same thing, though? They're both hacking a noauth wsgi app thingy and using RequestsInterceptor. I even seem to remember (or maybe I'm making it up) that we wanted to consolidate and get rid of PlacementFixture, or make it a thin wrapper around PlacementDirect.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574470/3/nova/tests/functional/test_report_client.py@a92'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-21 11:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> But looking through it
 > again, I still feel as though the PlacementDirect route is more
 > elegant. I really don't like the fact that PlacementFixture has
 > mocks for get/put/post/delete which have actual logic in them. This
 > is pretty brittle; means we'll have to change the fixture
 > (hopefully we notice!) if we ever e.g. implement a PATCH route or
 > add a new header or whatever.

That's a good point. I've never liked those mocks either which is why I left them out of the placement-side  'PlacementFixture' when I was unteasing it from the nova 'PlacementFixture'.

The adapter model is pretty nice.

 > That said, I really can't speak to
 > whether we're violating the "intent" of PlacementDirect (whatever
 > that may be) by using it for tests.
 
I don't reckon the intent of PlacementDirect has stayed steady. The original impetus was the non-http fast forward upgrade solution (and to some extent cinder stand-alone) but both of those plans are completely up in the air as far as I can tell.

You're right: The fixture and direct are doing the same thing. The important magic is the wsgi intercept. That concept is the same and the same usefulness whether it is for testing or "direct" (whatever that is).

So unless there's some clear reason not to use direct maybe that's the thing placement should expose (with a clear contract of "you need to set up the database first") and nova can wrap that in whatever tidy way it likes.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-21 15:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> So unless there's some clear reason not to use direct maybe that's the thing placement should expose (with a clear contract of "you need to set up the database first") and nova can wrap that in whatever tidy way it likes.

++ ^ this'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-20 19:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We went with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617935/ instead'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 23:14:32.000000000', 'message': 'Make placement direct usable from nova test

The report client test in nova uses placement.direct to have a placement

commit_message:
Make placement direct usable from nova test

The report client test in nova uses placement.direct to have a placement
instance in the test env instead of a PlacementFixture. However so far
importing placement.direct does not made sure that the database for
the in-process placement is created. This patch adds this step

Change-Id: I306507a41fdc6bed8ac6cbb5019e8fcb4782fe27

commit_message:
Make placement fixture usable from nova

Nova functional test depends on a placement fixture. This patch add the
absolute import to the fixture in placement repo to make it importable
from nova.

Then Nova can import the placement fixture from placement repo during
functional test to run that test against the placement code in the
placement repo.

Change-Id: I72836ffe4cb2eed1ec121a8d64ec3812231cb632

commit_message:
Fix bug of updating metadata for images

Glance project has a blueprint hidden-images. The commit can be
seen from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578755/
The os_hidden is added into image metadata as bool type. From
horizon, the string value of os_hidden is passed to glanceclient.
https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/v2/images.py#L341
But type is not correspond so raise exception to horizon from
glanceclient.

Here to change the type of os_hidden before passing it to glanceclient.

Closes-Bug: #1789172
Change-Id: I0d4edaa4b661d2da79cdb45e4afa97d826aeb65d

commit_message:
Add support to select rspec-puppet version

The plan is that we fix up the non-voting latest unit
test job and make sure it uses puppet 6.0.4 and
rspec-puppet 2.7.1 and then use that to work our way
through the modules and fix the testing.

When that is done we can update all unit testing to
use rspec-puppet 2.7.1

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618915/
Change-Id: I6b8a540a8f52512d491a1250159ddfc60a1b55e2

commit_message:
Correct host only routes

The host only route was adding the cidr twice which is wrong. This
change adds the missing network filter to correct the issue.

Change-Id: Ic280db301ce44b98ac35c8911999dec5fa263a29
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit ca24797261225e615e9e88745460649f32427983)

commit_message:
remove profiler opt setup in db api

The logic to setup the profiler opts, including the set_hook function,
already lives in neutron_lib.db.api and is being used. This patch
removes that duplicated logic from neutron.db.api.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ice242632634f0bbcae88c6b1ea0b161ef9f0c8bb

But, if we want to change the 'vlan-transparent' in network,
the 'neutron net-update' didn't work.

But, if we want to change the 'vlan-transparent' in network,

commit_message:
Add 'vlan-transparent' as parameter into the net-update.

We implement the vlan-transparent for openvswitch Ml2 driver, when
we create network, we can set the 'vlan-transparent' property.
But, if we want to change the 'vlan-transparent' in network,
the 'neutron net-update' didn't work.

Change-Id: Ic700d0a5207c91f5d69f1e1c2d206a2a5d66782a
Closes-bug: #1777746

commit_message:
Fix tag filtering for subnets, ports, routers and subnetpools

Neutron can add tags to subnets, ports, routes, and subnetpools, but it cannot
be filtered by the tags-any, not-tags, and not-tags-any parameters. Resources
can be filtered by adding additional filtering attributes.

Change-Id: I34552e35568a27492e1c83e470f4e8c3a2fb5c50
Closes-bug: #1794695

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 13:43:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix functional tests timeout race condition

The test_idl_run_exception_terminates test sometimes fails in the gate
with the following error;

ovsdbapp.exceptions.TimeoutException: Commands
[<ovsdbapp.schema.open_vswitch.commands.BridgeExistsCommand object at
0x7fcec0639150>] exceeded timeout 1 seconds

This seems to be due to another test called
test_post_commit_vswitchd_incomplete_timeout setting the transaction
timeout to 1 second. If the tests runs concurrently there's a chance
that such change would also affect the other tests.

This patch is changing the way that we force a timeout for the
test_post_commit_vswitchd_incomplete_timeout test by mocking the
timeout_exceed() method to return True within the scope of that patch
only.

Change-Id: I3f391f0b80285a2418987e2c51985732fa2cc352
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix functional tests timeout race condition

The test_idl_run_exception_terminates test sometimes fails in the gate
with the following error;

ovsdbapp.exceptions.TimeoutException: Commands
[<ovsdbapp.schema.open_vswitch.commands.BridgeExistsCommand object at
0x7fcec0639150>] exceeded timeout 1 seconds

This seems to be due to another test called
test_post_commit_vswitchd_incomplete_timeout setting the transaction
timeout to 1 second. If the tests runs concurrently there's a chance
that such change would also affect the other tests.

This patch is changing the way that we force a timeout for the
test_post_commit_vswitchd_incomplete_timeout test by mocking the
timeout_exceed() method to return True within the scope of that patch
only.

Change-Id: I3f391f0b80285a2418987e2c51985732fa2cc352
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

subject: Don't heartbeat manually in the cloudkitty orchestrator
messages: [{'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-06 14:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-11-14 15:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-20 17:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 14:51:58.000000000', 'message': "Don't heartbeat manually in the cloudkitty orchestrator

This fixes cloudkitty-processor randomly crashing when releasing locks.

Until now, heartbeating was done manually after each collect period,
once all tenants have been processed. However, the first collect period
is generally much longer than the following ones, given that the tenant workers
need to catch up with the current date.
Because of that, too much times passes between the moment where the coordinator
is created and the first heartbeat. This causes locks to be automatically
released, which leads to an error when we try to release them manually.

This issue is fixed by letting the tooz coordinator taking care of
heartbeating.

Change-Id: If82f5981645032dcc649ea6e29cfdf8b1054b01e
Story: 2004270
Task: 27817
"}]
commit_message:
Don't heartbeat manually in the cloudkitty orchestrator

This fixes cloudkitty-processor randomly crashing when releasing locks.

Until now, heartbeating was done manually after each collect period,
once all tenants have been processed. However, the first collect period
is generally much longer than the following ones, given that the tenant workers
need to catch up with the current date.
Because of that, too much times passes between the moment where the coordinator
is created and the first heartbeat. This causes locks to be automatically
released, which leads to an error when we try to release them manually.

This issue is fixed by letting the tooz coordinator taking care of
heartbeating.

Change-Id: If82f5981645032dcc649ea6e29cfdf8b1054b01e
Story: 2004270
Task: 27817

commit_message:
Fix pep8 stricter requirement about backslash (W605)

Python will become stricter about backslash requirement and all
unknown escape sequence will be forbidden.  PEP8 adjusted for that and
raises a W605 error.

Change-Id: Id9404f4e10bfa7b1b207a40f71832b269f7cfbb6
Closes-Bug: #1799926

commit_message:
Enable Ceph charts to be rack aware for CRUSH

Add support for a rack level CRUSH map. Rack level CRUSH support is
enabled by using the "rack_replicated_rule" crush rule.

Change-Id: I4df224f2821872faa2eddec2120832e9a22f4a7c

[{'created': '2018-10-04 16:17:38.000000000', 'message': "Mark Huawei Volume Driver Unsupported

The Huawei Volume Driver has not successfully run 3rd Party CI
in nearly 4 months.  This is outside of the CI requirements for
Cinder so we are marking the driver as unsupported.  If the
CI problems are not resovled, the driver will be removed in the
'T' release.

Change-Id: I1e00fd43a53d034d1b6e3cb01523333ac88f44b1
"}]
commit_message:
Mark Huawei Volume Driver Unsupported

The Huawei Volume Driver has not successfully run 3rd Party CI
in nearly 4 months.  This is outside of the CI requirements for
Cinder so we are marking the driver as unsupported.  If the
CI problems are not resovled, the driver will be removed in the
'T' release.

Change-Id: I1e00fd43a53d034d1b6e3cb01523333ac88f44b1

subject: Add support for setting the libvirt connection uri
messages:
[{'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-11-14 17:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-11-15 13:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-16 12:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Do you also need to pass the URI to libvirt-host?'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-11-16 13:21:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

stackhpc.libvirt-host determines the connection URI. We don't know what it should be until we have run that role. Ideally we would use the connection URI returned by this role to set the others - not sure of a nice way of doing this though."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-16 13:26:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> stackhpc.libvirt-host determines the connection URI. We don't know
 > what it should be until we have run that role. Ideally we would use
 > the connection URI returned by this role to set the others - not
 > sure of a nice way of doing this though.

But we configure the URI for libvirt-vm etc via libvirt_local_uri, which we need to know before running libvirt-host because they're both run via a single command."}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-11-19 14:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-11-19 14:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I went with the suggestion, but could we not store the connection URI in the state? commit_message:
Add support for setting the libvirt connection uri

This, for example, allows you to run libvirt with non-default
socket path.

Story: 2004344
Task: 27935

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.3.2

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.3.2.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I22dec4ff510123520a2c035c3fa1c80f18ce4cdd
Closes-Bug:  #1801360

commit_message:
Consider root id is None in the database case

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a KeyError.

This patch fixes that bug for cases there is no sharing or nested
providers in play.

NOTE: This is simply a port of the work Tetsuro Nakamura did in the Nova
tree in I9639d852078c95de506110f24d3f35e7cf5e361e. I contributed nothing
except copying some diffs.

Co-Authored-By: Tetsuro Nakamura <nakamura.tetsuro@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Related-Bug:#1799892

Change-Id: I722500034d7855b655deb2464e744689a0174a62

commit_message:
WIP: heat-run

This is an experiment which tries to take from lessons on the
standalone deployment and more recently heat-all to deploy a template
without having Heat running as a service. It basically bypasses the API
to talk directly to the RPC API, just running the RPC service for that
one operation.

Change-Id: I6da6551dffebe6d9a4d14f01e03542606adb953b

commit_message:
Move update_parameters from action to workflow

The update_parameters action started to be slower than the RPC timeout.
Until we find why it's so slow, it shouldn't hurt (much) to turn it into
a workflow.

Change-Id: I3ede64249f2940764a5a42a898c7a4de5d95b0d4

commit_message:
Fix race condition in test_security_groups

Listing security groups and taking the first one to change
rules doesn't give any warranty listed security group is
exactly the one used to create servers ports.

This avoids this problem by creating a security group and
passing it to server instead of having to search for it
after the server has been created.

Despite a test cases require a general refactory this should
at least fix the CI job intermittent failures related to
this test.

Partial-Bug: #1801306
Change-Id: I5ecb3c8711e7455e7f1588943a2ffd08ce154578

subject: do not expect to match the scheme://host:port/ part
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-16 10:49:28.000000000', 'message': 'do not expect to match the scheme://host:port/ part

api could be running behind a proxy such as the tls proxy run by
devstack. In such cases the url will not be match the baseurl known to
the client, as client will derive url from keystone catalogue.

Change-Id: Ie665240b53df92b8e5ca509e998e95d859bd5282
'}]
commit_message:
do not expect to match the scheme://host:port/ part

api could be running behind a proxy such as the tls proxy run by
devstack. In such cases the url will not be match the baseurl known to
the client, as client will derive url from keystone catalogue.

Change-Id: Ie665240b53df92b8e5ca509e998e95d859bd5282

commit_message:
Add centos-7 job with support to python-tempestconf

Since os_tempest already have support to python-tempestconf, it's a good
idea to have a job, non-voting for now, testing it.

Change-Id: I069ee9f90778842c1c1493473e914ad0b3e9af0b

commit_message:
Temporarily disable pypi releases for openstack/ara

This is to prevent the release of a tag which is not meant to be
uploaded to pypi.
We'll delete the feature/1.0 branch and tag it's tip for historical
purposes.

Change-Id: I411cc9b0ac7b8c2f0f0ac9f2af2040e3e3543366

commit_message:
Add puppet core providers for puppet6

In puppet 6 they have moved out a lot of builtin
resources to their owns modules since they didn't
belong in the Puppet core however in deb/rpm packaging
they are still bundled in but not when installing from
gem.

So we must add them in here so that they are available
in our unit tests.

Change-Id: I7060191395eff9c1e3146cb10594a38bef113117

commit_message:
Use loop_var name in when clause

The name of the loop_var should be used instead of 'item' in when
clauses.

Change-Id: I8beb383f6c20425ff3bba541de37249a02364b3e
(cherry picked from commit 829d3f5f01578defdc292a640e0be4c299ac2889)

subject: Fully log RBAC enforcement data
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 8116, 'name': 'John Dennis', 'email': 'jdennis@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdennis'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 22136, 'name': 'Harry Rybacki', 'email': 'hrybacki@gmail.com'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-11-19 23:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-11-20 00:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I submitted this against Rocky because I thought Morgan was actively re-writing a lot of the policy code in master, but I see this code is still identical in master so the commit should probably be against master and not Rocky.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-11-20 13:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> I submitted this against Rocky because I thought Morgan was
 > actively re-writing a lot of the policy code in master, but I see
 > this code is still identical in master so the commit should
 > probably be against master and not Rocky.

I agree, we should consider fixing this in master first, then figure out backports.

I left a comment on the bug report, but we might be able to avoid re-implementing this fix across services if we keep it in a common place (oslo.policy). I doubt all OpenStack services are logging this information consistently, which means they might be susceptible to the same issue.

Thanks for the patch, John.'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Lance, this should have been submitted against master. I will abandon this review and resubmit against master.

I also agree with Lance's point that getting the logging into a central location in oslo.policy makes sense. However, I don't think that separate effort should prevent us from fixing what is currently in Keystone. If and when oslo.policy gets fixed and there is duplicate logging we can remove our logging at that juncture, until that point let's make our logging useful. Henry Nash has already flagged this as an issue in keystone/common/autorization.py with this comment:

    # TODO(henry-nash) need to log the target attributes as well

Digging through the oslo.policy code and it's commits I discovered comments along the line of "oslo.policy can't log properly". I don't know what the problem is but if there is some architectural problem we might not get logging from oslo.policy in the near term. Also for some reason there is no logging of rule evaluation in olso.policy so you can't even debug which atomic rule in a sequence of rules is causing the failure. Somewhere I did see a comment in oslo.policy along the lines of "we can't log rule evaluation but rules are so simple this limitation won't be a problem in practice".'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Submitted against wrong branch, should have been master.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is 100% encompassed in the RBAC Enforcer. Rule Name, Credential Data, and Target Data are emitted in debug.

Rocky will not see all of the data as not everything was under flask/RBACEnforcer. Stein will emit this data.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:56:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/5ff37f10280639737527226ca4bd97919d3725ea/keystone/common/rbac_enforcer/enforcer.py#L403-L426'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 23:52:54.000000000', 'message': "Fully log RBAC enforcement data

Data passed to the RBAC enforce function consistes of 3 items:

* rule name
* credential data
* target data

Both the credential and target are dicts. When policy enforcement do
not work as expected it's essential to capture the input to the
enforcement engine as ascertain why the rule did not work as
expected. It would also be highly advantageous if the logging were in
a format that could be digested by other tools
(e.g. oslopolicy-checker).

This patch does two things:

1) It logs the target data (which was previously omitted)

2) It eschews the use of Python's string formatting which may not
fully dump the contents of the dict and is not easily parsed in favor
of using JSON format which does full capture the object's content and
can be used in data exchange (an can be read by oslopolicy-checker).

Closes-Bug: #1804073

Change-Id: I4684f479cefe9d58e474a56b233398172d93f77c
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fully log RBAC enforcement data

Data passed to the RBAC enforce function consistes of 3 items:

* rule name
* credential data
* target data

Both the credential and target are dicts. When policy enforcement do
not work as expected it's essential to capture the input to the
enforcement engine as ascertain why the rule did not work as
expected. It would also be highly advantageous if the logging were in
a format that could be digested by other tools
(e.g. oslopolicy-checker).

This patch does two things:

1) It logs the target data (which was previously omitted)

2) It eschews the use of Python's string formatting which may not
fully dump the contents of the dict and is not easily parsed in favor
of using JSON format which does full capture the object's content and
can be used in data exchange (an can be read by oslopolicy-checker).

Closes-Bug: #1804073

Change-Id: I4684f479cefe9d58e474a56b233398172d93f77c
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>

Drop devstack-platform-opensuse-tumbleweed

Builds of opensuse-tumbleweed nodes are currently failing, so these jobs
are receiving NODE_FAILURE.

commit_message:
Restructure the vpnaas roles

As neutron-vpnaas-agent has been loaded just inside of the existing l3 agent
rather than requiring operators to run a completely different binary with a
subclass of the existing L3 agent[1]. We need restructure this role to fit
with this new feature.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/488247

Depends-On: I47cd8ba5a14da3c76d5b1eb0b4c0cf0c729eb2ff
Implements: blueprint restructure-neutron-vpnaas
Closes-Bug: #1731498

Change-Id: I8f56f843505daf3a5cc066c06cca2abafbcd242c
(cherry picked from commit Id690a652bc9facf1c3e39358f548ab7ddd967d80)

commit_message:
Fix incorrect syntax in scripts/check_rabbitmq.py

* This fixes the incorrect syntax in the scripts/check_rabbitmq.py
  file.  Unfortunately, there are no tests for these files.  To
  help with QA, added the 'scripts' directory to the pep8 test to
  validate that they are correct python syntax for future changes.

* Updated .gitigore to exclude __pycache__ directories for py3 and
  removed the __pycache__ directory files from the repo.


Related-Bug: #1804126
(cherry picked from commit f30b4ac0c696f5bb344db592919c75bb71e96b34)

Change-Id: Idbe071df8d66cd0a4a977f9add7392215cfa2bf0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 11:03:40.000000000', 'message': "Modify the network to ensure their more restrictive

The network rules used to be too broad and could result in conflict when
address space is more restricted. This change updates the network rule
set such that it will not only add address to a macvlan interface using
the `noprefixroute` option and setting the route to the local table
only. This limits the macvlan network scope to ensure we're not creating
conflicts while also not breaking inter host connectivity.

Change-Id: I9b27a006a5587150254b35288d8907ae32651b57
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4f0837931baa073d750064e7e221aeb3089dbda2)
"}]
commit_message:
Modify the network to ensure their more restrictive

The network rules used to be too broad and could result in conflict when
address space is more restricted. This change updates the network rule
set such that it will not only add address to a macvlan interface using
the `noprefixroute` option and setting the route to the local table
only. This limits the macvlan network scope to ensure we're not creating
conflicts while also not breaking inter host connectivity.

Change-Id: I9b27a006a5587150254b35288d8907ae32651b57
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4f0837931baa073d750064e7e221aeb3089dbda2)

[{'created': '2018-11-19 21:45:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix curly brackets for ntp::servers: to prevent HTML escaping

According to MUSTACHE(5) documentation to prevent HTML escaping
value should be in triple curly brackets {{{ }}}. This change
adds missing brackets around ntp::servers: which resulted
improper values to be in hieradata.

Change-Id: Ia3f1343704a660a28ba4e48513eb2983849e87c3
Closes-Bug: #1794501
'}]
commit_message:
Fix curly brackets for ntp::servers: to prevent HTML escaping

According to MUSTACHE(5) documentation to prevent HTML escaping
value should be in triple curly brackets {{{ }}}. This change
adds missing brackets around ntp::servers: which resulted
improper values to be in hieradata.

Change-Id: Ia3f1343704a660a28ba4e48513eb2983849e87c3
Closes-Bug: #1794501

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

[{'created': '2018-11-05 01:54:39.000000000', 'message': 'Added [key_pairs]/fingerprint_algorithm options

This is one of the issues found when deploying Red Hat OpenStack 10 and 13 (Newton and Queens respectively) on "FIPS mode" systems (those with fips=1 kernel flag). MD5 is, for the most part, not allowed with FIPS 140-2 solutions so this patch gives users the option to change the SSH key pair fingerprint hash algorithm between md5, sha1, and sha256.

Change-Id: I406299a20a46e126737fb6a5560d7ebacb82d9ee
'}, {'created': '2018-11-05 01:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'Added [key_pairs]/fingerprint_algorithm options

This is one of the issues found when deploying Red Hat OpenStack 10 and
13 (Newton and Queens respectively) on "FIPS mode" systems (those with
fips=1 kernel flag). MD5 is, for the most part, not allowed with
FIPS 140-2 solutions so this patch gives users the option to change the
SSH key pair fingerprint hash algorithm between md5, sha1, and sha256.

Change-Id: I406299a20a46e126737fb6a5560d7ebacb82d9ee
'}]
commit_message:
Added [key_pairs]/fingerprint_algorithm options

This is one of the issues found when deploying Red Hat OpenStack 10 and
13 (Newton and Queens respectively) on "FIPS mode" systems (those with
fips=1 kernel flag). MD5 is, for the most part, not allowed with
FIPS 140-2 solutions so this patch gives users the option to change the
SSH key pair fingerprint hash algorithm between md5, sha1, and sha256.

Change-Id: I406299a20a46e126737fb6a5560d7ebacb82d9ee

commit_message:
Add libpython2.7 as a required package

Nova requires this package at runtime and currently assumes
that it is present in the environment. This patch ensures that
assumption is correct.

Change-Id: Ic74ffffb0e3f06ed1392d4006f1a511f66b4a30b

commit_message:
[LVM][IPv6] Quagga changes to support Bionic Beaver

Pre-create config and log directories and
update Quagga service configuration.

This patch does not add Bionic support to the gate
jobs. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608761/ does
the job configuration changes to run with Bionic.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608761/
Change-Id: I146ab5a41c06df2b2615ebdb38aaeb972db4c1d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 16:01:29.000000000', 'message': "Use a shorter default domain name

Some of the CI jobs use very long <hostname>'s,
resulting in the FQDN to be more than 63 characters
long which is the max for linux, see GETHOSTNAME(2).

Change the default to use: <hostname>.ooo.test instead.

Related-Bug: #1803703
Change-Id: Ia8f758a094d36c3f3bec383f1d3a8e1a5d4bd052
"}]
commit_message:
Use a shorter default domain name

Some of the CI jobs use very long <hostname>'s,
resulting in the FQDN to be more than 63 characters
long which is the max for linux, see GETHOSTNAME(2).

Change the default to use: <hostname>.ooo.test instead.

Related-Bug: #1803703
Change-Id: Ia8f758a094d36c3f3bec383f1d3a8e1a5d4bd052

subject: Add bootparams service for all roles

[{'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2018-11-14 12:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-11-14 12:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-14 16:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You need to rerun the genconfig task to rebuild the roles_data.yaml (to fix pep8)'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2018-11-15 04:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-15 16:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Does the Networker role need this as well? Which service uses the nic partitioning bits? If it's the neutron agents then the Networker role would need an update as well."}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2018-11-16 08:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Truly speaking, NIC Partitioning feature is applicable to any role which has at least 1 network.
    - External
    - InternalApi
    - Storage
    - StorageMgmt
    - Tenant
Backward compatibility would be retained when {role}KernelArgs is not defined for the role. So I think its best we add the boot params service for all the roles.'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2018-11-16 11:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2018-11-16 17:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2018-11-19 04:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-11-19 08:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2018-11-19 10:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-11-19 12:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-19 15:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-19 19:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

[{'created': '2018-11-14 12:48:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add bootparams service for Controller roles

NIC partitioning requires IOMMU to be enabled on roles using it.
By adding the BootParams service to controller role, we could
enable IOMMU selectively by supplying the role specific parameter
"KernelArgs". If controller doesn't use NIC Partitioning then
"KernelArgs" shall be not be set and backward compatibility would
be retained.

commit_message:
Add bootparams service for all roles

NIC partitioning requires IOMMU to be enabled on roles using it.
By adding the BootParams service to all the roles, we could
enable IOMMU selectively by supplying the role specific parameter
"KernelArgs". If a role doesn't use NIC Partitioning then
"KernelArgs" shall be not be set and backward compatibility would
be retained.

Change-Id: I2eb078d9860d9a46d6bffd0fe2f799298538bf73

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 13:48:02.000000000', 'message': "ceph: allow curl tasks to run in dry run mode

When running dry-run, --check option is used with Ansible CLI which
means the shell command don't actually run so the curl isn't producting
any change. This patch fixes the tasks that relied on the curl outputs
to only run these tasks when the curl changed and produced something.

Change-Id: I5b722ac111db0a1b6272a95496251107e23dd764
Closes-Bug: #1803986
"}, {'created': '2018-11-19 14:40:08.000000000', 'message': "ceph: allow curl tasks to run in dry run mode

means the shell command don't actually run so the curl isn't producting

to only run these tasks when the curl changed and produced something.

Change-Id: I5b722ac111db0a1b6272a95496251107e23dd764
Closes-Bug: #1803986

commit_message:
ceph: allow curl tasks to run in dry run mode

When running dry-run, --check option is used with Ansible CLI which
means the shell command don't actually run so the curl isn't producting
any change. This patch fixes the tasks that relied on the curl outputs
to only run these tasks when the curl changed and produced something.

Change-Id: I5b722ac111db0a1b6272a95496251107e23dd764
Closes-Bug: #1803986

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-16 13:33:58.000000000', 'message': "Omit grep process in nova_api healthcheck.

Currently, the nova_api healthcheck uses the output
from the ps -ef command passing it to grep looking
for the nova_metadata process. However, the way it's
done currently would print out the grep commmand itself
which would cause a false negative.

 ()[root@undercloud-0 /]# ps -ef | grep nova-metadata
 root       10979    8969  0 10:53 ?        00:00:00
 grep --color=auto nova-metadata

This patch uses pgrep intead, which does not create a
grep process that could match the string, plus it
provides a clearer idea on what we are trying to match.

Change-Id: Id493b3d0088e44c831b138b4526681694481d0eb
Closes-Bug: #1801365
(cherry picked from commit de6f82008dfa3f1f0eb222dbd6152fc80c378c4f)
"}]
commit_message:
Omit grep process in nova_api healthcheck.

Currently, the nova_api healthcheck uses the output
from the ps -ef command passing it to grep looking
for the nova_metadata process. However, the way it's
done currently would print out the grep commmand itself
which would cause a false negative.

 ()[root@undercloud-0 /]# ps -ef | grep nova-metadata
 root       10979    8969  0 10:53 ?        00:00:00
 grep --color=auto nova-metadata

This patch uses pgrep intead, which does not create a
grep process that could match the string, plus it
provides a clearer idea on what we are trying to match.

Change-Id: Id493b3d0088e44c831b138b4526681694481d0eb
Closes-Bug: #1801365
(cherry picked from commit de6f82008dfa3f1f0eb222dbd6152fc80c378c4f)

commit_message:
Exit when container is missing or empty when downloading logs

The workflow should exit early if the logging container isn't present or
is empty.  In that case, there aren't any logs to hand back to the
client so we're going to tell them that and fail.

Change-Id: I10747b593f8c5d4c81ae737e8bd279f8b312559c
Partial-Bug: 1803724

subject: Set SSH server keep alive options
messages:
[{'account_id': 11444, 'date': '2018-11-15 10:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11444, 'date': '2018-11-15 10:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We see exactly the same problem on N -> Q upgrade.
In our case it happens on Mellanox SRIOV NIC which has 255 virtual functions so it takes long time to put that interface through down/up cycle when /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/55-heat-config runs.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-11-15 10:29:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-19 20:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10857, 'date': '2018-11-19 20:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-15 10:04:02.000000000', 'message': "Set SSH server keep alive options

When os-net-config configures the network configuration on the overcloud nodes
ssh connections can be dropped.

Since we have ssh retries set to 8 in ansible.cfg, ansible would retry the task
since it was failed by a ssh connection error.

However, the first task was actually still running and it eventually succeeds.

The second task that was kicked off by ansible as a retry, sees that the
deployment is already applied, but the notification file (*.notify.json) does
not yet exist since the first task is still in progress. This causes the second
task to fail with the error reported in the bug and the whole ansible-playbook
run to then fail.

Setting ServerAliveInterval and ServerAliveCountMax ssh options seems to fix
the issue as ssh doesn't drop the first connection when these are configured.

Change-Id: I08781fe2aa6472d3fae5c5f5d0babd1f7a3b9b2d
Closes-Bug: #1792343
(cherry picked from commit c0f41cae9f672c21f05fa7b0cfbfeb66d1cfe296)
"}]
commit_message:
Set SSH server keep alive options

When os-net-config configures the network configuration on the overcloud nodes
ssh connections can be dropped.

Since we have ssh retries set to 8 in ansible.cfg, ansible would retry the task
since it was failed by a ssh connection error.

However, the first task was actually still running and it eventually succeeds.

The second task that was kicked off by ansible as a retry, sees that the
deployment is already applied, but the notification file (*.notify.json) does
not yet exist since the first task is still in progress. This causes the second
task to fail with the error reported in the bug and the whole ansible-playbook
run to then fail.

Setting ServerAliveInterval and ServerAliveCountMax ssh options seems to fix
the issue as ssh doesn't drop the first connection when these are configured.

Change-Id: I08781fe2aa6472d3fae5c5f5d0babd1f7a3b9b2d
Closes-Bug: #1792343
(cherry picked from commit c0f41cae9f672c21f05fa7b0cfbfeb66d1cfe296)

commit_message:
Select message IDs properly when publishing to swift

Zaqar messages used to have their IDs under the "_id" key.  This has
been changed to "id".  We're updating the select() call to reflect that.

Change-Id: I2bf66ece33306178c36b51f82c9d16663743d660
Partial-Bug: 1803724

commit_message:
Don't print None on plan delete

When successfully deleting a plan, we print a useless "None" on the CLI.
Let's skip it.

commit_message:
NeutronBindNetworkPlugin: fix multi segment neutron data save.

Neutron subnet data can be obtained directly and is needed to get
ip_version for port creation. Network data needs to wait for port
binding.
Fixes 2b40e5618f2c1039bbbbd1a3e31b72e104b5436b error:
"Can not find any IP address with configured IP version None in
share-network".

Closes-Bug: #1747695
Change-Id: Ie6c8a26db5c461400b789f91a97eb7ccc1031a0f

commit_message:
Extend DeployedServerPortMap to include network props

In I68e064d23ec5d43f59146d974cae604d2c5fdb52 we start
using the 'tags' of the ctlplane network via get_attr
on the ControlVirtualIP resource.

The undercloud need to extend it's DeployedServerPortMap
to provide the network tags.

Related: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: Ia8e219b30d4f8b199b882e95fe2834252a92c15a

commit_message:
Configure cloudkitty-api to use uwsgi

Accoring to the cloudkitty docs it is strongly recommended to
install the API server in a WSGI host such as mod_wsgi.

The tasks are a combination of os_cinder steps and the cloudkitty
docs for wsgi:
https://docs.openstack.org/cloudkitty/latest/install/mod_wsgi.html#mod-wsgi

Change-Id: I4173a32f4989f7e23205083738ccd81f7ea6f9f6
Closes-Bug: 1769632

commit_message:
Improve metric error handling

flush() should not produce a metric if value is None (causes
exception in monasca-api).
Fix the exception message in flush() to use the correct data
structure.

Change-Id: I62d31270db9e70f16d2a38a73856009c52c098e6
Story: 2004276
Task: 27825

commit_message:
oslo.service 1.31.6

We noticed high CPU usage in Rocky, it's caused by
inefficient code in oslo.service causing many useless system calls:
change: I62e9f1a7cde8846be368fbec58b8e0825ce02079

$ git log --no-merges 1.31.5.. --online
6566ec5 Use eventlet Event for loopingcall events
6a7d05d Fix stop of loopingcall
23dc8c0 Stop asserting on Eventlet internals

Change-Id: I1f0c4856e939bfa76e90542efc5091a4a9baa9a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 11:03:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add host only network option

The host only network function was adding a global network address and a
host only network address which would flip flop should networkd or the
nspawn-macvlan service be restarted. This change makes resolves the flip
flopping and adds an option to enable this functionality when required.

Change-Id: Ia856723580d345d01e0df06ac41adb9cb7fcdb24
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e873bda7d62ca3582226cdcfad6fe39add05f574)
'}]
commit_message:
Add host only network option

The host only network function was adding a global network address and a
host only network address which would flip flop should networkd or the
nspawn-macvlan service be restarted. This change makes resolves the flip
flopping and adds an option to enable this functionality when required.

Change-Id: Ia856723580d345d01e0df06ac41adb9cb7fcdb24
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e873bda7d62ca3582226cdcfad6fe39add05f574)
