  validate that they are correct python syntax for future changes.

Closes-Bug: #1804126

commit_message:
Fix incorrect syntax in scripts/check_rabbitmq.py

* This fixes the incorrect syntax in the scripts/check_rabbitmq.py
  file.  Unfortunately, there are no tests for these files.  To
  help with QA, added the 'scripts' directory to the pep8 test to
  validate that they are correct python syntax for future changes.

* Updated .gitigore to exclude __pycache__ directories for py3 and
  removed the __pycache__ directory files from the repo.

Change-Id: I406a70c3d04eb730e1c59189a83cc57495186105
Closes-Bug: #1804126

commit_message:
add the assertWorkflowErrors

some of the action pages use workflow,
but the check is using assertFormErrors,
which is unreasonable,
assertFormErrors only checks one step, not all

Change-Id: I764be4a243fb9c4790c195610514663d71e18373

commit_message:
Add networking-ovn job to Neutron's check pipeline

According with the ML thread [0] it was decided during the PTG in
Denver that Stadium projects are now allowed to add a non-voting job to
Neutron's check pipeling.

This patch is then adding a tempest job for the networking-ovn project.

[0]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135273.html

Depends-On: I49a644631365465ba4fbe2ca864dfa3d018c4b56
Change-Id: I4b7e7677b0f161048b7350cd491aba9e72d6b1d0
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove Linux apps pinning from Dockerfile

Alpine repositories remove older version of packages really fast and
stop images from building.

Change-Id: I80011d19204117d0ce7d8fe7d847432cd31ce99c

subject: Dont disable services that are not enabled
messages:
[{'account_id': 27532, 'date': '2018-10-30 17:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27532, 'date': '2018-10-31 10:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-11-04 14:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 27532, 'date': '2018-11-14 10:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Michel, whats missing for the workflow +1?'}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-11-14 16:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27532, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 17:25:30.000000000', 'message': "Dont disable services that are not enabled

Both neutron lib functions is_neutron_enabled and
is_neutron_legacy_enabled check for disabled services. If a particular
service is disabled, it will be assumed that the component that service
is part of is enabled. For example, if any 'neutron-*' service is
disabled, devstack will assume that neutron (non-legacy) is enabled.

This patch changes to disable services only if they wrere previously
enabled to avoid any assumption based on disabled services that were
never enabled on the first place.

Change-Id: If29ccbc5a7d80ad046ece26d822a6f55aa73f0b7
"}, {'created': '2018-10-31 10:56:29.000000000', 'message': "Dont disable services that are not enabled

Both neutron lib functions is_neutron_enabled and
is_neutron_legacy_enabled check for disabled services. If a particular
service is disabled, it will be assumed that the component that service
is part of is enabled. For example, if any 'neutron-*' service is
disabled, devstack will assume that neutron (non-legacy) is enabled.

This patch changes to disable services only if they wrere previously
enabled to avoid any assumption based on disabled services that were
never enabled on the first place.

Change-Id: If29ccbc5a7d80ad046ece26d822a6f55aa73f0b7
"}]
commit_message:
Dont disable services that are not enabled

Both neutron lib functions is_neutron_enabled and
is_neutron_legacy_enabled check for disabled services. If a particular
service is disabled, it will be assumed that the component that service
is part of is enabled. For example, if any 'neutron-*' service is
disabled, devstack will assume that neutron (non-legacy) is enabled.

This patch changes to disable services only if they wrere previously
enabled to avoid any assumption based on disabled services that were
never enabled on the first place.

Change-Id: If29ccbc5a7d80ad046ece26d822a6f55aa73f0b7

commit_message:
Nix refs to ResourceProvider obj from libvirt UT

Since we're extracting placement, we shouldn't be referring to artifacts
in placement namespaces anymore. This patch removes such a reference
from the libvirt driver unit tests.

Change-Id: Idc0c2a0c0f885a21dff412bea761bac82a029eb5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 07:32:03.000000000', 'message': "Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: I83394d79280c3e22469551f17356d057a26230c4
"}]
commit_message:
Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: I83394d79280c3e22469551f17356d057a26230c4

This bug has been reported by a customer to iLO drivers team as iLO drivers creates all the ports by default. As inband has the facility to create only active ports, even out-of-band inspection should have that capability. Since the inspection mechanism differs between inband and out-of-band, we cannot have the same mechanism of creating active ports for both inband and out-of-band.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-12-02 06:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-12-02 06:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-12-02 06:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17: Patch Set 16 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2016-12-02 06:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

I think the need behind this has actually been addressed by making ports pxe aware (via pxe_enabled).  I think storage specific networking ports, regardless of the carrier, that are represented as ethernet, should be explicitly reported as part of inspection.'}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2017-01-05 23:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

I think I agree with Julia here. As I see it another way this could be handled would be to have an inspector rule to handle port creation / removal.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-01-06 05:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

@Julia, @Chris : A suggestion...
As I understand pxe_enabled is a attribute in ironic port.  
This patch can be changed such a way that inspection creates the ironic ports for all the NICs discovered and set 'pxe_enabled' to 'True' only for the ports that are specified in 'driver_info/inspect_ports' . WDYT?"}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2017-01-06 23:07:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

Shivananda: i am having a hard time with inspect_port, this would require that the operator basically know the ethernet port numbers before inspection the system. In many environments I have worked in the first contact a operator has is after the node has been rack'd and stack'd in the datacenter and inspection is run via the node not found hook."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-01-06 23:23:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

I agree with Chris.  The burden to the operator is significant if the expectation is that they create nodes already knowing the mac addresses.  The entire purpose of inspection is to ease the burden of an operator.  The workflow is that inspection should be capable of adding additional information about the node into ironic.  To meet your development use requirement, it seems an operator can just then disable the ports that they have knowledge of after inspection takes place.

If an operator is following the state machine, which they don't have much choice about unless they use an old API version, then the newly created node should be in enroll, and can be inspected before moved into active state to be scheduled upon."}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-01-06 23:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

@Chris, @Julia,

The operator does not need to know the mac addresses. It is just the physical slot number which is connected physically which we need to pass as input. In most of the cases in datacenter, the first MAC is uniformly connected physically. In such case user will just pass the inspect_port=[1] as the input.

I am not sure, but does this answer your concern?'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-01-07 00:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

The operator doesnt need to know the MAC addresses. In general in a datacenter one or two MACs are uniformly conected physically via cable for all the systems. The operator need to just pass the slot number which is physically connected. The iLO has the mapping of slot number and MAC addreses and we can just filter based on that.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-01-12 00:18:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

@Chris @Julia and others,

 We still think that the inspect_port option is required. The reason being : The OOB discovery has no mechanism to know which port is pxe-enabled/connected physically.
User has three approach to follow for above: a) He provides the connected port information manually, and then create ironic ports only for them. or b) Let ironic create all the ports and operator manually removes them. c) User provides the connected port info and ironci creates ports fr all and sets pxe_enabled flag for the ports given by user.
The point is that  it's easier for operator to figure out which ports are intended for Ironic use.  Once he/she provides this info to inspection api then everything else can be automated.  On the other hand, if an operator has to manaully delete extra ports after ironic creates all the ports, it's more cubersome and may not be automated."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-02-10 13:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-04-18 04:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Posting the new patch set with just rebasing. 
@Julia, you had agreed on discussion with @wanyen that you wont block this feature as OOB cannot know which port is enabled or disabled.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-04-18 05:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2017-04-18 05:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

'}, {'created': '2016-06-21 12:16:46.000000000', 'message': 'adding back the inspect_ports as an optional parameter

This reverts commit I37eb1dda649d4d21681555339c9ece8a18216f95
which introduced a bug 1588177. Which will add back the
inspect_ports as an optional parameter in ilo.
This is needed in following scenario:
If there are two NICs cabled but one is cabled with
fibre channel and another one is connected to ethernet,
then second one should be chosen for deploy as the
fibre channel NIC serves as the storage NIC and
cannot be used for deploy. We need a mechanism
for a user to specify which port he wants to inspect.
Even in-band inspection provide an option for user to
choose/specify if they want the port to be created for
all the NICs.

Closes-bug: 1588177

Change-Id: I6ef017cd0837a419beee2025b6e8232e685b58c5

'}, {'created': '2016-08-24 06:46:29.000000000', 'message': "Add 'inspect_ports' as a 'driver_info' parameter to iLO drivers

Some bare metals having two NICs are cabled such a way that
one is cabled with fibre channel and other one is connected
to ethernet. During provisioning only second NIC should be
used as fibre channel NIC serves as the storage NIC and
cannot be used for deploy.
There is no mechanism available to the user to specify the
NIC port that is to be used for provisioning. The Ironic
'inspection' creates ports for all the NICs being discovered.
The proposed parameter 'inspect_ports' in 'driver_info' would
help to address this issue. User can specify the list of NIC
ports for which Ironic should create ports.

NOTE: This change was proposed earlier and was reverted back
as part of commit I37eb1dda649d4d21681555339c9ece8a18216f95.
But this change is useful as it removes the manual step
required to remove unwanted ports upon inspection. This will
also make out-of-band inspection at parity with in-band
inspection. In-band inspection provides an option for user to
choose/specify the NIC ports for which Ironic ports should be
created.

Closes-bug: 1588177
Co-Authored-By: Nisha Agarwal <agarwalnisha1980@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6ef017cd0837a419beee2025b6e8232e685b58c5

"}, {'created': '2016-12-02 09:15:32.000000000', 'message': "Add 'inspect_ports' as a 'driver_info' parameter to iLO drivers

Some bare metals having two NICs are cabled such a way that
one is cabled with fibre channel and other one is connected
to ethernet. During provisioning only second NIC should be
used as fibre channel NIC serves as the storage NIC and
cannot be used for deploy.
There is no mechanism available to the user to specify the
NIC port that is to be used for provisioning. The Ironic
'inspection' creates ports for all the NICs being discovered.
The proposed parameter 'inspect_ports' in 'driver_info' would
help to address this issue. User can specify the list of NIC
ports for which Ironic should create ports.

NOTE: This change was proposed earlier and was reverted back
as part of commit I37eb1dda649d4d21681555339c9ece8a18216f95.
But this change is useful as it removes the manual step
required to remove unwanted ports upon inspection. This will
also make out-of-band inspection at parity with in-band
inspection. In-band inspection provides an option for user to
choose/specify the NIC ports for which Ironic ports should be
created.

Closes-bug: 1588177
Co-Authored-By: Nisha Agarwal <agarwalnisha1980@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shivanand Tendulker <stendulker@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6ef017cd0837a419beee2025b6e8232e685b58c5

commit_message:
Add 'inspect_ports' as a 'driver_info' parameter to iLO drivers

Some bare metals having two NICs are cabled such a way that
one is cabled with fibre channel and other one is connected
to ethernet. During provisioning only second NIC should be
used as fibre channel NIC serves as the storage NIC and
cannot be used for deploy.
There is no mechanism available to the user to specify the
NIC port that is to be used for provisioning. The Ironic
'inspection' creates ports for all the NICs being discovered.
The proposed parameter 'inspect_ports' in 'driver_info' would
help to address this issue. User can specify the list of NIC
ports for which Ironic should create ports.

NOTE: This change was proposed earlier and was reverted back
as part of commit I37eb1dda649d4d21681555339c9ece8a18216f95.
But this change is useful as it removes the manual step
required to remove unwanted ports upon inspection. This will
also make out-of-band inspection at parity with in-band
inspection. In-band inspection provides an option for user to
choose/specify the NIC ports for which Ironic ports should be
created.

Closes-bug: 1588177
Co-Authored-By: Nisha Agarwal <agarwalnisha1980@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shivanand Tendulker <stendulker@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ankit Kumar <ankit.dhn31@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6ef017cd0837a419beee2025b6e8232e685b58c5

[{'account_id': 24454, 'date': '2018-11-14 08:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-11-14 08:56:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The priority is not set yet, we woundn't expose that in the documentation.

I am objecting to this change, because I don't think it provides any help on the thing we will do in the future."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-14 09:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24454, 'date': '2018-11-14 09:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-11-14 09:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

My comment on PS1 still stands.'}, {'account_id': 13689, 'date': '2018-11-15 02:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24454, 'date': '2018-11-15 11:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24454, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-11-20 10:17:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ironic will not be planning the Train release until our next PTG. It is inappropriate to expose this in planning documentation prematurely because it sets the wrong expectation. If there is no reference to Train, then maybe we've not planned yet. But a blank page can be interpreted as we've been unable to plan or have no consensus. I believe this needs to be held off on until we are able to actually perform planning.

That being said, if there is a desire to begin planning sooner (which I think _may_ be possible), we should engage the community in a wider discussion."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-11-20 10:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

In addition to what Julia said, I think this kind of semi-automated changes to all repositories are overall undesired.'}, {'account_id': 24454, 'date': '2018-11-20 11:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use blacklist_file for skipping tests in Ubuntu/Debian

* --black-regex does not work on debian tempest package. So it is
  better to switch to blacklist_file for skipping tempest tests.
* Install tempest from source for Ubuntu.
* Fixed tempest binary for debian

Change-Id: Ifc80f48bfc626566193c8fb01b7daa3eed9c7a0e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 11:37:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix the undercloud-process-count validation

After containerization of several services the `pgrep` call which should return
the number of running processes doesn't work anymore (since it's executed
outside of the container where the service is running)

This patch executes the `pgrep` command inside of the appropriate container.

Note: The validation in its current form cannot make a judgement for a
realistic limit for any given situation. For that reason, this validation will
always succeed with warning(s).

Change-Id: I0cb33babae2fc285fff7fd6638c578b39e630338
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the undercloud-process-count validation

After containerization of several services the `pgrep` call which should return
the number of running processes doesn't work anymore (since it's executed
outside of the container where the service is running)

This patch executes the `pgrep` command inside of the appropriate container.

Note: The validation in its current form cannot make a judgement for a
realistic limit for any given situation. For that reason, this validation will
always succeed with warning(s).

Change-Id: I0cb33babae2fc285fff7fd6638c578b39e630338
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the introspection interface look up

The ironic-inspection firewall specific configuration options were moved from
the ``firewall`` to the ``iptables`` group. All options in the ``firewall``
group are now deprecated.

Moreover, this patch adds `changed_when: False` to commands that should not
change things if nothing needs doing [ANSIBLE0012].

Change-Id: I609a3e44a6b18487601b78cfbc12bbaa742ad78e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add missing variable for nspawn networking

The variable `interface` is not defined in the `if` part of the
conditional, however, it is referenced later on.

Change-Id: I86ed0daabe369b984bf534d3bcf471c73c7795ce
(cherry picked from commit f54f58f57f94b5ccf02d05651e5c268e4e7829b9)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin SbÃ¢rnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll ðŸ¥•'}, {'_account_id': 27898, 'name': 'Quique Llorente', 'email': 'ellorent@redhat.com', 'username': 'quiquell'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-12 14:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-12 14:14:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-12 15:39:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

paunch is a cli, so i don't think is this correct"}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-12 15:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

paunch is cli python tool which may install in locations outside current PATH. Thus is why we would be calling it using python in order to allow python to use it from its location (system, user, virtualenv).

If python can be called, the module should be callable. Obviously that we have to wait for the fix in paunch.

Feel tree to try: python -m (pip|tox|virtualenv|flake8|...) -- all cli python tools are supporsed to allow this, if not is just a bug caused by poor documention of this old python feature. -- they only need a __main__.py to make the magic work.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-12 16:16:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In this particular case I don't think we should be using the python interpreter to do this.  I'm not against making it available as such, but I don't think we should be doing this in the deployment. We expect paunch to be in $PATH or we have other issues."}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-11-13 06:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

We must use just paunch-3 as we have do with others, is this thing is designed to be used as a command.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-13 15:02:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't think paunch should be paunch-2/paunch-3 but we'll have to figure out that on packaging"}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-11-19 07:41:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

python3 paunch package install "paunch" command pointing to python3 this is future proof enough, and the issue was not produced by that, this is not needed.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-19 20:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-20 10:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No longer needed as we have right rpm now.'}]

commit_message:
move selinux-permissive configure to pre-install phase

install-packages is running before install.d phase, there is a chance
that installing a package like "container-selinux" will failed the
build, moving "selinux-permissive" to run at pre-install stage make
more sense.

Change-Id: I32f988be725d4b385c3765c47a00cd57c53d7d71

commit_message:
Ensure that the --template-file option is passed to the kolla builder

This patch ensures that the file path passed into the openstack
overcloud container prepare command using --template-file is correctly
passed through to the kolla_builder container image prepare function.

Change-Id: I5df6926e0b9417f746e47cce3ccb9218dfa13a80
Closes-Bug: #1791039
(cherry picked from commit b7419d5d2a3f0e221f38310c92006166a5d2fa19)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-12 13:33:17.000000000', 'message': 'Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

With layered product packaging upgrading openvswitch may involve a
package rename of the openvswitch package (e.g. openvswitch to
openvswitch 2.10 or openvswitch2.12 to openvswitch2.13) This patch
adds special handling for the rhosp-openvswitch layered product package
to ensure that openvswitch networking remains available during the
upgrade.

Note that this patch also moves the special upgrade logic to
tripleo-packages because it could affect any node that is running
openvswitch for host networking, not just those that are using it for
cloud workloads.

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
(cherry picked from commit 1773afb0689c8fded9bce2dff4c1f8d9406c8294)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

With layered product packaging upgrading openvswitch may involve a
package rename of the openvswitch package (e.g. openvswitch to
openvswitch 2.10 or openvswitch2.12 to openvswitch2.13) This patch
adds special handling for the rhosp-openvswitch layered product package
to ensure that openvswitch networking remains available during the
upgrade.

Note that this patch also moves the special upgrade logic to
tripleo-packages because it could affect any node that is running
openvswitch for host networking, not just those that are using it for
cloud workloads.

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
(cherry picked from commit 1773afb0689c8fded9bce2dff4c1f8d9406c8294)

When nova fails to successfuly start an amphora and we hit our
ComputeWaitTimeoutException, currently it's hard to see the compute
ID nova issued us. This patch includes it in the exception message
so we can track the ID back into the nova logs to see why nova
failed.

Change-Id: I3e89ac3aae526b8d705a408e7c0a9eaba6bca193
(cherry picked from commit fc7bbd7599b45df24439f2c3581fe894ec8b1eca)
"}]
commit_message:
Log the compute ID when nova fails

When nova fails to successfuly start an amphora and we hit our
ComputeWaitTimeoutException, currently it's hard to see the compute
ID nova issued us. This patch includes it in the exception message
so we can track the ID back into the nova logs to see why nova
failed.

Change-Id: I3e89ac3aae526b8d705a408e7c0a9eaba6bca193
(cherry picked from commit fc7bbd7599b45df24439f2c3581fe894ec8b1eca)

commit_message:
Change secret var in publish.yml job / fix collectd build

Disable EPEL for collectd images as a partial backport of
3af9151c5ac896f097e982c1786d9b04772e8b49

Currently epel have different version than opstools repo and causes
dependency conflicts.

Change-Id: I61e379fbdd0481faa226d316ab09847011e99c86

'}, {'created': '2018-11-08 15:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Correct handling of capabilities on node update

When updating nodes we do not convert capabilities from the supported
dict representation to internal string representation. This may result
in incorrect capabilities after an update. This patch fixes it.

Also enforce alphabetical order in capabilities to prevent them
from reordering on updates.

Change-Id: I098409e5ff63b3c3719563de8144fda5bf482bdf
Closes-Bug: #1802318

commit_message:
Correct handling of capabilities on node update

When updating nodes we do not convert capabilities from the supported
dict representation to internal string representation. This may result
in incorrect capabilities after an update. This patch fixes it.

Also enforce alphabetical order in capabilities to prevent them
from reordering on updates.

Change-Id: I098409e5ff63b3c3719563de8144fda5bf482bdf
Closes-Bug: #1802318

* HPMSA-iSCSI http://os-logs.tristero.net/hpmsa-ci/81/611081/3/HPMSA-iSCSI : SUCCESS in 1:17:15'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-18 12:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

The glanceclient returns None if it gets back a No Content response from the glance API, so Marc is correct, we need to anticipate this behavior.

BTW, that call in master glanceclient now uses the glance "multihash" for image data validation.  Won't really affect cinder except in the weird case where glance is configured to use a weird hashing algo that isn't available in the version of hashlib available in the cinder installation, then you'll get an ValueError ("unsupported hash type X").  (The default is sha512, which should always be available in hashlib.  The operator chooses the algo; the config help suggests using something from hashlib.algorithms_guaranteed, but anything in hashlib.algorithms_available will work in glance.)  This doesn't impact this patch in particular, I'm just mentioning it because I'm not sure it's been communicated to the cinder team.  (Maybe I need to bring it up at the cinder weekly meeting.)'}, {'account_id': 24496, 'date': '2018-10-21 08:17:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Build failed. To recheck use 'datacore: recheck'. For information about DataCore CI see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DataCore_CI

commit_message:
Handling unexpected python error "NoneType object is not iterable"

The glance documentation states that None (empty image) is a valid
return value. We have to handle this outcome. Adding error handling
helps debugging this unhandled issue

Change-Id: If7c22ac4516f8c2a6ccd8bf6b6ed98409312b138
Closes-Bug: #1798147

commit_message:
docs: Include information about the list of supported projects

This documentation is included in HACKING at the top to let
newcomers know that Tempest's testing scope is confined to the
following projects:

* Cinder
* Glance
* Keystone
* Neutron
* Nova
* Swift

The user is directed to [0] for additional Tempest plugin
repos where they can add their tests for other projects. Note
that [0] currently appears to not be rendering correctly,
but this is an unrelated issue.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/plugin-registry.html#detected-plugins

Change-Id: I800a3f6ac4c347d4322574f649cb052070127db6

commit_message:
Add blazar-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for blazar-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I6f40be87eb7e20fb396191e60af023923eb9019a
Story: 2003657
Task: 26121

commit_message:
Support custom monasca-notification templates

Jira, Slack and possiblly other plugins allow custom templates
for defining the format of notifications. This change lets you
provide these in a templates folder which is copied into the
monasca-notification container.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: Ibc5ba3944d51f6c8ffc8bdc9ed60f43dd91ca7e0

commit_message:
Use minimal Ubuntu cloud image

The currently used image has almost 300MB size, which leads to slow
instance startup. Use a minimal image instead that has only about 50% of
the size.

Change-Id: Ib9744a9be143891041e2280665aca569fdf43768

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 15:34:34.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ie86513569c5a25c2de5eca94e0479f03806a45fb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ie86513569c5a25c2de5eca94e0479f03806a45fb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use the stable/rocky branch for dependencies

After the cut of a bifrost stable branch, it is necessary to modify the
default branch used to install dependencies to stable/rocky. We also
use the rocky tinyipa ramdisk and kernel image artifacts.

Change-Id: I284ea5456e556ddbb7c14900b22e86313138f42e

[{'created': '2018-09-18 10:20:43.000000000', 'message': 'Provision to add new config options in sample config file

In Rocky we have added support for multiple backend as a EXPERIMENTAL
feature. However configuration options related to multiple backend
are not generated in sample config file due to some issue. We have
added below 2 new config options for multiple backend.

1. enabled_backneds (added in glance)
2. default_backend (added in glance_store)

Made provision to add all the above options to sample config
file.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603331/
Change-Id: Iff3db9fe31243e5b9610742c796fdca84c698bcf
Closes-Bug: #1793057
'}]
commit_message:
Provision to add new config options in sample config file

In Rocky we have added support for multiple backend as a EXPERIMENTAL
feature. However configuration options related to multiple backend
are not generated in sample config file due to some issue. We have
added below 2 new config options for multiple backend.

1. enabled_backneds (added in glance)
2. default_backend (added in glance_store)

Made provision to add all the above options to sample config
file.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603331/
Change-Id: Iff3db9fe31243e5b9610742c796fdca84c698bcf
Closes-Bug: #1793057

commit_message:
Bump placement API version

We can now pass request ids and consumer generation ids, which
can detect race conditions that affect allocation updates.

Change-Id: Idccf7aeeecc619871b27e16c68f0706c1514c63b

[{'created': '2018-03-20 22:54:29.000000000', 'message': "Add scope documentation for service developers

We have a document that attempts to help describe keystone concepts
to other OpenStack developers. Now that we've added system scope to
keystone, it makes sense to refresh this document and make it more
helpful for services.

This should help services consume various scopes to protect APIs at
various levels (project, domain, system, et cetera).

commit_message:
Add scope documentation for service developers

We have a document that attempts to help describe keystone concepts
to other OpenStack developers. Now that we've added system scope to
keystone, it makes sense to refresh this document and make it more
helpful for services.

This should help services consume various scopes to protect APIs at
various levels (project, domain, system, et cetera).

Change-Id: I1a92ed0b6bbba44d1050a857c3609d918bb25b86
Closes-Bug: 1757151

commit_message:
Update allocations for failed over instances

This change ensures that we're updating the allocations stored in
the placement service when handling instance failovers.

For proper scheduling, the placement service needs to have an
accurate view of the resource providers.

We're using the 1.12 (Queens) Placement API version, making this patch
easy to backport.

Change-Id: Ie155ab280609ccff310c82c68dcdcbe3c4fc7f95
Closes-Bug: #1800437

https://git.centos.org/blobdiff/rpms!syslinux.git/1e69ac78ccd5571027da253a99da5968028b1d5c/SPECS!syslinux.spec changed path from /tftpboot to /var/lib/tftpboot in syslinux centos package. commit_message:
Add some more services in scenario-py3

Add following services which are made compatible to
Fedora with listed patches:- ironic, heat, mistral, zaqar.

Also add transport_url to ironic-inspector config needed
by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584758/.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608268/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613510/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613717/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616889/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617223/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618678/
Change-Id: I6169c047eb107bfcf0dcf7c45f73d8c6e492ff39

commit_message:
Fix server query examples

The 'locked' query parameter is not supported
in the "List Servers Detailed" API.
So replace examples using the 'locked' query parameter
with examples using another query parameters.

Change-Id: Ibcea6147dd6716ad544e7ac5fa0df17f8c397a28
Closes-Bug: #1801904

commit_message:
Run tempest.api.identity tests as a basic test in all CI

* when all test_regex present in whitelist file and are also in
  blacklist file that time tempest does not have any tests to run
  which leads to exit error and resulted in failing the CI job.
* Adding a minimal test through regex will help to run some test
  for sanity.
* Identity tests are pretty straight forward.

Change-Id: Icdb9ad5b91de3e902b8b5d309ce13e3176c4a226
Closes-Bug:#1803547

commit_message:
Skip double word hacking test

Because of a change [1] in the tokenize package in the stdlib of
recent pythons, one of the tests for the hacking checks can fail.
This change skips the test on newer pythons and leaves a TODO
to fix it.

[1] see https://bugs.python.org/issue33899 and
    https://bugs.python.org/issue35107

Change-Id: I64744a8144fcf630eea609eb2b2d14974f4fd4bb
Related-Bug: #1804062

commit_message:
Fix rotate_fernet_keys workflow to not use heat deployment

We've disabled os-collect-config after config-download became
the default from rocky. However, this workflow is currently using
heat software deployment for deploy_ssh_key task. This changes to
use inventory generated by config-download and removes the
deploy_ssh_key task.

Also fixes swift_ring.v1.reblance to use the correct inventory.

Change-Id: Iab9d30e1b5b3008ef3130f64225b4f7fd4082214
Closes-Bug: #1803814

[{'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-05 16:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-05 16:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-05 16:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

forgot to remove underlines from config option'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2018-11-05 18:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-05 21:08:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I ran a test to try overriding this value using config-flags. In doing so, you end up with duplicate config lines (with different values). In this case, the lowest value will take precedence no matter what order they're in.

Since we're using '0' in the patch, it will always take effect. Another option would be to set it ornately high (80?) then setting it via config-flags would work.

We could also expose this as a config option itself.

A third option would be to leave it as is and require the template be manually edited by the user."}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2018-11-06 00:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I ran a test to try overriding this value using config-flags. In
 > doing so, you end up with duplicate config lines (with different
 > values). In this case, the lowest value will take precedence no
 > matter what order they're in.
 > 
 > Since we're using '0' in the patch, it will always take effect.


{% if mon -%}
# The following are user-provided options provided via the config-flags charm option.
# User-provided [mon] section config
{% for key in mon -%}
{{ key }} = {{ mon[key] }}
{% endfor %}
{% if "mon pg warn max object skew" not in mon %}
mon pg warn max object skew = 0
{% endif %}
{% else %}
mon pg warn max object skew = 0
{% endif %}

This is an ugly way to express it, but basically add some logic to check if "mon pg warn max object skew" is present in the "mon" dictionary.

 > Another option would be to set it ornately high (80?) then setting
 > it via config-flags would work.
 > 
 > We could also expose this as a config option itself.
 > 
 > A third option would be to leave it as is and require the template
 > be manually edited by the user.'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-06 16:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-11-07 09:24:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thank you for your work on this.  I'm noticing that the proposed fix and the essence of the bug are not in alignment.  The bug is asking for a configurable option, whereas the proposal disables the check in a hard-coded way."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-11-08 09:19:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Ryan, that's a fair point. The commit message should do a better job of explaining the rationale of why we doing it this way. The original bug was indeed raised to request that we allow this to be configurable but we decided on simply disabling the feature since it was essentially giving us false positives for newly deployed clouds. Having said that I suppose that once a cloud is deployed and loaded it might make sense to re-instate a value for this setting. The user *could* use config-flags for this but that's a bit murky so i suppose a config might actually be the better option.

Shane what do you think about have a config option something like 'disable-pg-max-object-skew' that defaults to False but if set to True will apply the =0 like you have currently? That way users that know they want to disable this can do so otherwise they get defaults and if that's no good they can always override with config-flags."}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-08 22:52:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-09 15:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-11-09 15:14:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-11-09 16:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add disable-pg-max-object-skew option

Openstack clouds that use ceph will typically start their life with
at least one pool (glance) loaded with a disproportionately high
amount of data/objects where other pools may remain empty. This can
trigger a HEALTH_WARN if mon_pg_warn_max_object_skew is exceeded
but that is actually a false positive.

Change-Id: I5a535dbb17db2149630d971d85ac311f14298b09
Closes-Bug: 1720374

messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-16 12:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-11-16 13:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario008-multinode-oooq-container seems to fail also in other jobs, and in fact it looks unrelated (the opendaylight repository is too slow)'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-11-17 14:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Job that checks these rules should be enabled in the same patch, otherwise it will be broken very soon.

Also need to check if it runs on requirements also - tripleo-upgrades, ha-utils, browbeat, etc. We need to exclude these repos from linting here.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-17 14:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is no need to run "pre-commit run -a" in a job because we are always running (via tox-openstack-liners) the bit faster alternative "pre-commit run "pre-commit run --source HEAD^ --origin HEAD".

The speed was not the real reason for doing this, in fact it was to make it possible to ever fix this change.

For this change to run the check and gate and be merged it takes ~24 hours and we almost never have 24h without any other merge made to the repository. This would make extreamly unlikely for this change to merge because by the time it does reach the 2nd run on of tox-opentack-linters inside the gate, the repository would have already being changed by someone else and the linting may fail.

The comment about check rules does not make sense because the additional rules were already enabled about two days ago, and this is why we had to rework most in-progress CRs. The new rules are already active.

Pre-commit never checks files that are not tracked by current git repository so we do not need  to add extra excludes. Do you have one case where this didn't happen? Can you share it?'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-11-19 10:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

discussed in IRC'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Docs will be added about newer code style soon, thanks sorin for working on it.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-11-19 15:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-11-19 18:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-11-16 12:43:58.000000000', 'message': 'Adapt code to newer code style (linters)

Makes those files conformant with current linting rules and avoids
linting errors when we need to toch them again.

Previous doing "pre-commit run -a" uncovered these errors, now is no
longer reporting any other errors.

Change-Id: Ie4cf229c8f11c2b55b323eac23c89483b26d3781
'}]
commit_message:
Adapt code to newer code style (linters)

Makes those files conformant with current linting rules and avoids
linting errors when we need to toch them again.

Previous doing "pre-commit run -a" uncovered these errors, now is no
longer reporting any other errors.

Change-Id: Ie4cf229c8f11c2b55b323eac23c89483b26d3781

subject: Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 03:17:49.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ie8221091ed7971b6bcaf390049410b7e6868eb5c
Story: #2004073
Task: #27462

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 12:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I88cbc53bc16860b266cefcf9aa8e0811e8af8ae9
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I88cbc53bc16860b266cefcf9aa8e0811e8af8ae9

Just a quick search shows IPWrapper being used in other stadium projects [0].  I really think it's a good opportunity to rehome this code into neutron-lib.

commit_message:
Implement ip_lib get_devices using pyroute2

IPWrapper.get_devices() now uses pyroute2 and priv_sep.

Related-Bug: #1492714
Change-Id: Idb847bf16fe8898735266d93d39430da1f5410f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-24 11:47:44.000000000', 'message': 'Make neutron-fullstack-python36 actually use python 3.6

We renamed the job in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591081/ but it
still internally used the -python35 target. Update it to python 3.6

Change-Id: I37c1cb42b3a94532e7b7fea21a929a39fe63f00b
'}, {'created': '2018-10-02 20:20:25.000000000', 'message': 'Make neutron-fullstack job run py3

In the Neutron CI meeting on 2018-10-02 [1] we decided on the proper
approach for fullstack testing of Neutron in Zuul.  The approach is:

1. There should be only one fullstack CI job, named "neutron-fullstack"
2. The neutron-fullstack job should invoke python3 in tox.ini
3. The configuration of the job should direct it to a nodeset where the
default version for python3 is py3.6 (ubuntu-bionic)

This change implements the agreed-upon approach.

Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I37c1cb42b3a94532e7b7fea21a929a39fe63f00b
'}, {'created': '2018-10-03 21:28:40.000000000', 'message': 'Make neutron-fullstack job run py3

commit_message:
Make neutron-fullstack job run py3

In the Neutron CI meeting on 2018-10-02 [1] we decided on the proper
approach for fullstack testing of Neutron in Zuul.  The approach is:

1. There should be only one fullstack CI job, named "neutron-fullstack"
2. The neutron-fullstack job should invoke python3 in tox.ini

This change implements the agreed-upon approach.
Switching the nodeset to newer OS will be handled in a separate step

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2018/neutron_ci.2018-10-02-16.00.html

Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I37c1cb42b3a94532e7b7fea21a929a39fe63f00b

[{'created': '2018-11-10 14:58:21.000000000', 'message': 'Import neutron.db.api module in common.utils

Patch [1] removed import of neutron.db.api module in
neutron.common.utils.
This cause some issues e.g. in networking-ovn projects because
listeners:

@event.listens_for(orm.session.Session, "persistent_to_deleted")
on _persistent_to_deleted() function [2] and

Closes-Bug: #1802369

'}]
commit_message:
Import neutron.db.api module in common.utils

Patch [1] removed import of neutron.db.api module in
neutron.common.utils.
This cause some issues e.g. in networking-ovn projects because
listeners:

@event.listens_for(orm.session.Session, "persistent_to_deleted")
on _persistent_to_deleted() function [2] and

@event.listens_for(model_base.BASEV2, "attribute_instrument", propagate=True)
on _listen_for_changes() function [3]

aren't created as they where before.

This patch adds import of this neutron.db.api module again just to
ensure that those listeners are created properly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614252/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/api.py#L110
[3] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/api.py#L134

Closes-Bug: #1802369

Change-Id: I3e427ee5c904c34115aaf1afa67e1109ea58d603

commit_message:
Set router_id if floating IP has port_forwardings

Set floating IP's router_id when it has port_forwardings
during the update API.

Co-Authored-By: chenguobin <chengb@chinatelecom.cn>

Closes-Bug: #1799135
Change-Id: Idb1a52b6f32bdb18d920bce2b891b4d73c557dfb

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idbe1bf1715033cb28e822043601e5e6630be387d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-15 19:04:04.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)

commit_message:
Move ARA install to end of bootstrap

setup_ara sets up the callback plugins variable
so as it is now, it gets unset during the role
retrieval.  This commit moves it to the end of
bootstrap so that the ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS
is set.

Change-Id: I46ceb2acf377e38b2dc31ffc4a82b7945f8dd4c5
(cherry picked from commit 93831a60915d899e00c0eaa00a1e8b5511de3e88)

commit_message:
ceph improvements: failure domains, root hierarchy ..etc

Added supported for SSD, HDD co-existtance
Support for failure domains based on setup
Support for root hierarchy for OSDs
Support for differeent pools for SSD/HDD/any device class
Support for multiple storage classes (SSD/HDD)
general as default storage class
rbd provisioners for HDD along with client key generator and cleaner

Change-Id: Ie59e26dbe63a6365c7f4296414843f486e6db67d
Story: #27999
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>
Signed-off-by: kranthi guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda9@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Move ARA install to end of bootstrap

setup_ara sets up the callback plugins variable
so as it is now, it gets unset during the role
retrieval.  This commit moves it to the end of
bootstrap so that the ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS
is set.

Change-Id: I46ceb2acf377e38b2dc31ffc4a82b7945f8dd4c5

rbd provisioners for HDD along with client key generator and cleaner

Change-Id: Ie2febc602bd4f09d131a88313e2028b7a4898a4b
Story: #27999
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ceph improvements: failure domains, root hierarchy ..etc

Added supported for SSD, HDD co-existtance
Support for failure domains based on setup
Support for root hierarchy for OSDs
Support for differeent pools for SSD/HDD/any device class
Support for multiple storage classes (SSD/HDD)
general as default storage class
rbd provisioners for HDD along with client key generator and cleaner

Change-Id: Ie2febc602bd4f09d131a88313e2028b7a4898a4b
Story: #27999
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>

[{'created': '2018-11-08 16:59:09.000000000', 'message': "fix DBResourceExtendFixture fixture

Commit e5afd0b9cbd5b60d477d19ebcfb7b1ba71aeb694 rehomed the
resource_extend db module into neutron-lib and included a testing
fixture. However the fixture submitted in that commit incorrectly
backed-up/restored the _DECORATED_EXTEND_METHODS rather than the
_resource_extend_functions as it should've. This patch fixes that
issue.

Change-Id: I6f313d8b03cbe985a2f231e99c4b6c0d1af7a8c4
"}, {'created': '2018-11-09 13:28:46.000000000', 'message': "fix DBResourceExtendFixture fixture

resource_extend db module into neutron-lib and included a testing
fixture. However the fixture submitted in that commit incorrectly
backed-up/restored the _DECORATED_EXTEND_METHODS rather than the
_resource_extend_functions as it should've. This patch fixes that
issue.

Change-Id: I6f313d8b03cbe985a2f231e99c4b6c0d1af7a8c4
"}]
commit_message:
fix DBResourceExtendFixture fixture

Commit e5afd0b9cbd5b60d477d19ebcfb7b1ba71aeb694 rehomed the
resource_extend db module into neutron-lib and included a testing
fixture. However the fixture submitted in that commit incorrectly
backed-up/restored the _DECORATED_EXTEND_METHODS rather than the
_resource_extend_functions as it should've. This patch fixes that
issue.

Change-Id: I6f313d8b03cbe985a2f231e99c4b6c0d1af7a8c4

[{'created': '2018-10-31 13:13:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove build-openstack-api-ref jobs

in .zuul.yaml because they are unnecessary.

commit_message:
Remove build-openstack-api-ref jobs

The api-ref-jobs has been added
since Ia4680f24d78af1260f2f0106a458b78a079c1287.
It includes build-openstack-api-ref jobs in check and gate.

So remove the build-openstack-api-ref job definitions
in .zuul.yaml because they are unnecessary.

Change-Id: I4b612fa87609240bd0a0f838163ee87c45a41a46

[{'created': '2018-10-16 02:17:38.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I69dfc2ef3d7a458e579fc82fb22a0d7867161d77
Story: #2004073
Task: #27453
"}]
commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I69dfc2ef3d7a458e579fc82fb22a0d7867161d77
Story: #2004073
Task: #27453

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ic00c2c05c082d54dcdcfa4fce5d20d7ef8eca179
Story: #2004073
Task: #27432
